description: -  42897  Description  Our company  At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most.  We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in  cultivating leaders  throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about leading from where you sit, join us.  The challenge  Adobe is looking for a Data Scientist who will be building the next generation of data driven products. As a Senior Scientist you will be involved of all aspects of the optimization and modeling process for Adobe's display media advertising platform. These include creating and reviewing high-level architectural changes, solving novel optimization and modeling problems, and mentoring others to improve their abilities to do the same. You will be hands-on, which means you will be writing code in python to implement many of these solutions and setting an example for the team in terms of your ability to produce production-quality software.  Ideal candidates will have a strong academic background as well as technical skills including applied statistics, machine learning, data mining, and software development. Familiarity working with large-scale datasets and big data techniques would be a plus.  What you’ll do  Develop predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems through leveraging advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques.  Develop and implement scalable and efficient modeling algorithms that can work with large-scale data in production systems  Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features.  What you need to succeed  PhD or MS degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Operations Research, Econometrics, or other related fields.  Deep understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining concepts, and a track record of solving problems with these methods.  Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java and C  Familiar with one or more machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as R, Matlab and scikit learn  Knowledge and experience of working with relational databases and SQL  Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability.  Excellent communication, relationship skills and a strong team player.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with big data techniques (such as Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark)  Knowledge of experimental design, ANOVA, statistical inference, and multivariate testing  Knowledge of numerical or combinatorial optimization  Making our technology accessible to all  We believe everyone should have equal access to technology and its benefits. To help achieve this, Adobe is focused on making software more accessible for everyone. When we hire for engineering, development and design roles, we look for the following accessibility skills:  Base knowledge of the W3C’s Web Content Accessibility Guidelines v2.0  Exposure to current tools used by people with disabilities (screen readers and other assistive technologies)  Experience with accessibility evaluation and validation software  Understanding of input and output modes used by people with disabilities  Familiarity with compliance requirements - state, Federal, international  Making our technology accessible to all  We believe everyone should have equal access to technology and its benefits. To help achieve this, Adobe is focused on making software more accessible for everyone. When we hire for engineering, development and design roles, we look for the following accessibility skills:  Base knowledge of the W3C’s Web Content Accessibility Guidelines v2.0  Exposure to current tools used by people with disabilities (screen readers and other assistive technologies)  Experience with accessibility evaluation and validation software  Understanding of input and output modes used by people with disabilities  Familiarity with compliance requirements - state, Federal, international  At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on  Best Companies lists  . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique  Check-In  approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.  If you’re looking to grow your career  , Adobe’s the place for you.  Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences through the  Adobe Life magazine  .  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  Job  Other  Primary Location  Americas-USW-San Jose (Headquarters)  Schedule  Full-time

description: Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization.   The internet is essential to growing the knowledge we have and sharing it with each other. And for many of us, it’s a huge part of our everyday lives. But most of the world does not have access to the internet. Internet.org is a Facebook-led initiative with the goal of bringing internet access and the benefits of connectivity to the two-thirds of the world that doesn‘t have them. Check out info.internet.org for examples of our projects and impact. We’re looking for data scientists to work on internet.org to help shape the future of bringing people online at Facebook. You will enjoy working with one of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products that impact on real people on a regular basis. The internet.org initiative tackles unique challenges within Facebook and Silicon Valley. Passion to serve and empathy for new internet users in developing countries will be required, and some travel should be expected. This position is located in our Menlo Park office.  Responsibilities Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products  Partner with Product, Engineering, and Mobile Operator Partnerships teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities  Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions and product launches  The Data Scientist Analytics role has work across the following four areas:  Product Operations Forecasting and setting product team goals  Designing and evaluating experiments  Monitoring key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics  Building and analyzing dashboards and reports  Building key data sets to empower operational and exploratory analysis  Evaluating and defining metrics  Exploratory Analysis Proposing what to build in the next roadmap  Understanding ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends  Identifying new levers to help move key metrics  Building models of user behaviors for analysis or to power production systems  Product Leadership Influencing product teams through presentation of data-based recommendations  Communicating state of business, experiment results, etc to product teams  Spreading best practices to analytics and product teams  Data Infrastructure Working in Hadoop and Hive primarily, sometimes MySQL, Oracle, and Vertica  Automating analyses and authoring pipelines via SQL and python based ETL framework  Requirements 2+ years experience doing quantitative analysis.  BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or other technical field. Advanced degrees preferred.  Experience in SQL or other programming languages.  Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)  Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance  Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner with product and leadership teams  Influence the overall strategy of the product  Basic understanding of of statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions)  Experience manipulating large data sets through statistical software (ex. R, SAS) or other methods  Experience with distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop) a plus.  Apply As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Facebook is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.  If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com or you may call us at 1+650-308-7837.

We use data to drive our products and our business, and to better serve our learners. description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We deliver over a billion hours of streaming per month of movies and TV shows to more than 60 million members globally. Our data-driven culture allows us to continuously innovate and provide the best experience for our members. We are at the forefront of using advanced mathematical models and algorithms on big data to personalize the experience that every member has, and our scientists and engineers are constantly looking for new ways to improve the state of the art. Netflix data science is a unique combination of big data, algorithms, and entertainment: where else do you get to work on big data and win fourteen Emmys (four for technical achievement) and a Golden Globe Award!   The Science and Algorithms team at Netflix is a talented group of researchers from various disciplines, who work on interesting problems from different parts of the company. This position is in the Streaming Science and Algorithms team that is actively working on ways to improve the streaming Quality of Experience (QoE) for our members using algorithms applied to big data. Problems we tackle are diverse and range from optimizing the streaming algorithms to working with the digital supply chain that goes all the way to the studios in Hollywood! The streaming QoE space is still nascent and as part of our team, you will have the opportunity to do groundbreaking applied research that will shape the industry. Check out the following posts to learn more about our approach and some of the problems we're working on:   Optimizing the Netflix Streaming Experience with Data Science   Turning Data into a Better Viewing Experience   Optimizing Content Quality Control at Netflix with Predictive Modeling   We are in need of a creative thinker with deep expertise in designing scalable algorithms using mathematical techniques. You will work with amazing colleagues, brainstorm new ideas, and develop algorithms to solve challenging problems that have a substantial impact on the product, business, and millions of our members around the globe.   Qualifications   PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field. 4+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact. Expertise in machine learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), predictive analytics, statistical modeling, and/or data mining algorithms. Must have knowledge/experience in some or all of the following: Multivariate Regression, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, Bagging, Boosting, Decision Trees, Lifetime Analysis, Clustering, Mathematical Optimization, and Stochastic Processes. Strong algorithmic thinking and independent research ability. Passion for learning and innovating new methodologies at the intersection of applied math/statistics/computer science. Proficient at translating unstructured business problems into an abstract mathematical framework. Ability to make intelligent approximations of mathematical models in order to make them practical and scalable. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to describe the logic and implications of a complex model to all types of business partners. High-energy self-starter with a passion for your work, attention to detail, and a positive attitude.   Technical Skills   Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R, SAS, and/or Weka. Above average capabilities with SQL.- Experience with distributed databases and query languages like Hive/Pig and/or general map reduce computing is a plus. Knowledge of common data structures and ability to write efficient code in at least one language is a plus (preferably Java, Python, or Perl).

description: Additional Location(s) or Information: Guadalajara, Mexico Job Category: Supply Chain Operations Level of Experience: Experienced - Non Manager  Requisition #: R1008167 Description: The Business Entity Cisco Supply Chain Operations is committed to achieving intimacy with our customers and channel partners on a global basis.  The Team The Customer Excellence Data Scientist will be responsible for developing the tools and analytics capabilities required to provide customer insight that will drive Supply Chain’s efforts to increase Customer and Partner Satisfaction. This role is responsible for the development and continuous improvement of Cisco’s customer understanding using multiple tools including text based analytics tools, and data visualization tools. This is a high profile position that has direct impact to the customer experience, and supply chain operations.  Role & Responsibilities  Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze multi-unstructured, diverse “big data” and traditional enterprise data sources to generate actionable insights, predictive models and solutions for customer insight Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources Performs feasibility studies to identify meaningful insights from data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to business managers Drives better decision making and business values through obtaining predictive and actionable insight Supports critical business requirements by creating sophisticated methods of mining data for patterns and leverage predictive analytics model that can be turned into business values  Minimum Qualifications  Ability to convert a Business Problem into Analytical problem and providing Analytical Solutions Data Visualization: Effective communication of data through visual means through proper techniques Data Analytics: Ability to conduct unstructured analysis of both small and large data to discover areas of interest for problem analysis and recommendation based on the results Predictive Analytics: The ability to construct Markov chains into self learning Neural networks in order to predict likely future performance outcomes, as correlated to current expectations Analytical Modeling: Building the equivalent of computer programs, taking either real or generated data to solve analytical problems Functional: The ability to lay common sense and actual business wisdom over the top of the resulting analyses specific to the business function to guide the recommendation Communication: Excellent communication and collaboration skills; the ability to distill complexity and present and explain the data and insights in simple and easy-to-understand business terms  Desired Skills  Experience with Text analytics software  About Cisco The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.  Watch Video To Learn More About Cisco  Customer Satisfaction, Data Scientist, Business Intelligence, Predictive analytics, Text Analytics, Supply Chain Job Type: Experienced Opportunity Category: *None

description: We believe work is not a place, but rather a thing you do. Our technology revolves around this core philosophy. We are relentlessly committed to helping people work and play from anywhere, on any device. Innovation, creativity and a passion for ever-improving performance drive our company and our people forward. We empower the original mobile device: YOU!   Location:   Santa Clara   Requisition:   R2283 Data Scientist (Open)   Job Posting Title:   Data Scientist   Job Description:   Do you love getting your hands dirty with messy data, and devising ways to make it behave? Do you take delight in mastering the tools and techniques of data science, honing your ability to uncover elusive insights lurking in data? Do you have an open and inquisitive mind about the world around you, and feel passionate about weaving evidence-driven stories that inspire others to work smarter and live better?   If so, come join kindred spirits. The Data Science team at Citrix continually seeks more powerful and effective ways to supercharge how we organize, connect, and transform diverse data into actionable intelligence. Our successes enable our business stakeholders and collaborators to make smarter operational decisions, and innovate in ways that deliver greater value to our customers.   Since we are a geographically dispersed team, this position can be based in either Santa Clara, Santa Barbara or Fort Lauderdale.   As a member of the Data Science team, you will have an opportunity to:  Help identify areas where we can do more with data, then work iteratively with the team and business stakeholders to create and refine valuable new data products, insights, and capabilities. Connect with internal partners to learn about relevant business processes, data, and analytics needs. Share findings, learnings, and other deliverables both inside and outside the team. Serve as a contributor and active participant in the broader community of data enthusiasts across Citrix. Responsibilities Wrangle, interpret, and integrate data from diverse internal and external sources and systems using appropriate client libraries and APIs Apply and evaluate statistical models and machine learning algorithms to help answer business questions and solve business problems Dig beneath the surface to unearth data-driven, consumable insights that help to bust myths, reinforce strategies, or suggest new opportunities for the business Create data visualizations and stories that convey key insights to business audiences in an impactful manner, while also seeking innovative solutions for sharing knowledge more widely across the organization As needed, collaborate within and across teams to improve the ways in which key data streams are captured, managed, and made accessible for analysis Qualifications and Requirements 1-3+ years of practical experience with data wrangling, analysis, and visualization Proficiency in R, or transferable expertise in other languages and/or scripted analytical environments Broad understanding of the fundamentals of statistics and learning theory, including concepts related to significance, uncertainty, randomization, prediction, training/testing, and overfitting Experience choosing and applying appropriate statistical models and/or machine learning algorithms for the purposes of better understanding a target system, predicting outcomes, and/or prescribing interventions Domain experience in business preferred, such as sales or marketing analytics Comfort working in Linux or other Unix-like command-line environments preferred Ability to learn and assimilate new approaches quickly in order to solve novel problems Collaborative, open work style with strong inclination toward shared learning and knowledge exchange Strong writing/speaking skills, including comfort communicating to less technical audiences  *LI-AG1   Functional Area:   Database Administration   About us:   Citrix is a cloud company that enables mobile workstyles. We create a continuum between work and life by allowing people to work whenever, wherever, and however they choose. Flexibility and collaboration is what we’re all about. The Perks: We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. You’ll enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us.   If this is an evergreen requisition, by applying you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.

description: The Organization Danaher is a global science and technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life around the world. Our family of world class brands have unparalleled leadership positions in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including health care, environmental and communications. We are a globally diverse team of above 65,000 associates united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our ultimate competitive advantage. In 2015, we generated over $20 billion in revenue and our market capitalization exceeded $60 billion. We are ranked #147 on the Fortune 500 and, during the past 20 years, our stock has outperformed the S&P; 500 Index by nearly 2,800 percent.Launching in 2014, Danaher Labs is a new innovation center bringing together the leading subject matter experts, technologists and engineers for the common purpose of accelerating development and commercialization of Disruptive Computing solutions into the marketplace. Located in Silicon Valley, the heart of global innovation, Danaher Labs is ideally situated to capitalize on the digital mega trends transforming our world, including cloud infrastructure, big data analytics and mobile applications.Position Summary Danaher Labs is seeking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about data and focused on analyzing and presenting next generation machine data. Reporting to a leader in Data Science, the successful candidate will join a small and highly skilled team charged with establishing Danaher Labs in the Bay Area. The Data Scientist will function as a hands-on leader of high visibility efforts across Danaher operating companies (OpCos). Cross-organizational leadership is vital, as he or she will work with business partners in Danaher OpCos to understand the business objectives and drive innovative solutions that efficiently meet the needs of the business.This position will be responsible for analyzing and building sophisticated predictive models mostly backed by machine data produced by sensors, products and devices (refer to “Internet of Things” in Wikipedia). As a side responsibility, this position will help educate Danaher associates in terms of how to generate data driven insights and utilize data science techniques towards effective business decision making processes.Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:Understand variety of business questions and describe those in the form of analytics/data science problem statement.Accomplish initial selection of data sources, drive analytical thinking and design of appropriate mathematical approaches.Acquire, clean, and structure data from multiple sources.Build predictive models including both classification, regression, time-series analysis, and perform statistical analysis to provide business insight.Lead temporary data science staff including but not limited to contractors and interns.Provide training, leadership and oversight across Danaher where needed.REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: Education - PhD degree in engineering, business, statistics, fundamental science or relevant quantitative disciplines. MS holders with substantial and multiple year work experience as “Data Scientist” will be considered too.Experience – At least 1 year of full-time work experience as “Data Science” is a strict requirement .Technical Skills :Fluency in at least 2 of following data science tools: SQL, python, R, Hadoop.Experience and thorough knowledge of mathematical mechanism/derivation of at least 3 of the following algorithms: Logistic Regression, Neural Networks, Survival Analysis, Bayesian Networks, Naïve Bayes Nets, Linear Regression, Random Forest, Decision/Regression Trees, Time-series Analysis, SVM, LASSO, Ridge Regression and ensemble methods.Knowledge of manipulating data in multiple data sources/formats (e.g., databases, CSV files, unstructured data).Prior experience in failure detection based on time-series data is preferred.Quantitative and analytical mind with knowledge in experiment design, statistics, and probability.Ability to work both independently and in a remote team with minimal supervision.Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment with rapidly developing opportunities.Communication Skills: Present analytical findings to the company and key stakeholders through verbal and written communication including group presentations.PREFERRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: Due to possible international travels, holding green card or US citizenship is preferred but not required.Awards in data science competitions (Kaggle, etc)Experience working with time-series.Self-Directed – Able to spearhead initiatives, translate plans into specific actions across a team, and execute with urgency.Ego Maturity – A highly motivated, seasoned, and self-assured leader with high confidence in his or her superior professional skills and ability to drive decisions with equanimity.Job Type: Full-timeRequired experience:Full-time work experience as "Data Scientist": 1 yearRequired education:Doctorate

description: Netflix is seeking an outgoing, curious, interdisciplinary machine learning expert to help us imagine the next version of our globally-deployed recommendation algorithms. Is that you?   As a senior data scientist, you will:   Join a world-class team of machine learning researchers with an extensive track record in both academia and industry. Bring a combination of mathematical rigor and innovative algorithm design to create recipes that extract relevant insights from billions of rows of data to meaningfully improve user experience. Learn, develop, and apply new techniques in the intersection of math, probability, and optimization. Translate unstructured, complex business problems into an abstract mathematical framework, making intelligent approximations when needed to put your algorithm to work at scale. Work closely with various product development engineering teams to solve key personalization, discovery and search problems. Interact with and report to an audience that includes Directors, Vice-Presidents and the Chief Product Officer.   Some examples of the problems you might tackle in your new role:   How do we leverage our data to choose a small, relevant, and diverse subset of titles from our extensive catalog to present to each user? And how do we do this in half a second or less each time…. billions of times a day? How do we promote our new original movies to new users in different countries and also dynamically adapt our recommendations online based on realtime user feedback?   Netflix is a fact-based, analysis-driven organization:   The improved algorithms you develop will be A/B tested quickly and rigorously and you will have direct, measurable impact to the bottom-line. Remember: At Netflix, everything is a recommendation!   Qualifications:   PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics or related field. Strong background in machine learning using unsupervised and supervised methods. 5+ years of research experience. Proven track record of leveraging large amounts of data to solve real-world problems. Experience in optimization, graphical modeling, structured prediction, ranking, and representation learning are a plus.
jobtitle: Senior Data Scientist - Machine Learning Research

description: Netflix is seeking a talented and versatile data scientist to analyze and help optimize the algorithms used for movies and TV shows recommendations for over 69 million subscribers globally. Netflix maintains a relentless focus on empirical analysis and experimentation to continually improve our product. As part of our Science & Algorithms team, you will have a direct and high impact on how product decisions related to recommendations are made.   Responsibilities   Partner closely with our VP of Personalization Algorithms to analyze algorithm experiments and drive key product decisions. Proactively perform data exploration on user behavior to discover opportunities for improving our recommendation algorithms. Present your research and insights to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely. Research the best metrics to measure customer engagement by developing predictive retention/ lifetime value models. Drive innovation by exploring new experimentation methods and statistical techniques that could sharpen or speed up our product decision-making processes.   Qualifications:   PhD or MS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, CS, Econometrics or related field- 5+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics to drive significant business impact. Strong SQL skills- Statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in A/B testing- Experience with distributed databases and query languages like Hive or Pig- Programming experience with a scripting language such as Python, Perl or Ruby. Strong data visualizations skills to convey information and results clearly. Proficiency with a statistical analysis tool such as R or SAS- Deep product sense- Self-starter. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Impactful presentation skills in front of a large and diverse audience. A fan of Netflix is a strong plus   A few more things to know   We expect a lot. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about Netflix Culture We are a tight and driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are truly passionate about their work. We also support a balanced lifestyle.

description: GoDaddy’s (NYSE: GDDY) mission is to radically shift the global economy toward small businesses by empowering people to easily start, confidently grow and successfully run their own ventures. With over 13 million customers worldwide and more than 61 million domain names under management, GoDaddy gives small business owners the tools to name their idea, build a beautiful online presence, attract customers and manage their business.   Our Domain Search and Recommendation team is looking for great scientists and engineers to join us in building and improving Domain Search at GoDaddy. Domain Search is one of the key strategic pillars of GoDaddy, with an important contribution to the company’s revenue, customer growth and innovation. As a data scientist, you would play a major role in improving the metrics of the search page across the 42 markets we support worldwide, and the add-on products and advertising we offer when the user searches for a domain.   Responsibilities:  Work with the latest open source technologies that allow you to analyze and process data at scale. Be self-driven, understand the data we have, and provide data driven insights to all of our challenges. Use your skills in NLP to improve our understanding of user queries across the 17 languages we support. Mine datasets to develop features and models to improve search relevance and ranking algorithms Design and analyze experiments to test new product ideas. Understand patterns and insights about what our users search for and purchase to help personalize our recommendations Requirements:  BS/MS (PhD preferred) or equivalent experience in a quantitative discipline: Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, etc. 2 years of industry experience in a Data Science role Expertise with machine learning, statistics, and NLP Strong experience in a programming language of your choice: Python, Java, C++, etc. Familiarity with large-scale data analytics in Hadoop, Pig or Hive. Experience in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R, Stata, Matlab, or SciPy. Experience with Search or large semantic datasets would be a plus GoDaddy is an Equal Opportunity employer!   #LI-SH1

description: Walker & Company Brands is an e-commerce company that is completely reinventing the way consumers learn about, purchase and enjoy health and beauty products. We’re starting with a focus on the $50 billion personal care segment. Personal care manufacturers and traditional retailers are neither building brands nor merchandising experiences which cater to the uniquely differentiated needs of black, latino and asian consumers --- three of America’s fastest growing and most culturally influential demographic groups.   We're inventing a new class of commerce company that will build beloved consumer brands, will win on customer experience, and will win on technology.   Walker & Company's Data Scientist will help optimize the product experience across all Walker & Company brands, focusing on customer acquisition and our customer messaging platform to improve customer engagement and retention. Your predictive modeling, analysis and interpretation of results will inform decisions affecting customers and prospective customers, with a direct tie to Walker & Company Brands' revenue. As we expand to new markets, build new products and brands, this position is integral to Walker & Company's success.   WITHIN THE FIRST YEAR, WE EXPECT THE DATA SCIENTIST TO: Build predictive models of user behavior in order to optimize customer acquisition and retention for Bevel and our newest brand launching in 2016 Partner closely with Product Management, Engineering, Customer Success and Marketing leadership to design and analyze experiments that inform key product decisions Proactively perform data exploration on user behavior to discover future testing opportunities Lead the research and development of new experimentation methods and predictive modeling techniques that could sharpen or speed up decision making and move key metrics BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Master’s Degree or PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related technical field 3+ years of relevant employment experience Statistical knowledge and intuition - you love A/B testing Comfort in SQL (2+ years). You'll create SQL queries to drive recommendations and data structures in support of teams throughout the Walker & Company Brands ecosystem. You will analyze consumer data trends to understand behavior and key insights into current performance and will recommended targeted improvements Advanced data analysis skills – e.g. Database, query construction, pivot tables. Proficiency with a statistical analysis tools Good data visualization skills Excellent written and verbal communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams WHY WORK AT WALKER & COMPANY BRANDS? It's an opportunity to join a small, agile company chasing a large, underserved market opportunity Great exposure to building vertically-integrated e-commerce brands Our office is conveniently located in downtown Palo Alto, just a 2 minute walk to and from the Palo Alto Caltrain station Great coffee shops and restaurants surround the office More benefits! Amazing health, dental and vision plans for individuals and dependents (we pay 100% of the premium costs), commuter plans, competitive equity packages, unlimited vacation and personal days as needed We dream big. We love to compete. We like to have fun. Feel free to reference check us on that

description: Maxim Integrated is a highly successful, $2.4 billion company. With offices and manufacturing sites around the world, we design award-winning semiconductors that make the world more integrated. We also know that it’s our people who make us a great company. So we reward bold thinking, teamwork, personal growth, and community involvement. Want to make a difference and be challenged every day? Join us at Maxim Integrated. With analog integration, the possibilities are endless.   The Senior Managing Data Scientist is a senior technical and leadership position within the corporate Advanced Analytics team. In this role, the candidate will be responsible for building, deploying and supporting predictive and prescriptive models that enable effective decision-making across the business enterprise. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in delivering insight with a strong grounding in analytic research. The candidate must also demonstrate effective leadership capabilities with an ability to clearly communicate and present new concepts, technical results and deliverables.   Responsibilities  Contribute to the direction to the corporate Advanced Analytics team. Assist the Executive Director, Advanced Analytics in setting the team goals and research agenda. Help develop a team comprised of data scientists, statisticians and computational scientists.   Serve as a key member in the development of new analytics products and strategies supporting the enterprise. Develop product, business and process models, and identify/leverage new data sources.   Build, refine and leverage predictive and descriptive models, learning algorithms and data mining tools to improve insights, enhance data-driven business strategies and increase profitability.   Build relationships with internal business partners to find and drive analytic projects and solutions.   Effectively communicate and translate results to our executive leadership and business unit teams in appropriate business terms.   Minimum Qualifications  Education:  Ph.D. in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other quantitative discipline. Specialization in machine learning, Bayesian statistics, mathematical finance, or a related quantitative field is preferred.   Specific Skills:  5+ years of experience in developing prediction algorithms, solutions to prescriptive analytics problems, data mining techniques and/or econometric models   Demonstrated experience building statistical and/or machine learning systems to solve large-scale customer-focused problems   Expertise in leveraging Bayesian and frequentist statistical methods and applying them to real-world business problems.   Demonstrated ability to match the best analysis methods to a variety of business opportunities and ensure only the very best analytic models are put into production.   A high level of analytical rigor and the ability to sift through significant amounts of information to enable the development/deployment of effective analytic solutions.   Demonstrated experience using Python and SQL is required, and knowledge of R is a plus.   A confident peer influencer with strong communication skills (both oral & written) who quickly establishes credibility at all levels.   Maxim is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.   Percentage of Travel  0% - 10%   Relocation Assistance Available  No   Visa Sponsorship Available  No   Removal Date  06/12/2016

description: Description   Responsibilities:  Gathering functional requirements, developing technical specifications, and project & test planning. Helps to align to overall strategies and reconcile competing priorities across organization. Designing/developing schema definitions. Act in a technical leadership capacity: Mentoring junior engineers, new team members, and applying technical expertise to challenging data and design problems. Designing/developing ETL jobs across multiple platforms and tools including Hadoop, Vertica, Netezza. Roughly 60-75% hands-on coding. Resolve defects/bugs during QA testing, pre-production, production, and post-release patches. Work cross-functionally with various Intuit teams: Product Management, Project Management, Data Architects, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Software Engineers, and other Data Engineers. Contribute to the design and architecture of project across the data landscape. Experience with Agile Development, SCRUM, or Extreme Programming methodologies.  Qualifications Qualifications:  5-8 years experience developing DB schemas, creating ETLs, and experience with Hadoop/MPP systems. BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience. Experience with the following languages/technologies: Hadoop, Hive/Pig, SQL, HP Vertica, Python, Shell. Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to technical and non- technical audiences. Strong understanding of the Software design/architecture process. Experience with unit testing and data quality automation checks.  Preferred Mindset:  Communication is king. Goals and design principles guide your decisions. How you achieve a result is equally important as the result itself. Data will answer any debate. Mistakes are common, just don't learn the same mistake twice. Anything can be learned.  Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune's “100 Best Companies To Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide.   Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market -- from QuickBooks®, Quicken®, and TurboTax®, to GoPayment, Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.Discover what it’s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It’s time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: http://jobs.intuit.com . EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. BNY Mellon Innovation Center Silicon Valley (ICSV) is currently seeking Senior Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team. The ICSV is a startup within an enterprise, focused on applied research that can be quickly brought to market as production services and new financial services products. BNY Mellon is the world’s leading provider of financial services technology, and current business operations provide a wealth of fascinating business opportunities and requirements, as well as terabytes of the world’s most interesting data science challenges. Help us revolutionize global financial services!  This is an outstanding opportunity to be a part of a very small and talented team, giving you the ability to help pioneer the usage of consumer and advertising data science techniques, on data that is vastly more valuable and complicated.  As a Sr Data Scientist, you will take lead on exploring and creating business value from data science operations in new business data domains, working with our data model architects, machine learning architects, storage architects, product managers, and line of business owners, You will formulate strategies for Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and follow-on data science processes and architectures, including statistical analysis, machine learning modelling etc. You will help ensure understanding of the business objectives in the data science, and will help invent new ways to analyze, visualize, and derive value from enterprise and financial services data. Python, Java or C++ experience is highly desired. A principled approach to solving algorithmic problems with a focus on what will make users happy. A pragmatic approach to rapidly evaluating new algorithmic ideas. A very high attention to detail and ability to thoroughly think through problems. Excellent written and oral communication skills on both technical  and non-technical topics.   Strong understanding of R or python ML packages and statistics.  Qualifications   -Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must -Proven ability to mine a new data area and derive business value -BS or equivalent, in a field requiring coursework in quantitative modeling and analysis -MS or PhD in Statistics  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. description: Requisition No.: 119481BR  Subsidiary: eBay Marketplaces Primary Job Responsibilities: Senior Data Scientist/Applied Researcher role working within the Search Science team at eBay. Job Requirements: You are Well versed in areas such as applied statistics, machine learning, data mining and general algorithms. You have a background in computer science or math and a graduate degree in computer science, math, physics, computational biology, economics, or some other science. A hacker. If something you need doesn’t exist you don’t wait around, you go and build it. Then you share it with others on the team and turn it into an open source project. Proficient with data stores like SQL and Hadoop. You’re not necessarily an expert, but you’ve written some queries and done some mapreducing. Inherently curious. You want to know whether the distribution of the query frequency on ebay.com is Zipfian and what family of random graphs models the relationship between sellers and buyers on eBay. A polyglot programmer. You probably have a favorite language like Scala or R but you can jump in and write some Java or C as needed. Results oriented. Research is great but at the end of the day you want to see your creation live and breathe. You have a history of building things and solving real problems. You will Be directly responsible for improving search at eBay via services such as spell corrections, result set ranking, related searches, synonym/acronym expansions, and query rewrites. Conceptualize, code, deploy, and iterate on designs from prototypes all the way through to production systems. Analyze petabytes of real-world performance data to understand patterns and trends. Transform data insights into actionable reports, targeting algorithms, and model features. Provide technical expertise in statistical analysis, data mining, machine learning, NLP, and Information Retrieval. Work jointly with architects, engineers, QE, and operations to deliver complex applications. Last Updated: 11/04/2015

description: Infosys – Data Scientist - US – BigDataAre you looking for a change? Do you want to collaborate with some of the best talent in the industry? Are you ready to join a company whose passion is to really make a difference to enterprises, the community and the world? Then you are the one that we are looking for to be part of our growing team.WANTED: Global Innovators To Help Us Build Tomorrow’s EnterpriseThis position's primary focus is to manipulate large datasets to extract meaningful business information using statistics and machine learning techniques. Individuals within the Data Scientist role are responsible for modeling complex internal problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database and computing environments, and communicating results.Our Data Scientists work closely with clients’ data stewards, project/program managers, and other IT teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions. Other responsibilities include providing data that is congruent and reliable. They need to be creative thinkers and propose innovative ways to look at problems by using data mining approaches on the set of information available. They will need to validate their findings using an experimental and iterative approach. Also, if called upon, Data Scientists will need to be able to present back their findings to the business by exposing their assumptions and validation work in a way that can be easily understood by their business counterparts. Excellent written and communication skills are required.Lastly, these professionals will need a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle their hypothesis through the discovery phase of the project.LOCATION: Palo Alto, CA.TYPE: Full TimeSTART DATE: April 4, 2016RESPONSIBILITIESAnalyze and model structured/unstructured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analysesBuild recommendation engines, spam classifiers, sentiment analyzers and classifiers for unstructured and semi-structured dataCluster large amount of user generated content and process data in large-scale environments using tools such as Amazon EC2, Storm, Hadoop and SparkPerform machine learning, natural language, and statistical analysis methods, such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methodsIntegrate diverse data sources into solutionsResearch new modeling techniques and other innovations as appropriate for a specific solutionDrive engagements focused on Big Data and Advanced Business Analytics, in diverse domains such as product development, marketing research, public policy, optimization, and risk management.Perform explanatory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns.Communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations.QUALIFICATIONSBasicAt least 4 to 8 years of professional experience related to the job description.Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.PreferredDemonstrated experience applying and showing an understanding of machine learning algorithms.Demonstrable knowledge of Python in combination with scientific packages or a comparable toolkit. Have written Python code following the PEP 8 guidelines and use of a version control system like Git.Experience with Big Data solutions like Hive or Pig.Strong programming skills (such as Hadoop MapReduce or other big data frameworks, Java), and statistical modeling (like SAS or R).A mid-to high level of expertise with Modelling Tools (such as ERWin Data Modeler, Embarcadero, or Visio).Proven history of being able to successfully conduct advanced data analysis and complex designs algorithm.Master’s Degree_________________For more information, please contact: Ronald ReddenRecruiter – Talent Acquisition6100 Tennyson Parkway, Suite 200Plano, TX 75024O: 469 467-2618M: 214 682-4042www.infosys.com_________________ABOUT USInfosys is a global leader in consulting, technology and outsourcing solutions. We enable clients, in more than 30 countries, to stay a step ahead of emerging business trends and outperform the competition. We help them transform and thrive in a changing world by co-creating breakthrough solutions that combine strategic insights and execution excellence.EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/DisabledJob Type: Full-timeLocal candidates only:Palo Alto, CARequired experience:Data Analytics: 4 yearsRequired education:Bachelor's

description: As part of a programs team within the Google Apps for Work Demand Management organization, you will play a critical role in building an even stronger outbound sales development organization. Our mantra in Demand Management is “Engage. Inspire. Accelerate” which describes not only to how we want to connect with and serve our clients, but also to how we want to connect with and serve our sales development representatives and demand management representatives on our global team.  You will identify and execute a range of complex projects, including managing ongoing programs to help our global sales development representatives spend more quality time with prospective customers, ultimately helping our sales teams to achieve our aggressive growth objectives. With your strategic problem solving skills, and deft interpersonal communication style, you will work fluidly across disparate functional teams (Marketing, Sales, Systems, Sales Operations, etc.) to solve big, ambitious (and ambiguous) challenges to help our organization work smarter, faster and more effectively.  These efforts will range from innovative efforts such as coordinating with a team of data scientists to harness the power of machine learning and predictive analytics helping our representatives target the right accounts, to more foundational efforts such as building actionable business intelligence dashboards, and from deploying sales training certifications, to driving core strategy decisions with cross-functional directors and VPs.  Highly creative, curious, driven, analytical and detail oriented, you are the kind of person who paradoxically never has time to pursue all of your passions, interests and the opportunities you see, but at the same time you ruthlessly prioritize and tightly manage time to do cool things that really matter. Responsibilities  Collaborate with Google for Work Demand Management, Sales, Marketing and Operations teams (from front-line representatives to senior stakeholders) to help build a highly productive global demand management team.  Manage and lead projects across multiple stakeholders and educate stakeholders on style and guidelines for projects.  Develop processes and tools to tightly manage ongoing business operations (including campaign reporting definitions and data views, operational expense management, Objectives and Key Results (OKR) governance, internal and external communication, and recognition/reward programs, etc.).  Present management with clear insights and recommendations into drivers of business growth, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), market trends, risks and opportunities leading to identification of new business opportunities and business growth-enhancing actions.  Build training and ongoing development programs and certifications to help our representatives become masters of their craft.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.  5 years of experience in sales, marketing, project management, consulting or business development at a high-tech company.  5 years of experience in reporting, data analysis and data visualization.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience and demonstrated ability to plan, execute and manage sales development and marketing campaigns.  Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL, Google Apps Script, JavaScript or HTML.  Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities and ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines.  Analytical, with a track record of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.  Ability to understand complex systems and data structures, and translate that complexity in a simple, concise way to stakeholders.  Area  We've helped millions of employees and organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Google for Work team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.
jobtitle: Global Demand Management, Project Manager, Google Apps for Work

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We deliver over a billion hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 60 million members globally. Our data-driven culture allows us to continuously innovate and provide the best experience for our members. We are at the forefront of using advanced mathematical models and algorithms on big data to personalize the experience that every member has, and our scientists and engineers are constantly looking for new ways to improve the state of the art. Netflix data science is a unique combination of big data, algorithms, and entertainment: where else do you get to work on big data and win fourteen Emmys (four for technical achievement), two Golden Globes, and earn back to back Oscar nominations!  Netflix maintains a relentless focus on experimentation in order to improve the experience for our members. Our recently formed Streaming Science and Algorithms team partners with engineering teams to develop and test new approaches and algorithms to improve the streaming Quality of Experience (QoE). These algorithms have a direct impact on the viewing experience as they determine key aspects of the experience such as video quality, delay before playback starts, and ensuring an uninterrupted playback session. Check out the following posts to learn more about our approach and some of the problems we're working on:  Optimizing the Netflix Streaming Experience with Data Science  Turning Data into a Better Viewing Experience  Optimizing Content Quality Control at Netflix with Predictive Modeling  In this role, you will have the opportunity to optimize the Netflix streaming experience by designing experiments to evaluate changes to our streaming-related algorithms, and use rigorous statistical modeling and analysis to discover critical insights that shape the product experience for millions of Netflix subscribers around the world. The streaming QoE space is still nascent and as part of our team, you will have the opportunity to do groundbreaking experimental work that will shape the industry.  Responsibilities  Think carefully and critically about the design of experiments and analysis techniques used. Partner closely with scientists and engineers to design, run, and analyze A/B and multivariate tests aimed at testing hypotheses and optimizing the streaming video experience. Analyze experimental data with statistical rigor. Ensure accurate interpretation by combining business acumen with detailed data knowledge and statistical expertise. Translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business or product improvement, and communicate these findings. Drive efforts to enable independent interpretation of results through education, improved tools, and data visualization. Support internal research into new methodologies for experimentation, as well as adapt existing methods such as Response Surface Methodology (RSM) to online A/B testing. Innovation for the experimentation-based "consumer science" approach at Netflix. Qualifications  PhD degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Psychology, Sociology, Econometrics, or related field. 4+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact. Solid statistical knowledge and intuition, ideally utilized in experimentation (or related analytics). Strong algorithmic thinking and independent research ability.- Passion for learning and innovating new methodologies at the intersection of statistics, applied math, and computer science. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills coupled with strong business acumen. Must be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses, and analytic results into actionable business and product recommendations. Impactful presentation skills, including the use of meaningful charts, graphs, or other data visualizations to convey information and results clearly and concisely. High-energy self-starter with a passion for your work, attention to detail, and a positive attitude. Technical Skills  Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R, SAS, etc. Above average capabilities with SQL. Experience with distributed databases and query languages such as Hive/Pig and/or general map reduce computing is a plus. Knowledge of common data structures and ability to write efficient code in at least one language is a plus (preferably Python).
jobtitle: Senior Data Scientist - Streaming Experimentation and Modeling

description: (DAM) LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.  Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.  Consumer Analytics at LinkedIn influences our products in ways immediately felt by our members. We thrive on collaborating with LinkedIn's product development teams to build data-fueled products which our members love. We own our metrics, track them carefully and are nimble in analyzing trends.  Can you think out of the box to envision how an accurate, timely business intelligence report will allow us to deliver transformative insights?  Do you have what it takes to quickly seize opportunities and leverage the power of programming to unite terabytes of "professional" data and expose hidden insights through dazzling visualizations?  The Data Scientist on the Data Analytics and Measurement team (DAM) plays an important role in defining, computing and visualizing the most important, actionable metrics our Executives use to measure and assess our Member Value Propositions. This high-visibility role affords collaboration with the product and engineering teams behind such revolutionary products as People You May Know, Endorsements, and Who Viewed My Profile.  Responsibilities Provide KPIs, dashboards and deeper insights into product trends to our Executives and Product Managers by tapping directly into our data sources using a combination SQL, Hive, Pig, Python, Java and Tableau. Collaborate with engineering teams to root-cause data problems, devise robust fixes and correct the impacted data. Engage with internal technology partners to prototype and validate tools developed in-house for near-realtime processing of very large data sets. Investigate data errors, construct queries to correct affected data sets and keep stakeholders apprised of progress by planning and tracking tasks using Agile methodologies.  Basic Qualifications: B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, Economics, or related quantitative field of study. Experience working with databases, such as through SQL, Hive, etc. Experience working in an Unix/Linux environment.  Preferred Qualifications: 3 - 5 years industry experience 3+ years work experience analyzing very large datasets with SQL (Teradata, Oracle, or MySQL) - Pig experience desired. 2+ years work experience providing analytical insights and business reports to product or business functions. Experience in presenting insights to executive staff on a regular basis a plus. 2+ years work experience programming in Java or Python. 1+ years experience with Tableau, QlikView, Microstrategy, or other data visualization and BI dashboarding tools. 1+ years experience working with distributed computing platform and tools (Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Spark, etc.) Proficiency in Unix/Linux for automating processes with shell scripting. Experience with R or other statistical package. Strong interest in working with Big Data, and making it accessible for the broader organization. Highly Productive : Ability to choose between competing technology solutions to find the right solution for the problem at hand. The ideal candidate will approach all problems with a holistic view toward future enhancements, ease of maintainability and leverage of emerging technologies. Strong Programming Skills: Success in this role requires hands-on work analyzing data captured from our products using a combination of Hive, Pig, Java, Python, and SQL, executed in our Hadoop framework. Prototyping metrics necessitates mastery of visualization tools like Tableau. Proven Communication Skills: This is a high-visibility role with direct exposure to our senior executives who are data-driven decision makers. Complex technical issues, actionable recommendations and their business impact must be stated concisely, both verbally and in writing. High-energy, Team-first, "Get it done" attitude : Must be motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment to develop and track metrics for our company-wide Member Value Propositions, constructively accepting input from diverse stakeholders across the organization

description: We are looking for experienced data engineer with machine learning, signal processing and data mining background to join the team, to conduct exciting R&D; work focused on algorithm development and investigating biosignal data, including ECG, PPG, GSR, EMG, blood pressure, blood oxygen level(SpO2) etc. You will have opportunities to use cutting edge technologies to solve the most challenging topics. Experience with time series data analysis is a plus.Experience with big data analysis, such as Hadoop, Spark, EMR, is a plus.Good oral and written communication skills, team-work spirit.About HuamiMission:Huami's mission is to seamlessly connect human’s emotion signals and daily activities with Internet services in order to improve people’s lives.The company:Huami received a joint investment from Xiaomi and Shunwei Capital Partners in January 2014, to become the exclusive company within the Xiaomi Ecosystem to focus on smart wearable devices. In December 2014, Huami has raised US$35 million series B funding from Banyan Capital, Sequoia Capital and Morningside Ventures, with pre-money valuation over US$300 million. Huami is now one of the top three smartband shipment and wearable data services companies in the world - aiming at the No. 1 position soon. Huami has offices in China (Beijing and Hefei) and US (Silicon Valley) with talented engineers, domain experts and award-winning designers from worldwide.Products:We started selling the Mi Band smart band at RMB 79 (US$13) on August 16, 2014. By November 28, 2014, within 3 months of launching, Mi Band sales volume had exceeded 1 million units. On the November 11, 2014 (China’s “Black Friday”), Mi Band single-day sales volume reached 103 thousands units on TMall.com (China’s leading online e-commerce site). Huami also delivers the Mi Fit service with applications on both iOS and Android. Beyond Mi Band, Huami is actively developing next generation wearable and mobile devices, building up partnerships with third party software/hardware/service providers, delivering best products worldwide.Job Type: Full-timeRequired experience:Biosignal Analysis: 1 yearRequired education:Master's

It requires a passion for consumer experience, a desire to go into uncharted territory with bold new ideas, and a willingness to go the last mile on execution!

description: PERSONAGRAPH IS HIRING!  DATA ENGINEER  Location: Sunnyvale, California  Term: Full-time  Website: www.personagraph.com  Job description: We are looking for talented, hard-working Data Engineers to join our rapidly expanding team. Personagraph has engineered the first brand focused audience data platform for mobile apps. We empower brands, agencies and publishers with actionable audience understanding, segmentation, and targeting based on core demographics, intent, and interest.  Our Data Engineers will process and analyze terabytes of data for more than 250 million users (and growing) within Personagraph’s Pipeline team. You will work with cutting edge Big Data technologies and apply Machine Learning algorithms to understand our users’ behavior. You will frequently switch between different technologies such as Hadoop, AeroSpike, Spark, Elasticsearch, Nodejs, Python, Java, Javascript, Scala and others.  The Data Engineer will contribute to Personagraph’s success by:  supporting the Data Scientist team and translating proof of concept into code that can be run in production environment  applying machine learning algorithms and to understand user’s behavior  working with the QA team and troubleshoot any issues that may arise during production  The Data Engineer should possess these skills: BS in Computer Science or related fields  around 2 years of Object Oriented Design experience working on backend systems  experience working with and evaluating open source technologies and demonstrated ability to make objective choices  some experience working with Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, Storm, or Spark  around 1-2 years of experience in Java or Python  strong interest in Statistics, Probability Theory, Natural Language Processing, Data Mining, Recommendation Systems or Probability/Optimization Algorithms  strong interest in Data Science and learning how to make sense of massive amounts of unstructured data  Personagraph has developed the most scalable and effective real time, programmatic audience platform for mobile video advertising. We are a true, mobile first data and media company designed to deliver best of breed audience targeting and delivery solutions for Global Fortune 500 companies & their Agencies. Find out more at www.personagraph.com  Come work with us and enjoy competitive compensation, medical benefits, 401k, PTO, catered food, drinks, gym and lot of opportunity to grow and have fun.  Personagraph is a subsidiary of Intertrust Technologies Corporation . We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and e-Verified.

An independent self-starter who likes to take ownership and independently seeks out new challenges. Always ready to learn and step outside of your comfort zone to blaze the trail for new technology. Comfortable to dive into a Python codebase; familiar with a scientific computing framework such as Numpy or R. Ready to learn and work with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Pig, Cassandra, Redshift. Comfortable to work in a Linux environment in the AWS cloud. Interested to dive into the field of cybersecurity.  CDS019SV   For more information please submit resume or contact:   Samuel Merchant   samm@talentmerchants.com   510-851-3594

description: USRA is an independent, nonprofit research corporation where the combined efforts of in-house talent and university-based expertise merge to advance space science and technology. USRA works across disciplines including bio medicine, planetary science, astrophysics, and engineering and integrates those competencies into applications ranging from fundamental research to facility management and operations. USRA engages the creativity and authoritative expertise of the research community to develop and deliver sophisticated, forward-looking solutions to Federal agencies and other customers - on schedule and within budget.  Under the lead of the Science Planning & Instrument Support lead and HAWC+ Instrument Scientist, the Visiting Post-Doctoral Scientist will support SOFIA far-infrared instrumentation, particularly HAWC+, science operations by supporting the instrument(s) and general investigators. The Visiting Post-Doctoral Scientist will also develop and pursue independent research relevant to SOFIA up to 50% time. You have a proven ability to work within teams of highly talented, diverse engineers through solving tough technology problems that enable valuable business solutions. description: Maxim Integrated is a highly successful, $2.4 billion company. With offices and manufacturing sites around the world, we design award-winning semiconductors that make the world more integrated. We also know that it’s our people who make us a great company. So we reward bold thinking, teamwork, personal growth, and community involvement. Want to make a difference and be challenged every day? Join us at Maxim Integrated. With analog integration, the possibilities are endless.   The Senior Managing Data Scientist is a senior technical and leadership position within the corporate Advanced Analytics team. In this role, the candidate will be responsible for building, deploying and supporting predictive and prescriptive models that enable effective decision-making across the business enterprise. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in delivering insight with a strong grounding in analytic research. The candidate must also demonstrate effective leadership capabilities with an ability to clearly communicate and present new concepts, technical results and deliverables.   Responsibilities  Contribute to the direction to the corporate Advanced Analytics team. Assist the Executive Director, Advanced Analytics in setting the team goals and research agenda. Help develop a team comprised of data scientists, statisticians and computational scientists.   Serve as a key member in the development of new analytics products and strategies supporting the enterprise. Develop product, business and process models, and identify/leverage new data sources.   Build, refine and leverage predictive and descriptive models, learning algorithms and data mining tools to improve insights, enhance data-driven business strategies and increase profitability.   Build relationships with internal business partners to find and drive analytic projects and solutions.   Effectively communicate and translate results to our executive leadership and business unit teams in appropriate business terms.   Minimum Qualifications  Education:  Ph.D. in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other quantitative discipline. Specialization in machine learning, Bayesian statistics, mathematical finance, or a related quantitative field is preferred.   Specific Skills:  5+ years of experience in developing prediction algorithms, solutions to prescriptive analytics problems, data mining techniques and/or econometric models   Demonstrated experience building statistical and/or machine learning systems to solve large-scale customer-focused problems   Expertise in leveraging Bayesian and frequentist statistical methods and applying them to real-world business problems.   Demonstrated ability to match the best analysis methods to a variety of business opportunities and ensure only the very best analytic models are put into production.   A high level of analytical rigor and the ability to sift through significant amounts of information to enable the development/deployment of effective analytic solutions.   Demonstrated experience using Python and SQL is required, and knowledge of R is a plus.   A confident peer influencer with strong communication skills (both oral & written) who quickly establishes credibility at all levels.   Maxim is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.   Percentage of Travel  0% - 10%   Relocation Assistance Available  No   Visa Sponsorship Available  No   Removal Date  06/12/2016
