description: Work within a small group of dedicated individuals to develop and improve an application that is at the core of physical modeling capabilities of a line of semiconductor film measurement systems.   Work on problems that influence the design and success of current products or addresses broad design issues of future products or technologies. Tasks include developing problem statements, analysis of various solutions, implementing solutions at software level, testing prototypes, and supporting integration into product software.   The responsibilities include development of new numeric methods and algorithms for data processing, physical optical modeling and numeric regression, implementing the algorithms in C++, supporting other groups in adopting new features and participate in troubleshooting.   Preferred Qualifications  Proven ability to solve complex and challenging physics or engineering problems in academic or industrial setting 5+ years of experience in C++ and object oriented design; Ability to work with other scientists and engineers to develop problem statements, requirements and solutions; Experience in any of the following areas: computational physics, scientific programming, numeric methods, algorithm design, and data processing; Background in physical optics or metrology is a plus.  Minimum Qualifications   Doctorate (Academic) Level Degree in Physics, Computational Physics or Applied Mathematics with at least 4 years of experience, or Master's Level Degree with at least 8 years of experience.   Proficiency in C++ and object oriented design, with at least 2 years of experience.   Equal Employment Opportunity   KLA-Tencor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

description: Position Summary: Niche Diagnostics within the Clinical Diagnostics Division of Thermo Fisher Scientific is seeking a highly motivated, innovative and experienced professional to join the Research and Development department at Fremont, California. This person will be responsible for the planning and implementation of sample acquisition projects to meet R&D; needs for clinical specimens; this includes the acquisition, characterization, and management of clinical specimens, and build of select panels fit for the purpose.  Job Responsibilities: Design, write and review sample collection study protocols, negotiate collection study contracts, facilitate purchase requisitions, and collaborate with suppliers to acquire clinical specimens for R&D; projects, in compliance with Good Clinical Practices, Good Laboratory Practices, Quality, Business, and Industry best practices/standards. Collaborate with users to ensure that customer requirements for specimens are agreed to, via formal established processes, communicated to on a periodic basis, and met per commitment. Collaborate with internal/external clients and service providers to establish and monitor compliance with the sample collection protocols, including, but not limited to, the collection and maintenance of legal and regulatory documentation, ethics committees approvals, accurate and complete data set, managing material logistics, and maintaining collection study information in a validated laboratory information management system per Good Clinical Practices and Quality Standards. Engage, establish, and manage suppliers to actively support the site’s biological material/process requirements. Monitor sample collection studies, identify and resolve discrepancies associated with sample collection projects. Establish and maintain strategic metrics (key performance indicators), and monitor performance. Participate in project team meetings and provide periodic updates on sample collection projects. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with users to manage service requests and associated process requirements efficiently. Maintain a working knowledge of regulations, scientific literature, and the site’s product portfolio. Work with internal/external collaborators and suppliers, such as, thought leaders and key customers in the medical community across the globe, while representing the company in a professional manner.  Minimum Requirements/Qualifications: BS/MS in biological discipline or related field or equivalent combination of education and work-related experience. Biobanking and/or specimen acquisition experience is a must. 5+ years’ relevant experience is required. Prior experience in conducting clinical trials, interfacing with suppliers and biospecimen acquisition/procurement would be a plus. Prior demonstrated experience in developing and managing within budget expectations is required. In-depth understanding of ICH GCP and US FDA regulations relative to human subject protection and specimen collections is required. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment with efficiency; and capable of handling multiple projects. Results and goals oriented. Strong interpersonal and networking skills, highly collaborative within a multi-discipline team and contribute to a supportive and positive work environment.  Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria: Bachelor’s degree with minimum of 5 years experience with biobanking and/or specimen acquisition.

description: People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.  The Self-Driving Car project, part of X, is working to improve people's lives by transforming mobility. The team's goal is to make mobility easier, safer and more enjoyable for everyone to get around. We are a highly motivated team that works in a fast-paced environment. We created a self-driving prototype vehicle that is designed to take you where you want to go at the push of a button - no driving required. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to help create and implement the Self-Driving Car team’s patent strategy.  The role of the Head of HR is to solve complex organizational challenges through people-related solutions. You’ll be an integral part of the leadership team, so you’ll need to understand every aspect of the business and be a thought leader on People and Organizational topics. It’s your role to create the end-to-end People Strategy that will support employees in realizing their wildest ambitions. This will require you to think big, use data to guide your work, be comfortable challenging convention, and in some cases reinvent how work is done. You’ll manage a small team of HR and Staffing professionals to design and execute your strategy for how we staff, onboard, develop, motivate, retain employees and organize work. As part of our culture, you’ll also have the opportunity to be hands-on, working side by side with leaders and employees to get things done on a variety of People-related areas. As a core part of this hands-on work, you will be rolling out programs to support employees - including compensation, performance and talent programs. Responsibilities  Offer thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution. Provide insightful data to guide decision making and provide proactive solutions; set overall HR strategy for acquiring, growing, and retaining talent to meet business objectives  Consult with leaders to create a comprehensive people plan to influence lasting change. Advise leadership team on organizational structure, company culture and HR related matters.  Provide leadership and expertise in the following areas: career planning, performance management, coaching, data analysis, compensation and rewards, employee relations, learning and development, recognition programs and strategic development. Monitor organizational hot issues and trends to make recommendations to executive team on improvements.  Solve problems and get to the root cause of any issue, no matter how complex, and design and quickly implement solutions that cut across multiple disciplines, even those beyond People and Organizational solutions.  Manage leadership development and succession planning. Oversee HR and Staffing department that is responsible for designing and implementing HR programs and processes in compliance with local, state, federal/country regulations.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.  10 years of HR or relevant HR Business Partner Manager experience  Preferred Qualifications  Experience working as a management consultant, working with external clients. Start-up experience.  A proven leader who is a fast thinker, a strategist and practitioner with an incredible track record of successfully implementing people programs and initiatives.  Strong business acumen and the ability to translate the needs of the core business function into people solutions  Proven analytical and influencing skills and an exceptional ability to build credibility quickly at all levels within an organization. Ability to manage a complex set of stakeholders.  Comfortable rolling up your sleeves to get things done and the next moment being part of deeply complex strategy discussions.  Versatile, flexible, collaborative and ability to work within constantly changing priorities. Extraordinary communications capability with a high tolerance for ambiguity and ability to communicate large complex change.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: We are looking for a talented Senior level Optical Researcher and Scientist to generate fundamental research into next generation Light Field optical design and support the productization of new Light Field optics and systems. This person will have a major impact on the company’s success by performing research, design and analysis of critical optical systems that enable revolutionary Light Field capture. He/she will leverage their extensive knowledge of optics to collaborate with computational imaging researchers within Lytro to create new optical solutions that provide significant value to the imaging world.   Main Responsibilities: Perform fundamental research into Light Field optics hardware, leveraging computational advantages into revolutionary new optical solutions. Drive complex optical design, modeling and tolerance analysis for still image and video capture systems. Perform all necessary design and modeling tasks and presents data during internal and external design reviews. Collaborate closely with software, hardware and product teams specifying by selecting and qualifying active and passive optical components, developing and benchmarking system. performance models, developing and implementing test procedures and/or evaluating and selecting appropriate test. Design new optics solutions and specification/modification of off-the-shelf components to support new product development efforts. Work closely with lens suppliers to prototype and refine your designs into revolutionary products. Design and build complex measurement setups as required; perform measurements and data analysis; compile and present data. Establish and develop collaborative engineering relationships with internal customers. Assist Business Development and Engineering teams through consultation on outside system designs to secure new business. Mentor and train optical engineers and technicians. Requirements: Ph.D. in Optics or Physics with an emphasis in Imaging Systems. Extensive experience (10 + years minimum) and demonstrated expertise in optical research into and design of complex imaging systems. Experience with multi-element imaging lens experience highly preferred. Experience managing/working with lens suppliers to realize new and future forward designs. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent time management skills, exercising the ability to prioritize and ability to multi-task and to meet agreed milestones and schedule. Effective communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills. Proficient with software tools including ZeMax, Code V. Experience with optical characterization/metrology tools and setups preferred. Deep knowledge of current “state-of-the-art” design and modeling techniques would be a plus. Experience with Stray Light Analysis would be a plus.

Our group is dedicated to making robots more accessible for real-world applications and finding places where they can help relieve people from tedious tasks. Perform operation, maintenance, and first level troubleshooting of electrical and mechanical Industrial Automation subsystems, such as cameras, proximity sensors, servos, networking, and safety systems. An aptitude for basic mechanical and electronic troubleshooting, logical problem solving evidenced by past work, training or hobbies, etc.  Ability to work non-standard work hours as needed (Hours are subject to change in accordance with individual projects). description: Title: Data Scientist- Python  Contract: 6+ months (renewed quarterly)  Location: San Jose, CA   This is an immediate position for a Data Scientist - Python for our premier client in San Jose, with the following skills:   Requirements:  - Graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, applied mathematics, physics, computer science, engineering, or quantitative field required.  - Five or more years of work experience in an analytics role. At least two years of experience in writing algorithms and building models in a Big Data environment. Prior work experience in higher education industry is preferred. In addition, analytics experience in Learning Management System (LMS), adaptive and competency based learning is a plus.  - Must have Python experience, Pandas and Scikit  - Must have SQL and Statistics experience  - Strong skills in programming languages such Java / Python, Pig, Mahout or SQL required. The candidate needs to have an understanding of Hadoop, Hive and / or Map Reduce.  - Knowledge of writing APIs for data extraction is a plus.  - Using the tools above, the candidate needs to be familiar with disciplines such as:  - Natural Language Processing  - Machine Learning  - Statistical Analysis and Predictive Modeling   Responsibilities:  - Data Scientist with experience with Big Data platforms and advanced proficiency with real time predictive modeling techniques to deploy cutting edge analytical and predictive modeling support to internal constituents in the following areas:  - Preparation of complex and large volume of structured and unstructured data coming from multiple integrated systems  - Predictive Analysis to improve customer experience and persistence. Discovery of insights from large volume and high velocity unstructured data for business to develop targeted strategies for improved student experience.  - Data governance (e.g. defining metrics for new reports, database management, etc.)  - Design and analysis of controlled randomized tests (e.g. multivariate testing)   Send your qualified resume to jeannie.fernandez@experis.com for immediate consideration.   Jeannie Fernandez  Experis  408-431-4554   Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)

description: -  40737  Description  Adobe is changing the world through digital experiences. Our digital media and digital marketing solutions empower businesses to make, manage, measure, and monetize content. We are aggressively innovating to enrich content creation and to reinvent how companies interact with their customers across every digital channel. Just look around you, our impact can be seen on virtually every screen, from TV and movies to digital magazines, to websites and mobile devices.  The challenge  We are looking for student interns with expertise in big data analytics for web, social and video. Our research includes building models of users' behavior from online experiences and identifying key factors that affect these behaviors. Other research involves the analysis of attribution modeling of influences on end-user behavior, churn prediction and propensity scoring. We are also exploring the opportunities of linking media activity to online digital marketing experiences. Ideal candidates will have a strong academic background as well as technical skills including MapReduce programming, statistics, machine learning, and data mining. Familiarity working with large-scale datasets (such as Twitter, blogs, Facebook, etc) would be a major plus.  What you’ll do   Performing analysis on big data from social media and web activity logs. Building predictive user models. MapReduce programming within Hadoop ecosystem -Create visual analytics or dashboard applications. What you need to succeed Strong communication skills; able to clearly articulate complex problems and solutions in terms that others can understand. Strong Java programming skills. Enrolled in a MS/PhD program in Computer Science or related technical field. Must have academic research experience in one of the following areas: Human-Computer Interaction, Data Mining, Information Retrieval, Information Visualization, or Machine Learning.  If you’re looking to grow your career, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences through the Adobe Life magazine.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, disability or veteran status.  About Adobe United States  Adobe has over 5,900 employees in the U.S. and is headquartered in San Jose, California, with other office locations nationwide. description: Geomagical Labs is an early-stage technology startup in the SF Bay Area, applying novel computer vision technologies to mass-scale consumer applications. We are looking for an imaginative, hands-on computer scientist, with a background in Visual SLAM, to lead the R&D; of our novel smartphone visual SLAM engine. Ideal candidates will be highly-motivated applied researchers with excellent hands-on development skills, entrepreneurial drive, and enthusiasm to develop amazing software used by millions of people. Candidates should have practical experience with keyframe and filtering-based visual SLAM systems, experience with inertial sensor kinematics, and solid understanding of multiple view geometry. This position requires strong theoretical foundations, excellent software development skills, sound scientific method, and an adventurous outlook.  Requirements:  Strong computer science foundations, with focus on vision and/or robotics (M.S./Ph.D. strongly preferred). Enthusiastic about seed-stage startups; entrepreneurial, comfortable with risk & uncertainty Hands-on experience developing visual SLAM systems for robotics, vision or AR applications Experience using inertial IMU data (gyros & accelerometers) in SLAM systems Familiar with multiple SLAM approaches, including keyframe BA and probabilistic filtering Solid applied math skills in linear algebra, 2D/3D geometry, and linear & non-linear optimization. Strong software development skills in Linux environments Significant hands-on experience with computer vision feature-level fundamentals (feature detection, correspondence matching, and tracking) Real-time software experience desired Mobile app development experience desired (iOS, Android) U.S. work visa is strongly desired - We will sponsor H1-B visas for candidates, but given visa uncertainty, we strongly prefer candidates to have an existing U.S. work visa.  Benefits:  Rare opportunity to join an early tech startup adventure when it is less than ten people. Be part of the core team responsible for inventing and productizing influential new technologies. Substantial stock equity packages, of the sort only available to early startup employees. We are located in Mountain View, California, but we have technical staff located around the globe. We prefer local candidates. but are open to remote work/telecommuting or part-time consulting for the right candidate.

description: Requisition No.: 121651BR  Subsidiary: eBay Primary Job Responsibilities: Join the Search Science team at eBay! Do you have what it takes to improve a world-class real-time search engine that serves millions of queries a day? Do you thrive on developing data mining techniques to pull insight out of large data sets. Do you dream of having access to the largest eCommerce repository of closed loop buyer/query/demand, seller/supply, and transaction data? Do you know how to combine quantitative and qualitative data? We are passionate about building the best search platform for the world’s largest online marketplace and are looking for top-notch software Engineering and Data Science leaders.  Job Requirements: You will be directly responsible for improving search at eBay via services such as spell corrections, related searches, synonym/acronym expansions, query rewrites, metrics accumulation, spam prevention, ranking, and recommendations.  You will work with a team of software engineers and data scientists.  Collaborate with architects, engineers, QA and operations teams to architect and develop strategic and tactical solutions.  Design, develop and test projects jointly within your team and with other teams to deliver complex applications.  Oversee proof-of-concept prototypes for data collection, analysis, and presentation.  Work with engineers, managers, Product Management, QA, and Operations teams to develop innovative solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles.  Collaborate within the Search team to develop strategic and tactical solutions.  This is an applied research engineering position. You will be expected to research state of the art search query processing techniques, implement them at eBay, roll them to production, analyze results offline/online, and measure site impact. Your performance will be measured by site impact and engineering quality. Publishing is encouraged but not required.  Example Project: Improve related search recommendations by analyzing eBay query logs to find optimal user paths based on success metrics (purchase events). Hadoop/Graph Processing/Statistics/Machine Learning/Data Mining/Natural Language Processing.  Basic Qualifications: BS in Computer Science or related field, MS/PHD desired  3+ years software experience  Expertise required in object-oriented design methodology and application development.  Excellent understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms.  Excellent problem solving skills.  Data mining and machine learning expertise required.  Familiarity with search/recommendation/classification applications and domains preferred. Information Retrieval (search/recommendation/classification) experience or Machine Learning experience. Last Updated: 03/08/2016

description: Personalization analytics is a team dedicated to supporting the algorithm research/engineering teams at Netflix. As part of Netflix's greater personalization efforts we partner with leading researchers as they determine the best way (through algorithm development and data) to make each user's experience unique and customized. This means that we build datasets for the purpose of analysis, collaborate with modeling experts to build data pipelines, and manage the large/offline datasets that enable personalization. The perfect person will have a background in a quantitative/technical field, will have rich experience working with large data sets, and will have some experience in data-driven decision making.   Responsibilities:   Partnering with internal customers. You will partner with data scientists, algorithm engineers, and data engineers to solve business problems as they become computationally intractable. Prototype and productize data feeds that for downstream predictive models. You should enjoy taking abstract/vague requirements and crystallizing them into crisp deliverables. Build/Deploy/Improve internal-built data tools. You will be expected to contribute to internal tools that enable efficiency throughout Netflix. These tools will be used for both analysis and data processing. As these tools mature you will encouraged to make them available via open source.   Skills & Characteristics:   Experience building production data pipelines (using Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, etc.) on web-scale datasets. You should have an unmistakable passion for elegant and intuitive dataset design. Hands on and deep experience with schema design and data modeling. Programming proficiency in at least one major language (Java, Scala, C++, even Fortran!). You strive to write beautiful code, and you're comfortable working in a variety of tech stacks. You are a well-rounded, top performer who is able to "crunch the numbers" and think critically through strategic issues. You move seamlessly between code and analytical concepts. You're ambitious and willing to take action, but not stubborn. You recognize when you're wrong and move past your own mistakes. You leave your desk & collaborate. You recognize the value in face-to-face contact. (Not to be mistaken with extroversion.) You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines. General knowledge of predictive modeling and algorithms.   Two more things to know:   We expect a lot. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it at jobs.netflix.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Additional Location(s) or Information: Job Category: Engineer - Software Level of Experience: Experienced - Non Manager  Requisition #: R1000397 Description: Software Engineer – Tesseract San Jose, CA  The Business Entity The Core Software Group (CSG) has the charter for all Platform Independent and Platform Dependent software development across Switching (for data center, campus core and campus access), wireless, network services, routing, optical software and Enterprise routing and cable access. CSG is creating unprecedented customer value by providing cohesive and innovative software, platforms and solutions for Cisco's core networking customers.  The Team At Cisco, we build products that enable enterprises react faster to the intelligence derived from data. To do that requires a data centric platform that can receive events from a variety of network appliances, and other event sources, process and provides insights. Cisco’s data platform operates at massive scale processing billions of network events across the enterprise and converting that into actionable insights in real time. Cisco’s data platform team consists of Data Scientists, Data Modelers/Analysts, and Platform engineers collaborating on building the next generation data platform that powers the enterprise. description: The Speech Sciences and Analytics group is part of the Data Sciences Group (DSG) and is responsible for continually innovating and improving 24/7’s premier voice applications. The DSG is responsible for research, development and implementation of predictive analytics solutions that address clients’ needs across the life cycle of their interactions with their customers. At DSG, we are developing the science of intuitive consumer experience and building cutting edge solutions by applying machine learning, data mining, natural language processing and text mining to customer interactions.   In this Speech Sciences and Analytics group, the NLU Engineer will work alongside Speech Engineers, Data Scientists, and Application Engineers and will be responsible for understanding the speakers’ intent from speech data. An ideal candidate should have strong depth and breadth of knowledge in speech sciences, machine learning, data mining, and statistics.   The NLU Engineer should have reasonable knowledge of available tools and processes to manipulate unstructured speech data and build prototypes that work on massive datasets. The candidate should be able to design components that work within production systems. Knowledge of programming and scripting is also desired.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Design and develop analytic models using both structured and unstructured speech data to derive: Intent prediction Relationship extraction Information extraction and retrieval Research, design, prototype, develop and support NLU system that analyzes unstructured customer interaction speech data in Finance, Communication, Travel, Retail and Technology industries For natural language intent prediction, design and conduct iterative usability tests to evaluate, optimize and provide feedback to Engineering teams in the development of core technologies Work closely with the Speech Scientist/Engineering team in the development of Semantic Interpretation engines that employ POS tagging, and morphological intent modeling Make recommendations to resolve and improve application performance problems Perform data extraction, manipulation, cleaning, analysis, modeling and data mining in support of your contributions Performing experiments and analyze results to improve the performance and quality of available algorithms Constantly learn and experiment with available APIs REQUIREMENTS  Subject matter expert with deep knowledge in Statistical NLP theories (Latent Semantic Analysis, Linear Discriminant Analysis, HMM, etc.) Hands-on experience in NLP techniques such as Text Classification & Clustering, Topic Summarization, Text Mining, Statistical Language Modeling etc. Hands-on experience with some of the NLP toolkits such as NLTK, Stanford NLP, GATE, Mallet, etc. Knowledge and experience with machine learning/data mining techniques (supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning) Script languages such as Python, Perl, etc. Experience with statistical/machine learning package (R, SAS, Weka, etc.) Experience with handling large speech datasets Master's Degree in relevant major (Computational Linguistics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering) Over 5-8 years of relevant industry experience in Speech Processing, Linguistics, NLP/NLU etc. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong analytical background and proven ability to make data-driven decisions Outstanding attention to detail  PLUSES  Human Factors - Best Practices & Principles Grammar Tuning, Prompt Tuning, Pace Tuning Experience with Information Retrieval, Sentiment Analysis Experience with C++, Java, and/or C# Experience with database and SQL Experience with large scale data processing – Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig, Hive Experience with distributed computing platforms

description: The Instrumentation Software Engineer will be responsible for developing software for Picarro's innovative gas analysis instrumentation, to be used by scientists and industry professionals world-wide. We are looking for a creative scientist with extensive programming experience, who understands the challenges of interfacing software and instrumentation hardware robustly; who knows how to design powerful, intuitive, and reliable user interfaces; who is adept at managing, analyzing, and displaying large amounts of scientific data; and who is capable of developing a deep understanding Picarro’s core technology and the hybrid hardware / software algorithms that run on the instruments. The Instrumentation Software Engineer will work closely with Picarro's team of scientists and engineers to develop new products and expand the capability of existing products.  The Instrumentation Software Engineer must:  Develop highly functional and robust software that reflects a deep understanding of Picarro’s laser-based Cavity Ring-Down Spectroscopy technology. Understand the software development life cycle – including planning, developing, troubleshooting, documenting, integrating, and analyzing software applications. Work closely with project managers, engineering, research and development, marketing, manufacturing and technical support. Must be able to understand software requests, acquire specifications, manage project scopes, and provide fast and accurate solutions.  Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree or higher in Physics, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field, with Masters or Ph.D. desirable. Minimum 3 years of experience in data acquisition software development, data processing and analysis, control algorithm design, and/or data visualization. Solid object-oriented programming skills in Python Experience creating software to interface with scientific instruments and/or test equipment Background in scientific data processing and statistical analysis Experience in developing algorithms for controlling and monitoring physical systems Strong teamwork and communication skills Strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills Proactive, creative, fast-paced, and quality-oriented  Related Skills and Experience:  Experience in software modeling and simulation for engineering applications Experience in elegant, intelligent, and reusable high-level design techniques Fluency in version control processes and software tools. Experience with embedded system design desirable  Picarro is revolutionizing human understanding of the global carbon, water and nitrogen cycles - essentially the building blocks of all life on Earth - by providing analytical instrumentation, systems and advanced services that are opening incredible new opportunities in diverse markets related to science, environment, energy and food.  With ultra-precise, easy-to-use and portable gas concentration and stable isotope analysis instruments, integrated with powerful geo-informatics and geo-spatial visualizations, we are empowering scientists, businesses, governments and NGOs with specific, comprehensive and actionable environmental data – at unprecedented speed, scale and simplicity.  We are marketing our scientific instruments, associated products and technologies into three application segments, helping our customers solve pressing global problems in air, water and land.   Air: Customers use Picarro technology to do critical research on the changing composition of the atmosphere and the air we breathe. We put new tools and information in the hands of scientists, regulators, industry and government stakeholders to enable research in the fields of climate change, urban air pollution and emissions. Water: Picarro enables fundamental research into the water cycle, one of the most critical resources for sustaining life on earth, for the past, present and future. Land: Efficient use of soil, nutrients and water resources are amongst the most important objectives of our global society. Picarro technologies allow scientists to quantify the flux of gases from soils, monitor carbon storage and host of other applications.  Our products are used in a wide variety of applications, including: Earth sciences research; air quality, greenhouse gas and fugitive emissions measurements, energy exploration and distribution, and supply chain integrity. Deployed on all seven continents in places as diverse as the Greenland Ice Cap, The Eiffel Tower, NASA aircraft and Pacific Gas & Electric’s natural gas leak detection vehicles, our solutions are unparalleled in their precision, ease of use, portability and reliability. Our products are all designed and manufactured at our Santa Clara, California, U.S.A. headquarters and exported to countries worldwide. Our technology is based on dozens of patents related to cavity ring-down spectroscopy (CRDS). Investors include Benchmark Capital, DAG Ventures, Focus Ventures, Greylock Partners, Mingxin China Growth Fund and NTT Finance.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, gender identity, secual orientation, or on the basis of disability.  Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.

description: About the Agency   The Exobiology Branch (Code SSX) of the Science Directorate (Code S) at the NASA Ames Research Center is seeking candidates for Research Physical Scientist position. This position serves as an expert in biomarker research and is responsible for conducting a basic research program in biogeochemistry, with the goal of understanding a broad range of biological processes. This position conducts microbiological and geological research to identify biosignatures that can reveal and characterize past or present life in environments relevant to astrobiology and NASA missions.   To receive consideration, you must submit a resume and answer NASA-specific questions. The NASA questions appear after you submit your resume and are transferred to the NASA web site. If you successfully apply, USAJOBS will show your application status as 'Received'. If your status is 'Application Status Not Available', you have not successfully applied. Do not rely on a USAJOBS email to confirm successful application. Only an email from NASA confirms a successful application.   As identical vacancies are identified, additional selections may be made.   KEY REQUIREMENTS Position subject to pre-employment background investigation A one-year probationary period may be required Selectee must complete a financial disclosure statement A minimum background investigation is required  DUTIES: This is a research position engaged in professional scientific and engineering work which is systematic, critical, intensive investigation directed toward discovering, disseminating, and applying new or expanded knowledge in a professional discipline. The incumbent conducts systematic research in problem areas that are highly complex and of considerable scope. The researcher investigates modern microorganisms and environmental samples, ancient terrestrial rocks, and Mars/Europa analog rocks/minerals/ices to support the interpretation of mission data and the identification of 'habitable' exo-planets. He/she develops research proposals in response to research opportunities and publishes research results in national and international peer-reviewed scientific journals.   The researcher addresses two or more of the following categories of biosignatures: remotely detectable features on planetary surfaces (e.g. spectral reflectance of photosynthetic pigments) and characteristic temporal changes in planetary properties (e.g. seasonally-mediated cycles of biogenic atmospheric gases), cellular and extracellular morphologies, biogenic fabrics in rocks, bio-organic molecular structures, chirality, biogenic minerals, and biogenic stable isotope patterns in minerals and/or organic compounds. The incumbent identifies and characterizes biosignatures in microorganisms or natural samples by integrating measurements obtained from state-of-the-art analytical instrumentation. He/she contributes to the design of instrumentation for NASA missions through research that can enhance the search for novel biosignatures on other worlds.   The incumbent determines areas for investigation and provides advice and recommendations to colleagues regarding new approaches to scientific problems; and determines the extent to which objectives are accomplished and if changes are necessary. He/she recommends changes, redirection of effort, and additions to the basic projects to maintain desired objectives. The investigator contributes to the development and deployment of instrumentation for NASA missions, including testing potential spaceflight instrumentation in controlled laboratory and relevant analog environments, and the development of crucial testbeds for real-time problem solving.   QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Applicant must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade, which has equipped the applicant with the particular competencies needed to successfully perform the duties of the position described above.   GS-13: Specialized experience is defined as experience in conducting microbiological and geologic research to identify and characterize biosignatures; AND experience developing research proposals; AND experience in publishing research results in leading journals, or equivalent.   Basic Education Requirement: A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major study in engineering, physical science, mathematics, life sciences, computer science, or other field of science. Degrees in engineering technology are not considered to be qualifying for this position.   U.S. citizenship is required.   HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED: NASA uses an automated system (Resumix) that matches the competencies extracted from your resume to the competencies identified by the selecting official for the position. Based on the competencies you match, you are placed in one of three categories identified as 90, 80, or 70 pt. quality categories, which are defined as:   If you are an individual with a disability, you may be eligible to apply to this announcement under the Schedule A Hiring Authority. To receive consideration under this hiring authority, you will need to check mark "Schedule A appointments for person with disabilities" under the "Options" tab when completing the application process. For information regarding the Schedule A Hiring Authority, please visit https://www.opm.gov/disability/PeopleWithDisabilities.asp OR http://nasajobs.nasa.gov/generalinfo/nssc.htm.   90 pt. Category - Tentatively meets (until subsequent confirmation upon referral) the basic qualification requirements identified in the vacancy announcement and has experience in the same or similar job that has demonstrated superior proficiency in the primary requirements of the position.   80 pt. Category - Tentatively meets (until subsequent confirmation upon referral) the basic qualification requirements identified in the vacancy announcement and demonstrates satisfactory proficiency in the primary requirements of the position.   70 pt. Category - Fails to meet criteria described in the 80 pt. category.   Additional application guidance is available in NASA's Applicant Guide .   Information for Veterans : The Category Rating Process protects the rights of veterans by placing them ahead of non-preference eligibles within each category. Preference eligibles who meet qualification requirements and have a compensable service-connected disability of at least 10 percent must be listed at the top of the highest quality category, except when the position being filled is scientific or professional at the GS-09 grade level or higher.   For the purpose of the Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP) and the Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP), candidates rated in the top quality category are considered well-qualified   If you are an individual with a disability, you may be eligible to apply to this announcement under the  Schedule A Hiring Authority. To receive consideration under this hiring authority, you will need to check  mark "Schedule A appointments for person with disabilities" under the "Options" tab when completing the  application process. For information regarding the Schedule A Hiring Authority, please visit  https://www.opm.gov/disability/PeopleWithDisabilities.asp OR  http://nasajobs.nasa.gov/generalinfo/nssc.htm.   BENEFITS: You can review our benefits at: http://nasajobs.nasa.gov/benefits/benefits.htm   OTHER INFORMATION: Any applicant tentatively selected for this position may be required to undergo a pre-employment background investigation. Individuals who have special priority selection rights under the Agency Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP) or the Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP) must be well qualified for the position to receive consideration for special priority selection. See 'How You Will Be Evaluated' for definition of well qualified. Federal employees seeking CTAP/ICTAP consideration must indicate their eligibility when applying for a position. The USAJOBS resume asks you to identify your ICTAP eligibility; the NASA Supplemental Information asks you to identify your CTAP eligibility. If you are selected for the position, you must be prepared to submit proof that you meet the requirements for CTAP/ICTAP. This includes a copy of the agency notice, a copy of their most recent Performance Rating and a copy of their most recent SF-50 noting current position, grade level, and duty location.   As a condition of employment, male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must certify that they have registered with the Selective Service System, or are exempt from having to do so under the Selective Service Law. In order to receive preference in hiring, you must clearly identify your claim for veterans preference on your resume.   U.S. citizenship is required.   NASA's Applicant Guide provides the information needed to assist you in determining whether or not you can claim 5 or 10 point veterans preference. You should not submit documents to prove your eligibility for veterans preference at this time. However, you must be prepared to submit proof of veterans preference (DD-214, and, if claiming 10-point preference, SF-15 plus proof required by that form) as requested by the Human Resources Office. Veterans preference will only be considered based on what is supported For instance, if you claim 10-point preference, but are only able to document 5-point preference, you will be considered accordingly. If you fail to provide the required documents within the stated time period, we may withdraw a job offer and/or remove you from further consideration.   Your USAJOBS account asks you to assign a name to each of your resumes. When you apply to a NASA position, we will show you the text of the resume you have submitted, but we do not maintain the name you have assigned to that resume. If you wish to keep track of that information, we recommend you make note of it at the time you apply.   Fair Employment Opportunities for Applicants  NASA Credit for National Service   The payment of relocation expenses is authorized.   HOW TO APPLY: This vacancy is being filled through NASA STARS, an automated Staffing and Recruitment System. NASA partners with USAJOBS in providing a seamless application process. Before you begin the application process, please read the vacancy announcement carefully and have all required information available. You may begin the process of submitting your resume by clicking on the 'Apply Online' link. In order to be considered, you must submit a resume completed on the USAJOBS site. When completing your USAJOBS resume, please remember that NASA limits resumes to approximately 32,000 characters including spaces. NASA does not accept resumes uploaded to USAJOBS from a second source or documents attached through USAJOBS' document attachment feature. Once you submit your resume to NASA, you will be asked to complete a short series of additional questions. You must finish the entire process in order to have a complete application package and receive consideration. Your answers will not be saved unless you finish the entire application. You may edit a previously-submitted application, if the announcement is still open. If you are unable to apply electronically for this position, submit your resume and supplemental questions to:  National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)  4200 Rideout Road  Resume Operations Center/Mailstop: HS50  Marshall Space Flight Center, AL 35812. All applications must be received no later than midnight Eastern Time on the closing date of the announcement.   REQUIRED DOCUMENTS: NASA's application process has been specifically developed to ensure that we only ask you for the information we absolutely need to evaluate your qualifications and eligibility. No additional documentation is accepted at the time of application. (For example you need not submit narrative 'KSA' statements; they are not required and will not be evaluated.) In this way we allow you to focus on preparing a resume that best describes your background and abilities. For assistance in preparing your resume, consult the Applicant Guide . Nothing further is required until requested by the Human Resources Office. At that point, we may ask you to submit documentation to support statements made in your resume. For example, we may ask you to provide academic transcripts or proof of Federal employment status. description: Whether you’re guiding a user through a shift in context or expressing the personality of your brand, motion and animation are key ingredients to refine a user's experience on every screen— from mobile phones and tablets to desktops and beyond. At Google, we use motion design to help tell a product’s story, guide our users, improve usability and make the user’s experience responsive and fun. As a Motion Designer, it’s your job to apply your passion for animation to simplify complex interactions and solve challenging design problems.  In this role, you’ll help define and implement Google’s motion design language across all platforms—this includes driving the creation of best practices, collaborating with visual and interaction designers, and working with other product teams. You’ll think critically about how motion reinforces Google’s UX objectives, enhances interactivity, and delights our users.  Play a vital role in building out a new medium for computing and entertainment. Virtual Reality (VR) is rapidly evolving as an important new area in personal computing and content creation. The Google VR team is a fast-moving group of designers, engineers, PMs and research scientists, tasked with building the foundations for great VR, developing best-in-class VR apps and prototyping novel, delightful user experiences. The project started as a 20% project with Google Cardboard. It has since evolved into a vibrant team of full-time VR enthusiasts at Google.  You are a detail-oriented motion designer who understands how form influences function, can weave motion into interaction design and simplify complexity. Responsibilities  Contribute to the overall vision and user strategy for Cardboard/VR apps and platforms, from concept exploration through implementation, working closely with UX and software engineers to build designs.  Define and implement the motion design language for VR and Augmented Reality (AR) products and apps.  Provide patterns, best practices and guidance on animation and transitions for different devices and platforms including web, Android, and iOS.  Collaborate with fellow UX designers as they incorporate motion into their work to enhance interactivity, delight users, and bring beauty, life, and motion to VR experiences.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS or a related field or equivalent practical experience.  Experience with UX design.  Portfolio that includes motion and interaction in game, film/video, web or mobile contexts.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with real time engines and what they do to animation curve data.  Experience with using motion to reduce perceived latency. Propensity to focus on detailed aspects of motion and experience, often related to physics, patterns, and visual design elements; ability to use motion to express sentimental or emotional experience.  Experience working collaboratively with teams: research scientists, UI and 3D artists, interaction designers, game developers, full-stack software and hardware engineers, marketing and business teams.  Proficient in principles of animation; ability to use motion to a narrative effect and understanding the future of interactive motion and strong conceptual skills.  Ability to fuse creativity and code to deliver cutting edge interactions.  A strong acumen for user experience design and how motion design influences UI and interaction design (and vice versa).  Area  Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Identifies problems and solves them independently, or under supervision if required. REQUIREMENTS High school degree required, bachelors or associates degree is preferred. 1-2 years of experience with specimen handling in a laboratory setting. Highly responsible, organized and meticulous. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

From bringinglectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we arealways reexamining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our ownbackyard or an education community across the globe\.  Weare bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explorenew frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always bebetter\. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpassthese boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for theworld’s innovations, personal and global, large and small\.  Comecheck us out\. What big idea will _you_ help us launch?  http://www\.youtube\.com/watch?v=MkyK4aaYzpc  We are seeking a very bright and talented **R&D; Research Scientist withextensive C/C programming skills and solid ASR and ML knowledge\.** Youwill focus on advancing the state of thecompany's automated grading technology while working with the sales, marketingand test development teams to solve practical problems from the field\. The providerof brands such as **aim** sweb, Versant™Tests and WriteToLearn™, APS develops formative, diagnostic and progressmonitoring assessments and instructional tools for various domains includingeducation, business, and government\. For more see www\.pearsonkt\.com and http://www\.pearsonassessments\.com  **Pearson** is aninternational media company with world\-leading businesses in education,business information and consumer publishing\. Pearson fuels the growing demandfor effective education and high\-quality information in the global knowledgeeconomy, and share a common goal: to help people get on in their lives througheducation\. For more information, visit www\.pearson\.com\.  **Pearson** is anEqual Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and a member of E\-Verify\.All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, veterans, and peoplewith disabilities are encouraged to apply\.  \#LI\-BJ  **Primary Location: ** US\-CA\-Menlo Park  **Job: ** Professional Development  **Organization: ** School  **Employee Status: ** Regular Employee  **Job Type: ** Standard  **Shift: ** Day Job  **Job Posting: ** Mar 9, 2016

description: Job Description  A big opportunity! Great pay! Love statistics? Are you a data scientist?  Then, my client requires YOUR mojo with them. We are looking for a self-motivated individual who loves to take up new challenges. We are looking for a self-starter who has a rolls-up-sleeves attitude. This is an excellent opportunity for those aspiring for a growth oriented company.  In a nut shell: You’ll leverage the terabytes of diverse data our systems generate to directly improve our algorithms and buying strategies. You'll also heavily influence the product road map.  If this has piqued your curiosity, please check if you have the following: You’ve more than 5 years of data science experience. You hold a degree in physics, statistics, math, or engineering. You’ve experience coding in Python, R, or Clojure to perform data analysis.  Here’s what we can offer A competitive base salary of $170K + Benefits. Lunch daily and dinner twice a week. Endless snacks of your choosing. Surprises!  Please send us your resume. We’re excited to meet you!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We’re strongly committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all employees and all applicants for employment. For us, this is the only acceptable way to do business. description: Maxim Integrated is a highly successful, $2.4 billion company. With offices and manufacturing sites around the world, we design award-winning semiconductors that make the world more integrated. We also know that it’s our people who make us a great company. So we reward bold thinking, teamwork, personal growth, and community involvement. Want to make a difference and be challenged every day? Join us at Maxim Integrated. With analog integration, the possibilities are endless.   Become the latest leader in the Supply Chain Management organization, a dynamic group of creative analysts and program managers responsible for a wide range of high-impact and strategic projects. As internal consultants and project managers for our partners, SCM is responsible for strategy development and planning execution. This function works in close collaboration with senior management on process improvement across the company. Specific focus is on key metrics; customer delivery performance, lead times, inventory & cycle times.   Competency Required: MS/PhD in Statistics/Mathematics/Industrial Engineering/Computer Science or a related engineering discipline. Strong OR skills preferred. Deep theoretical knowledge & practical expertise in conventional & emerging statistical methods. Extensive experience with data analysis and modeling in statistical packages. Working knowledge of Relational Data Base Systems and SQL. Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication and presentation skills. Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas in plain language. Curiosity: Enjoying discovering and solving problems using data. Self-confidence: Ability to work in stressful situation when insights in (new) data set is required quickly.  Job Description:   The Supply Chain Analytics Director supports the business in delivering valuable insights. The Director is a thought leader in the company presenting management with key insights about recent supply chain trends both in and outside company. The Director will lead processes to sift through all incoming data with the goal of discovering a previously hidden insight, which in turn can provide a competitive advantage or address a pressing business problem. Think of problems like “How do we reduce overall DOI in the supply chain without impacting delivery?”, “What business processes and systems need to change to eliminate customer pain?”, and “How will supply chain handle stress?”   The candidate will be doing “what if” analysis, questioning existing assumptions and processes. Armed with data and analytical results, a top-tier data scientist will then communicate informed conclusions and recommendations across an organization’s leadership structure.   Responsibilities:   Partner with manufacturing operations, business units, finance and sales to define program needs, design solutions through deep analytics, and initiate/execute projects balancing inventory, lead time & delivery. This would require analyzing customer data, building statistical models and provide relevant insights. Identify new methodologies and methods that can enhance supply chain model capability. Coordinate strategies, influence partners and develop and manage implementation plans. Collaborate with management to drive S&OP; processes; develop and deliver effective presentations. Communication and enforcement of best practices in data organization, analytical practices and data visualization and presentation.  Minimum Qualifications   Maxim is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.   Percentage of Travel  10% - 25%   Relocation Assistance Available  Yes   Visa Sponsorship Available  No   Removal Date  06/12/2016

description: Data Scientist at Impermium in Palo Alto, CA   If you are a high-level Machine Learning Expert / Data Scientist with strong hands-on engineering experience, please read on!  Locality Sensitive Hashing! Random Forest Ensemble Classifiers! Stochastic Gradient Boosting Distributed Decision Trees! As Impermium continues to build out its Internet-scale user generated content classification system, we're looking for someone whose passion lies in the invention and application of cutting-edge machine learning and data-mining techniques. Our system already classifies tens of millions of "social transactions" every day, looking for spam, abuse, fraud, and other bad behavior -- as Data Scientist, you'll join our team to help guide and shape our algorithm and classifier development.   Most large-scale abuse classification systems break down due to non-I.I.D. document distributions, an over-reliance on exhaustive ground truth training corpora, and an adversary who continually adapts to specific weaknesses in the classifier. The Impermium Data Scientist will help in our pioneering work to overcome these historical limitations.   The ideal candidate is a highly knowledgeable, all-star computer scientist, with a strong background in machine learning, data mining, and distributed computing. This candidate must have previous, hands-on experience turning conversations into prototypes and prototypes into products -- ideally in a start up environment.   You'll fit right in if:  You are a self-managed, high-energy individual You possess exceptional communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate your engineering and product ideas with both team-members and customers You are absolutely confident in your ability to design scalable, principled, practical classification and clustering algorithms that operate within the near-real-time constraints of the abuse domain Requirements:  5+ years experience creating prototypes that are shipped to market (production systems) 5+ years experience in software product development - with the core focus being on mathematical and / or statistical algorithms Well versed in a modern general purpose programming language such as Java/C++/Scala/Python  Well versed with unix command line tools and one ore more scripting language such as awk/perl/shell  Proven ability to develop and execute sophisticated data mining & modeling Experience working with "Big Data" systems and platforms NLP (natural language processing) experience is a plus Publications and/or patents are a plus MS/PH.D in Computer Science recommended  Impermium offers you:  A chance to build a crucial component of Web 2.0 infrastructure: the defense against spam and abuse A dynamic, technology-driven work environment in our beautiful Palo Alto office space A highly influential and visible role with direct impact on foundational product and engineering direction The opportunity to work alongside a highly talented, experienced founding team
snippet: The ideal candidate is a highly knowledgeable, all-star computer scientist, with a strong background in machine learning, data mining, and distributed computing...

description: We are looking for a talented Senior level Optical Researcher and Scientist to generate fundamental research into next generation Light Field optical design and support the productization of new Light Field optics and systems. This person will have a major impact on the company’s success by performing research, design and analysis of critical optical systems that enable revolutionary Light Field capture. He/she will leverage their extensive knowledge of optics to collaborate with computational imaging researchers within Lytro to create new optical solutions that provide significant value to the imaging world.   Main Responsibilities: Perform fundamental research into Light Field optics hardware, leveraging computational advantages into revolutionary new optical solutions. Drive complex optical design, modeling and tolerance analysis for still image and video capture systems. Perform all necessary design and modeling tasks and presents data during internal and external design reviews. Collaborate closely with software, hardware and product teams specifying by selecting and qualifying active and passive optical components, developing and benchmarking system. performance models, developing and implementing test procedures and/or evaluating and selecting appropriate test. Design new optics solutions and specification/modification of off-the-shelf components to support new product development efforts. Work closely with lens suppliers to prototype and refine your designs into revolutionary products. Design and build complex measurement setups as required; perform measurements and data analysis; compile and present data. Establish and develop collaborative engineering relationships with internal customers. Assist Business Development and Engineering teams through consultation on outside system designs to secure new business. Mentor and train optical engineers and technicians. Requirements: Ph.D. in Optics or Physics with an emphasis in Imaging Systems. Extensive experience (10 + years minimum) and demonstrated expertise in optical research into and design of complex imaging systems. Experience with multi-element imaging lens experience highly preferred. Experience managing/working with lens suppliers to realize new and future forward designs. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent time management skills, exercising the ability to prioritize and ability to multi-task and to meet agreed milestones and schedule. Effective communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills. Proficient with software tools including ZeMax, Code V. Experience with optical characterization/metrology tools and setups preferred. Deep knowledge of current “state-of-the-art” design and modeling techniques would be a plus. Experience with Stray Light Analysis would be a plus.

description: Personalization analytics is a team dedicated to supporting the algorithm research/engineering teams at Netflix. As part of Netflix's greater personalization efforts we partner with leading researchers as they determine the best way (through algorithm development and data) to make each user's experience unique and customized. This means that we build datasets for the purpose of analysis, collaborate with modeling experts to build data pipelines, and manage the large/offline datasets that enable personalization. The perfect person will have a background in a quantitative/technical field, will have rich experience working with large data sets, and will have some experience in data-driven decision making.   Responsibilities:   Partnering with internal customers. You will partner with data scientists, algorithm engineers, and data engineers to solve business problems as they become computationally intractable. Prototype and productize data feeds that for downstream predictive models. You should enjoy taking abstract/vague requirements and crystallizing them into crisp deliverables. Build/Deploy/Improve internal-built data tools. You will be expected to contribute to internal tools that enable efficiency throughout Netflix. These tools will be used for both analysis and data processing. As these tools mature you will encouraged to make them available via open source.   Skills & Characteristics:   Experience building production data pipelines (using Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, etc.) on web-scale datasets. You should have an unmistakable passion for elegant and intuitive dataset design. Hands on and deep experience with schema design and data modeling. Programming proficiency in at least one major language (Java, Scala, C++, even Fortran!). You strive to write beautiful code, and you're comfortable working in a variety of tech stacks. You are a well-rounded, top performer who is able to "crunch the numbers" and think critically through strategic issues. You move seamlessly between code and analytical concepts. You're ambitious and willing to take action, but not stubborn. You recognize when you're wrong and move past your own mistakes. You leave your desk & collaborate. You recognize the value in face-to-face contact. (Not to be mistaken with extroversion.) You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines. General knowledge of predictive modeling and algorithms.   Two more things to know:   We expect a lot. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it at jobs.netflix.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Work on problems that influence the design and success of current products or addresses broad design issues of future products or technologies. Tasks include developing problem statements, analysis of various solutions, implementing solutions at software level, testing prototypes, and supporting integration into product software.   The responsibilities include development of new numeric methods and algorithms for data processing, physical optical modeling and numeric regression, implementing the algorithms in C++, supporting other groups in adopting new features and participate in troubleshooting. Minimum Qualifications   Doctorate (Academic) Level Degree in Physics, Computational Physics or Applied Mathematics with at least 4 years of experience, or Master's Level Degree with at least 8 years of experience.   Proficiency in C++ and object oriented design, with at least 2 years of experience.   Equal Employment Opportunity   KLA-Tencor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

description: Position Summary: Niche Diagnostics within the Clinical Diagnostics Division of Thermo Fisher Scientific is seeking a highly motivated, innovative and experienced professional to join the Research and Development department at Fremont, California. This person will be responsible for the planning and implementation of sample acquisition projects to meet R&D; needs for clinical specimens; this includes the acquisition, characterization, and management of clinical specimens, and build of select panels fit for the purpose.  Job Responsibilities: Design, write and review sample collection study protocols, negotiate collection study contracts, facilitate purchase requisitions, and collaborate with suppliers to acquire clinical specimens for R&D; projects, in compliance with Good Clinical Practices, Good Laboratory Practices, Quality, Business, and Industry best practices/standards. Collaborate with users to ensure that customer requirements for specimens are agreed to, via formal established processes, communicated to on a periodic basis, and met per commitment. Collaborate with internal/external clients and service providers to establish and monitor compliance with the sample collection protocols, including, but not limited to, the collection and maintenance of legal and regulatory documentation, ethics committees approvals, accurate and complete data set, managing material logistics, and maintaining collection study information in a validated laboratory information management system per Good Clinical Practices and Quality Standards. Engage, establish, and manage suppliers to actively support the site’s biological material/process requirements. Monitor sample collection studies, identify and resolve discrepancies associated with sample collection projects. Establish and maintain strategic metrics (key performance indicators), and monitor performance. Participate in project team meetings and provide periodic updates on sample collection projects. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with users to manage service requests and associated process requirements efficiently. Maintain a working knowledge of regulations, scientific literature, and the site’s product portfolio. Work with internal/external collaborators and suppliers, such as, thought leaders and key customers in the medical community across the globe, while representing the company in a professional manner.  Minimum Requirements/Qualifications: BS/MS in biological discipline or related field or equivalent combination of education and work-related experience. Biobanking and/or specimen acquisition experience is a must. 5+ years’ relevant experience is required. Prior experience in conducting clinical trials, interfacing with suppliers and biospecimen acquisition/procurement would be a plus. description: As part of a programs team within the Google Apps for Work Demand Management organization, you will play a critical role in building an even stronger outbound sales development organization. Our mantra in Demand Management is “Engage. Inspire. Accelerate” which describes not only to how we want to connect with and serve our clients, but also to how we want to connect with and serve our sales development representatives and demand management representatives on our global team.  You will identify and execute a range of complex projects, including managing ongoing programs to help our global sales development representatives spend more quality time with prospective customers, ultimately helping our sales teams to achieve our aggressive growth objectives. With your strategic problem solving skills, and deft interpersonal communication style, you will work fluidly across disparate functional teams (Marketing, Sales, Systems, Sales Operations, etc.) to solve big, ambitious (and ambiguous) challenges to help our organization work smarter, faster and more effectively.  These efforts will range from innovative efforts such as coordinating with a team of data scientists to harness the power of machine learning and predictive analytics helping our representatives target the right accounts, to more foundational efforts such as building actionable business intelligence dashboards, and from deploying sales training certifications, to driving core strategy decisions with cross-functional directors and VPs.  Highly creative, curious, driven, analytical and detail oriented, you are the kind of person who paradoxically never has time to pursue all of your passions, interests and the opportunities you see, but at the same time you ruthlessly prioritize and tightly manage time to do cool things that really matter. Responsibilities  Collaborate with Google for Work Demand Management, Sales, Marketing and Operations teams (from front-line representatives to senior stakeholders) to help build a highly productive global demand management team.  Manage and lead projects across multiple stakeholders and educate stakeholders on style and guidelines for projects.  Develop processes and tools to tightly manage ongoing business operations (including campaign reporting definitions and data views, operational expense management, Objectives and Key Results (OKR) governance, internal and external communication, and recognition/reward programs, etc.).  Present management with clear insights and recommendations into drivers of business growth, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), market trends, risks and opportunities leading to identification of new business opportunities and business growth-enhancing actions.  Build training and ongoing development programs and certifications to help our representatives become masters of their craft.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.  5 years of experience in sales, marketing, project management, consulting or business development at a high-tech company.  5 years of experience in reporting, data analysis and data visualization.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience and demonstrated ability to plan, execute and manage sales development and marketing campaigns.  Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL, Google Apps Script, JavaScript or HTML.  Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities and ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines.  Analytical, with a track record of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.  Ability to understand complex systems and data structures, and translate that complexity in a simple, concise way to stakeholders.  Area  We've helped millions of employees and organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Google for Work team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.
