description: Geomagical Labs is an early-stage technology startup in the SF Bay Area, applying novel computer vision technologies to mass-scale consumer applications. We are looking for an imaginative, hands-on computer scientist, with a background in Visual SLAM, to lead the R&D; of our novel smartphone visual SLAM engine. Ideal candidates will be highly-motivated applied researchers with excellent hands-on development skills, entrepreneurial drive, and enthusiasm to develop amazing software used by millions of people. Candidates should have practical experience with keyframe and filtering-based visual SLAM systems, experience with inertial sensor kinematics, and solid understanding of multiple view geometry. This position requires strong theoretical foundations, excellent software development skills, sound scientific method, and an adventurous outlook.  Requirements:  Strong computer science foundations, with focus on vision and/or robotics (M.S./Ph.D. strongly preferred). Enthusiastic about seed-stage startups; entrepreneurial, comfortable with risk & uncertainty Hands-on experience developing visual SLAM systems for robotics, vision or AR applications Experience using inertial IMU data (gyros & accelerometers) in SLAM systems Familiar with multiple SLAM approaches, including keyframe BA and probabilistic filtering Solid applied math skills in linear algebra, 2D/3D geometry, and linear & non-linear optimization. Strong software development skills in Linux environments Significant hands-on experience with computer vision feature-level fundamentals (feature detection, correspondence matching, and tracking) Real-time software experience desired Mobile app development experience desired (iOS, Android) U.S. work visa is strongly desired - We will sponsor H1-B visas for candidates, but given visa uncertainty, we strongly prefer candidates to have an existing U.S. work visa.  Benefits:  Rare opportunity to join an early tech startup adventure when it is less than ten people. Be part of the core team responsible for inventing and productizing influential new technologies. Substantial stock equity packages, of the sort only available to early startup employees. We are located in Mountain View, California, but we have technical staff located around the globe. We prefer local candidates. but are open to remote work/telecommuting or part-time consulting for the right candidate.

description: SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is seeking an Associate Staff Scientist or Staff Scientist to join the Coherent X-ray imaging Department of the Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) Directorate. LCLS the world's first hard x-ray free electron laser is ideal to study ultrafast processes in matter and utilize the femtosecond x-ray pulses for structural biology studies beyond the classical x-ray pulse tolerance limit. The Associate Staff Scientist or Staff Scientist will be a member of the Science, Research & Development (SRD) Division, whose mission is to ensure the success of experiments at the LCLS by operating, maintaining and upgrading the instrumentation. The successful candidate will become a member of the Coherent X-ray Imaging department and be involved in every day experiments as well as potential development of new instrumentation. Depending on interests and capabilities, the candidate could play a lead role in developing analysis tools for general purpose research or dedicated to structural biology, or lead the development of a new beamline at LCLS. The candidate will also have the opportunity to engage in other related scientific research efforts and develop new scientific objectives.   Specific Responsibilities including but not limited to the following:  Improve proficiency in the operation of LCLS instrumentation and user activities. Perform research and development to expand the capabilities of LCLS. Participate in planning and performing forefront experiments in ultrafast X-ray science and structural biology using the LCLS. Collaborate with other instrument scientists, engineers and technical staff to execute planned experiments. Disseminate research results through peer reviewed publications and presentations at scientific meetings. Note: This position is posted at the Associate Staff Scientist and Staff Scientist levels. The Associate Staff Scientist position is a 3 to 5 year fixed term position and is the entry level in the Staff Scientist career path. Appointment to the Staff Scientist level, a regular-continuing position, requires a review and evaluation of documented scientific achievements.   Qualifications:  Ph.D. in Physics, Applied Physics, Chemistry, Biology or related field with post-doctoral experience. Strong background in synchrotron radiation or Free-Electron Laser techniques and instrumentation, with emphasis in structural biology, hard X-ray crystal diffraction and or coherent diffractive imaging. Demonstrated ability to develop, design and test new scientific instrumentation. Demonstrated record of scientific productivity through publications. Strong analytical and computation skills. Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to multi-task and complete assignments. Effective communication and writing skills to prepare and present technical and scientific documentation. Demonstrated ability to carry out independent research, collaborate closely with colleagues conducting experimental research, and participate in the writing of scientific proposals to fund research. Demonstrated ability to work independently and in a team environment. Demonstrated ability to work and communicate effectively with a diverse population. Experience in one or more of the following required: Experience with data processing and data analysis for large data sets. Experience with x-ray structural biology data analysis and data interpretation. Specific experience with analysis of Coherent Diffractive Imaging data. Specific experience with analysis of Serial Femtosecond Crystallography data. Background in x-ray optics and beamline design Experience with optical lasers Qualifications:
jobtitle: Associate Staff Scientist- Coherent X-ray Imaging

description: Job Description: Performs a wide range of medical laboratory tests used to diagnose, treat and prevent disease. Using technical knowledge and a theoretical understanding of the basis of the tests, records and validates the accuracy and quality of results to ensure conformity to specifications. Understands and applies the correct control measures and protocols in cases of abnormal results, reporting any discrepancies to a Senior, Reference, or Supervising Clinical Laboratory Scientist. Calibrates assays where the calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance and records is performance. Performs simple troubleshooting and reports instrument malfunctions to senior staff. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory.  Accurately performs and completes laboratory analysis on body fluids in accordance with laboratory protocols and policies. Adheres to all safety/health and state/federal regulatory requirements and the procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Demonstrates technical proficiency in all areas of assigned responsibility. Keeps abreast of new technical developments and acquires the necessary skills to adapt to technological changes. Maintains a current understanding of all procedures used in the assigned laboratory section(s) and can interpret the significance of normal and abnormal results. Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisors. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test results to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability. Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university  Experience: One (1) year of progressively responsible and directly related work experience. Experience with molecular techniques desired but will train the right candidate.  License/Certification: Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS)  Must be able to work evening shift.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification. Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to technological changes in the laboratory Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities Ability to solve problems and identify solutions Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization Knowledge and technical proficiency in specialty areas assigned within the laboratory Knowledge of infection prevention policies and procedures Knowledge of local, state and federal regulatory requirements related to areas of functional responsibility

description: Additional Location(s) or Information: Job Category: Engineer - Software Level of Experience: Experienced - Non Manager  Requisition #: R1000397 Description: Software Engineer – Tesseract San Jose, CA  The Business Entity The Core Software Group (CSG) has the charter for all Platform Independent and Platform Dependent software development across Switching (for data center, campus core and campus access), wireless, network services, routing, optical software and Enterprise routing and cable access. CSG is creating unprecedented customer value by providing cohesive and innovative software, platforms and solutions for Cisco's core networking customers.  The Team At Cisco, we build products that enable enterprises react faster to the intelligence derived from data. To do that requires a data centric platform that can receive events from a variety of network appliances, and other event sources, process and provides insights. Cisco’s data platform operates at massive scale processing billions of network events across the enterprise and converting that into actionable insights in real time. Cisco’s data platform team consists of Data Scientists, Data Modelers/Analysts, and Platform engineers collaborating on building the next generation data platform that powers the enterprise. Are you pushing the envelope? Here, you'll be designing, implementing, and empowering the world’s best data platform. You’ll lead and collaborate as part of a disruptive software engineering team that is passionate about transforming the networking industry.  Role & Responsibilities  You will:  Bring a strong perspective that drives change and motivates engineers to develop simple solutions to complex problems. create reusable components and services in the machine learning space, so we can can quickly and efficiently implement new algorithms, compute pipelines, and persistence stores You’ll scale out the platform to process thousands of events per minute, and be the expert in our team for running our internal systems for stream processing systems and other batch compute engines like Spark and Elastic MapReduce  You bring:  Expertise in building high performance , highly scalable solutions on the cloud You have expertise in Java, Scala, or other JVM-based languages experience initiating cross-function collaboration with Ops, Product and Design to develop high quality, focused products (and inspire your team to independently initiate this same collaboration). experience with front-end technologies and/or statistical analysis tools experience building high performance distributed system solving large scale engineering challenges Deep understand messaging/queuing systems  Bonus:  Experience with Hadoop, Scalding, Spark, Storm, Scala or similar Experience with A/B testing or machine learning infrastructure Experience with AWS technologies Proficiency in the Apache Hadoop stack, and have written applications on top of big data platforms like Spark, Hive, Mesos and Storm Working experience with a cluster management system such as Kubernetes  Minimum Qualifications  3-5 years experience working on a senior high impact software development team MSEE/CS combined with 5+ years of related experience, or BSEE/CS combined with 7+ yrs related experience. Provides technical guidance to small teams. Takes ownership for initiatives and code, and then drives ongoing evaluation and success. Determines own methods on issue resolution. Uses judgment to solve problems where protocol might not exist. description: Reporting to the Head of Nonclinical Development and working closely with the Head of Early Development, and other senior Tech Ops, Clinical, and Regulatory leaders of the Jazz R&D; Organization, the Senior Director, Bioanalytics will be responsible for the conduct and reporting of the clinical and nonclinical bioanalytical (BA) assays supporting pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics (PD), and immunogenicity assessments, preparation of BA components of regulatory submissions for Jazz portfolio of small molecule and biologics products in support of IND and NDA/BLA packages and respond to inquiries from regulatory authorities. The Candidate will have experience in evaluating and addressing global assay development issues. The Candidate, will direct and monitor the CRO and consultant activities to deliver robust and reliable bioanalytical assays.  The individual will be a self-starter with excellent time and people management capabilities and who is seeking to be a critical part of an innovative team that to support the company’s drug development process. Essential Functions Supervise, manage, and strategic planning with BA CROs on objectives and priority setting Lead scientific review and provide instruction on bioanalysis from CROs for CRO to provide quality data/reports within specified timelines Evaluate work from the bioanalytical sub-team, CROs, contractors, and consultants. Organize project meetings and manage timelines for coordinating BA and CRO work. Represent the bioanalytical group to present bioanalytical results to project teams Responsible for review and approval of data/report from both BA and CRO labs in coordination with the Senior CRO Manager Contribute to the preparation of bioanalytical sections of IND/BLA documents Contribute to addressing questions and inspections from the regulatory agencies Lead development and technology transfer of BA methods to CROs Provide bioanalytical input and collaborate across all functional areas, including research, preclinical, clinical development, project management, biostatics, data management, and regulatory affairs departments. Persuasive written and oral communications skills. Demonstrate success in technical proficiency, scientific creativity, and collaboration with others and independent thought. Scientific know-how: widely recognized expert maintains high level of professional expertise through familiarity with scientific literature. description: Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.  The UX (User Experience) Team at Project Aura develops concepts, designs, user interfaces, user experiences, input and output devices, and interaction techniques. We are a highly motivated team that works in a fast paced environment. We prototype with paper, clay, screens, video, software and hardware, depending on the needs. We work both with near-term products to support and inform product decision, as well as, with experiments, explorations, and longer term R&D; efforts. We have a diverse team of UX/UI/sound/motion/product designers, interaction/UX researchers, software engineers, UX prototypers and research scientists. Not only is our team very interdisciplinary, we also work closely and organically, for example, with industrial design, product design engineering, mechanical engineering, optics, marketing and the software and hardware teams.  As a Software Engineer in our UX team, you will have a critical role in synthesizing concepts into functional prototypes of different fidelity. We’d like you to bring the most innovative product concepts to life to help us push the boundaries of user interface design across a new category of products.  You'll partner with our designers, researchers and engineers to define and deliver new features, test new concepts and assist with final implementation. You work both independently and collaboratively in your projects, and will interface members across the organization. You will use your experience to drive medium to large-sized tasks and projects while exercising considerable independent judgment and discretion. Responsibilities  Deliver innovative, engaging prototypes using the latest software technologies.  Design and build advanced apps for the Android platform.  Advise, collaborate with, and synthesize feedback from UX designers and researchers, and members from across the organization.  Fulfill several project requests simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines.  Assist software and hardware engineers with final development of Aura products.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.  Experience with developing apps with streamlined UI/UX.  Experience in mobile application development.  Preferred Qualifications  MS degree in Computer Science with 5 years of related work experience.  Experience working with Android SDKs (sensors), third-party APIs and data sources (JSON/XML, etc.).  Experience with low-level Android development (NDK).  Embedded development and prototyping (microcontrollers, FPGAs) experience.  C/C++ experience, especially for firmware development.  Proven ability to collaborate with designers, researchers, and engineers to develop new solutions.  Area  The Google Glass division is a world-class team focused on the cutting edge of hardware, software and industrial design. It is charged with pioneering, developing, building and launching smart eyewear and other related products in line with Google's ambitious and visionary objectives.
jobtitle: Software Prototyping Engineer, Project Aura, Glass and Beyond

description: SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is one of 17 Department of Energy (DOE) National Laboratories.   Operated by Stanford University on behalf of the DOE, SLAC develops and operates some of the world’s premier science facilities. The Advance Instrumentation for Research Division in the Technology Innovation Directorate (TID-AIR) is involved in many national and international projects, among others the instrument development for the Large Synoptic Survey Telescope (LSST) camera, the Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) experiments, the Cryogenic Dark Matter Search (CDMS) experiment, the LHC ATLAS detector at CERN, and accelerator controls for LCLS-II.   TID-AIR has a centrally managed summer internship program for undergraduate students. Each intern is partnered with a mentor, typically a scientist, engineer, or other technical staff, who directs the internship project during the summer. The primary goal of the program is to provide interns with a stimulating, real-world research experience. To some extent technical projects are matched to the interests and skills of each intern, but are ultimately determined by the programmatic needs of the facility.   Project Description  The intern will be in charge of the setup of a beam loss detector research laboratory for the Advanced Control Systems (ACS) Department in the Advanced Instrumentation for Research Division at SLAC. The intern will work closely to engineers and physics to learn specific tasks. He/she will be responsible for setting up test bench for sensors including: sensor instrumentation, control and data acquisition systems, as well as modeling and simulation system for data validation. The detectors under study and characterization in this laboratory will be used for beam loss detection on the LCLS I and LCLS II accelerators. Specific responsibilities (Including but not limited to):  Initial setup and organization of the laboratory space and equipment. Setup, configuration and installation of sensors and their instrumentation. Implementation of control and data acquisition systems. Characterize the sensors experimentally. Create mathematical model of the sensors and characterize them through simulations. Validate experimental data with simulation results. Sensors under study:  LCLS 1 MR and LCLS IIBeam Loss Detector detectors MPS Undulator Beam Loss Fast Wire Scanner Detector Point Loss Detectors with Diamond Sensors Note: This is an hourly, non-benefits eligible temporary-nonexempt, summer internship position (work at 50% full-time equivalent or more), not to exceed 980 hours in six consecutive months. Eligible applicants must be at least 18 years of age and currently enrolled in an educational program or recently graduated and have US work authorization.   Qualifications:  Must be enrolled in a degree program in engineering, physics or related field Problem-solving and analysis skills Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment Organizational skills and ability to multi-task and complete assignments Strong verbal and written communication SLAC Competencies:  Effective Decisions : Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner. Self-Development : Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing. Dependability : Can be counted on to deliver results with a sense of personal responsibility for expected outcomes. Initiative : Pursues work and interactions proactively with optimism, positive energy, and motivation to move things forward. Adaptability : Flexes as needed when change occurs, maintains an open outlook while adjusting and accommodating changes. Communication: Ensures effective information flow to various audiences and creates and delivers clear, appropriate written, spoken, presented messages. Relationships : Builds relationships to foster trust, collaboration, and a positive climate to achieve common goals.  Qualifications:

description: A Little About Us  How good is the Yahoo Search and Advertising experience? In what ways is it better than the competition, and in what ways is it worse? How can it be improved? We produce information and insights to improve Yahoo products. We design and analyze experimental changes to the user-interface, monetization algorithms, and search algorithms. We measure and monitor search revenue and quality, taking into account potential instrumentation anomalies. In addition, we compare the Yahoo user experience to that of competing services to support strategic planning. We're passionate about building the best and most innovative search experience on the planet, and our team brings together some of the best and brightest minds from across the search industry.  A Lot About You  The Yahoo Search Analysis team is seeking a data scientist with project or product management experience possessing sound business judgment and deep analytical capabilities, and able to demonstrate an ability to work collaboratively. The candidate will possess strong organizational skills, intellectual curiosity, and a passion for achieving practical business impact leveraging big data and analytics. Skills in experimentation, problem definition, rigorous analysis, and recommendation development to senior management will also be critical. As part of the team, you will be responsible for driving systems and practices across Yahoo to accurately track and understand referral and revenue. You will play an important role in improving the success of the Search business on PC, mobile and Tablet.  Your Day  Build models to gain insights on what drives product/business performance in terms of both revenue, as well as user satisfaction.  Offer a strategic perspective, possess sound business judgment and deep analytical capabilities, and demonstrate an ability to work collaboratively.  Present business trends, data issues and insights to senior leadership  Leverage data and analytics to provide support to product ideation, design and implementation.  Frame business problems into questions that can be answered through data analysis, and translate business needs into requirements that can be understood by technical teams.  Determine appropriate experiments, data, and analyses as needed.  Conduct data mining to understand user behavior.  Monitor data quality and product innovations.  Ensure that results are presented in ways that engineering and business colleagues can understand and act upon.  Collaborate with product and engineering teams.  Lead large scale analysis projects across product teams  You Must Have  BS, MS or PhD with a focus on economics, statistics, math, computer science or related quantitative discipline.  3-4+ years web experience in a Business Intelligence, Data/Project Management or Data Science.  Solid analytical skills and business acumen, combined with the ability to formulate insights, present a compelling case for action, and deliver expert advice and recommendations  Ability to tell compelling, data-driven stories based on large, complex datasets  Strong oral, written, communication, and organizational skills are a must.  Attention to detail with the ability to see the “big picture” and frame opportunities  .  Experience working on systems handling large volumes of data  Self-driven, detail oriented, excellent communication skills, ability to multi-task and manage expectations  *  LI-YahoosRocks

description: The self-driving car project aims to improve people’s lives by transforming mobility and making it easier and safer for everyone to get around, regardless of their ability to drive. So far, we’ve self-driven over 1 million miles and are currently out on the streets of Mountain View, California and Austin, Texas.  In this role, you’ll be on the front line of analyzing tagged issues to determine if and from whom they need attention. You’ll develop a wide breadth of knowledge about the team’s LIDAR software and hardware in order to identify bugs and communicate your recommendations to the engineering teams. You’ll maintain the status of known issues in the fleet, and work with the driving operations team to determine corrective action for issues as they arise. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: Do you wish that your work had a more direct impact on people? Are you excited about the potential of human genetics to make a real difference in the world? At 23andMe, we believe that we are one the cusp of huge advances in genetics, and that our unique database of over one million genotypes and over two hundred fifty million phenotype data points gives us an incredible opportunity to advance biomedical research and make discoveries about the genetics of complex disease. We are looking for a colleague with extensive training and experience in statistical genetics to join our highly productive, world-class research team. The successful candidate will work within and across teams to support our research efforts. The job requires strong statistics, computational skills, biological insight, and excellent writing. An ability to ask and understand the “so what” aspect of any finding is critical. Candidates for the senior statistical geneticist role should also have multiple years of experience playing a leadership role in genetic association studies and executing independently-developed ideas, as well as a demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and effectively with a wide range of audiences. See our recent publications here: https://www.23andme.com/for/scientists/ Responsibilities Design and execute a wide range of analyses for both internal and external customers. Work collaboratively with members of the research, product, and engineering teams to develop our research platform. For senior scientists: supervise, develop, and mentor junior scientists. Manage teams to execute complex projects. Requirements  Ph.D. in Statistics, Genetics, or a related field. Strong statistical skills. Research experience in statistics and genetics. Hands-on experience working with very large data sets in Python or R; experience with C/C++ is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Enthusiasm for working in a highly collaborative environment. About Us 23andMe, Inc. is the leading personal genetics company. Our mission is to help people access, understand and benefit from the human genome. 23andMe has over 1 million customers worldwide with over 80 percent consented to participate in research. 23andMe, Inc. is located in Mountain View, CA. More information is available at www.23andMe.com.

description: Job  :  Marketing / New Business Development  Primary Location  :  United States-California-Santa Clara County-Sunnyvale  Schedule  :  Full-time  Senior Director, Enterprise Analytics  -  160288  Description  Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority.  Position Overview: The idea of surgical robotics was little more than a curiosity until 1999, the year Intuitive Surgical introduced the  da Vinci  ® Surgical System. Today, Intuitive Surgical is the global leader in the rapidly emerging field of robotic-assisted minimally invasive surgery. Intuitive Surgical is also an industry leader in designing data capture from over  3,000  surgical robotics systems used by over  20,000  surgeons globally.  We are looking for an experienced leader to head up our growing Global Enterprise Analytics function and help to solve the most complex and pressing business problems in our company and industry. This role requires a combination of expertise across data, technology and analytics, as well as a strong vision for how analytics should work across the enterprise.  This is a unique opportunity to build out a team and data consumption roadmap for the company; partner with analysts around the company in building an analytics community; and evolve our data platforms that serve internal and external customers to help them answer their hardest data-driven questions.  Roles and Responsibilities: The Sr. Director, Enterprise Analytics must have a solid understanding of both the business and the technical aspects of our data program.. He/she sits at the nexus of (1) business partners, (2) engineering data infrastructure and curation teams, (3) Business Intelligence team responsible for our Enterprise Data Warehouse, and (4) other home-grown analytics teams. In essence, his/her job is to enable all functions to deliver actionable insights for internal and external customers in ways that delight and inspire confidence.  The successful candidate must possess a work style that promotes progress through collaborative teamwork in a dynamic environment. The candidate must relish the challenge of building and leading a data-centric solutions group, using the techniques of data science, visualization, communication, and collaboration. He/she must be able to balance the good and the better, embracing continuous improvement in data solutions and standards, while delivering actionable results within a scalable framework,.  Key Responsibilities: Oversee the vision, long range planning, prioritization, budgeting, and execution of data initiatives across the enterprise.  Lead the planning and successful migration/redesign of legacy reporting platform to new Enterprise Data Warehouse; coordinate with SAP/ERP Hana migration.  Partner with commercial/marketing teams to define and deliver data products/services to our external customers.  Define business engagement model aligned with internal stakeholders in collaboration with IT and engineering organizations.  Lead, mentor and grow Business Intelligence and Enterprise Analytics teams, attract top talent for multiple new openings.  Lead data architecture, engineering and business analysts to design best-in-class reporting, data mining and data visualization solutions.  Build out software development lifecycle processes that are adaptable to needs ranging from analytics ideation/experimentation to full product development.  Work cross-functionally with other technology teams and architects to ensure alignment and buy-in for common architecture and optimization of company’s technology investments. Ensure applications are instrumented with proper tracking mechanisms to enable analytics.  Establish Analytics Center of Excellence with charter to mature analytics capabilities and grow analyst community; raise awareness of data availability, provide statistical constructs, establish training curriculums and develop internal talent.  Lead small team of analysts and data scientists.  Support and influence data governance initiatives.  Develop a data science program focused on the exploitation of big data using cloud, business partnerships, and advanced tools and techniques for data analytics, mining and visualization.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications Include: Must enjoy spending time with various stakeholder teams (Marketing, Manufacturing, Finance, etc.) to develop a deep understanding of our company and customer’s data needs.  Possession of a unique blend of startup style "get-it-done" mentality as well as the rigor associated with mature software development processes.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to translate complex technical concepts into layman’s terms.  Proven ability to lead initiatives to define technical strategy in partnership with the cross-functional business and technology stakeholders.  Ability to manage multiple, conflicting, high priority requests from various functional teams and geographies.  Ability to break down complex business scenarios into actionable options/activities.  Ability to build consensus around common vision for program.  Provide strong leadership in cross functional/matrix setting.  Strong decision making skills based on objective criteria.  Ability to attract, recruit and retain high performing data/analytics deep staff.  Project management skill.  Budget management skill.  Skill/Job Requirements: 10+ yrs. experience with mix of business intelligence and advanced analytics and preferably 5+ years in health care industry. Excellent communication and presentation skills with ability to create and deliver presentations and reports to senior management and business partners  Executive presence and the ability to work well with all levels of an organization including technical and non-technical personnel;  Demonstrated experience across BI/Analytics technologies: relational data bases (Hana preferred); BI Tools (Business Objects, Tableau), Hadoop, R, SAS, Elastic Search, Web analytics platform, etc.  In depth knowledge of data integration concepts, approaches, and tools and the role of data architecture in successful implementation of data integration strategy;  Hands-on experience of metadata management and master data management concepts, approaches and tools. description: On January 6, 2016 we announced that Netflix was available around the world. In one instant, we turned on the service in more than 130 countries simultaneously. However, simply making the service available is not the last step. All associated tools and solutions need to continue to evolve to address this global scale. One example is our marketing technology, where we are focused on cutting edge digital marketing efforts founded in automation, big data, testing and associated analytics.   As an engineer for our marketing technology platforms, you will contribute to these efforts with a broad base of skills including the ability to create tools, automate solutions and debug complex advertising execution issues. The role is a balance of architectural oversight combined with a penchant for finding problems and devising solutions.   The role spans the continuum of digital execution from cutting edge dynamic serving and buying platforms all the way to sophisticated front-end applications across desktop, video and mobile environments. If you have worked in digital advertising (a big bonus!) you understand how day-to-day tasks shift, the environment is dynamic and while the problems are difficult, the rewards are satisfying.   As part of the Ad Technology team within the Netflix Product Engineering organization, you will work directly with world-class talent from teams including: digital marketing, data science, platform engineering and finance to develop innovative solutions that improve and optimize Netflix digital marketing tactics.   We embrace our high performance culture so we’re looking for a history of outstanding accomplishment and a willingness to lead in the face of ambiguity. If you like to think big, move fast and build cutting edge solutions with outstanding colleagues, we’d like to talk with you.   About you:   Netflix’s culture is unique and we are seeking an equally unique individual who can thrive in this fast-paced and ever-evolving environment. Some traits you possess that would point toward success in the role:  You enjoy autonomy and thrive when challenged with creating definition out of ambiguity. You like variety, experimentation and challenging existing assumptions. You love working with a team that spans world-class engineers, scientists and digital marketers. When the tools and systems you use are sub-optimal, you are not content until you find a solution. Your express concepts -- both written and verbally -- with clarity and comprehensiveness. You possess tenacity, determination and are not intimidated by hard problems and new challenges. You like risk and are accountable when you fail (and we encourage you to innovate to the point of failure). Requirements:  3+ years of web-related experience in software development or devops in a large-scale production environment. Designing, developing and enhancing tools / solutions to automate data analysis and business insights (Java, Python, Pig, SQL, Kibana). Building / debugging front-end web solutions (JavaScript, HTML5, Pixel tracking). Implementing API solutions (REST, SOAP). Familiarity with relational and non relational database systems (Hive, Elasticsearch, Druid).Experience working in a Distributed/Cloud-based environment (Amazon EC2, Google Cloud Storage, etc.). Experience analyzing and processing log files, large data sets and related data visualization. Not required but nice to have:  Experience developing solutions for display or search advertising. Familiarity with the inefficiencies of the ad ops space and a desire to improve them. Experience working with elements of the digital advertising tech ecosystem: adserver (DoubleClick, Atlas etc.), DSPs, DMPs, bidded social buying, etc. Our culture is unique so it's worth determining if you are inspired by our values: Netflix Culture

description: Robotics is a growing area, as advances in perception and manipulation enable more complex interactions between robots and the environment. Our group is dedicated to making robots more accessible for real-world applications and finding places where they can help relieve people from tedious tasks.  As a robot and physics simulation engineer, you possess strong C/C++ skills, and are excited about making robots significantly more capable at performing useful tasks in real environments. In a team of software engineers, roboticists and control engineers, you are expected to implement a physics simulator for robot and machine learning applications. Responsibilities  Work closely with the rest of the team to implement a physics engine for robot applications.  Work with physical robots to validate that the physics engine generates physically correct data.  Collaborate with machine learning experts who will use the physics engine to generate training data.  Participate in end-to-end testing from writing unit, functional and integration tests, to running code on physical robots.  Develop technical roadmaps and project plans, and translate project management goals into appropriate testable targets.  Minimum Qualifications  Experience with implementing or deploying components for physics engines (Bullet, ODE, Vortex, PhysX, Newton, Abaqus, etc.).  Experience with physical robots, and particularly, robot arms.  Programming experience in C++.  Experience prioritizing and managing across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience and knowledge in the domain of compliant contact modeling.  Experience and knowledge with parameter estimation of dynamic robot models and statistical analysis.  Knowledge or experience in the domains of cloud computing and parallel computing systems.  Machine learning skills (e.g., reinforcement learning for robot tasks).  Expertise in robot motion control (e.g., force/torque control, position control).  Exceptional organizational, communication, and leadership skills.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: As a Cloud System Architect, you will be responsible for system design and implementation of our cloud services including but not limited to Wildfire, URL filtering, and autofocus. You will be one of the key members deciding what/how data needs to be collected and analyzed and what direction our product is going to take. The work also involves making sure the right platform and technology is used , working with development team to design and implement it and working across multiple teams such as product manager, malware researchers and data scientists.  If you are a motivated, creative, passionate, team-player, hands on and hard working individual who wants to contribute and make a difference, we would love to talk to you.  Responsibilities: Review our current architecture and proposed new architecture for our hyperscale computing cloud services. Review our non-functional requirements such as high availability, response time, scalability and provide solutions to satisfy them. Review our data model and decide if/how we should collect more data; how we can improve our data model to have a more efficient system and reduce manual processes. Analyze existing systems and provide models to explain their behaviors and pro-actively identify components that need review and redesign. Work with devops to make sure there are tools in place for monitoring the system, and log management to effectively handle incidents. Review our data engineering models and data ingestion pipelines Work directly with our research teams to build tools for massive data set analysis. Requirements:  Can-do attitude on problem solving, quality and ability to execute. 8+ years work experience in hands on development. Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills. Experience in environment with hyperscale requirement. Experience in architecture and designs in environment with several moving components and hundreds of terabytes of data. Experience with large data processing tools such as Hadoop, Hbase, Cassandra, Elastic-search, Kafka. Hands-on with great OO programming skills. Previous experience working with data scientists is a plus.  About Palo Alto Networks Palo Alto Networks is the next-generation security company, leading a new era in cybersecurity by safely enabling applications and preventing cyber breaches for tens of thousands of organizations worldwide. Built with an innovative approach and highly differentiated cyberthreat prevention capabilities, our game-changing security platform delivers security far superior to legacy or point products, safely enables daily business operations, and protects an organization's most valuable assets. Find out more at www.paloaltonetworks.com.  Fast Facts  Serve more than 26,000 customers in over 140 countries across multiple industries. Almost half of the Global 2000 that rely on Palo Alto Networks to improve their cybersecurity posture. Fiscal year 2015 revenue was $928.1 million, a 55% year over year growth that significantly outpaced the industry Ranked an enterprise firewall market leader by Gartner in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 (published April 2015). dded more than 1,000 customers per quarter for the last 15 consecutive quarters. Partnered with elite IT leaders such as VMware, Citrix, Splunk, and Symantec. Earned the TSIA Outstanding rating (2015) for commitment to customer support and the STAR Award for innovation (2014) in the delivery of excellent support. Named best place to work by the Silicon Valley Business Journal. 2,600+ employees worldwide. Global support organization with teams in the Americas, EMEA, Asia, and Japan. IPO July 2012; stock symbol on the NYSE: PANW. For more information, please visit www.paloaltonetworks.com .  #LI-KB1

Experience with authentication and authorization systems or certificate management.  Experience with quality-audited environments that use traceable requirements, design documents, and test-plans.  Knowledge of National Airspace System (NAS).  Able to define and execute an ambiguous project: identify requirements, explore concepts, design, then implement solutions.  Willing to design and write software developed according to a rigorous process. description: Job Description: Supervise the work of laboratory personnel engaged in performing routine and specialized technical procedures, including planning laboratory work, evaluating work performed and handling procedural and technical laboratory problems. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. description: Associate Scientist - Protein Purification & Characterization-BIO004520  Description  Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.  Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.  We are looking for a talented protein purification and analytical biochemist to purify and carry out extensive characterization of recombinant proteins and monoclonal antibodies expressed within the Protein Sciences Department at Merck Palo Alto.   Candidates should have hands on experience in protein purification. Candidates must be knowledgeable in protein purification, analytical, and biophysical characterization methods such as HPLC (SEC, IEX, RP), capillary electrophoresis, cIEF, dynamic and static light scattering, DSC. Ability to analyze, interpret, and effectively present data at group and departmental meetings is required. description: Summer Intern: Research Assistant/ Programmer – Location: Newark, CA Headquartered in Newark, CA, Triple Ring Technologies is an innovative technology and product development company that partners with clients to deliver complete solutions from conceptual design through product launch. Our highly interdisciplinary team includes senior professionals from industry, finance, and academia, with extensive experience in medical device, life science, clean tech, security, and industrial technologies. We both challenge and rely upon each other for technical excellence and for real-world engineering and commercial wisdom. To apply for this position, please go online to http://tripleringtech.com/AU_careers.html  What you will learn: Research and Development processes Conduct research in an industrial setting Develop a new software tool Work on a code base with multiple developers Verification and Validation of software tool Job Summary In this role you will work with the X-ray and Imaging Group and you will assist to develop and validate our new simulation platform. Our simulation platform is based on a Monte Carlo simulation package developed by CERN and is used for explosive detection using X-rays and for verifying dose in e-beam sterilization. You will help to acquire data with our in-house X-ray equipment and at an e-beam sterilization company. You will customize our tool to perform simulations reproducing experimental results. You will work closely with Triple Ring Technologies' engineers and scientists in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. You must have hands on experience in data analysis using tools such as Matlab and you must be familiar with C++. Understanding of ionizing radiation is a plus. Responsibilities Development and documentation of code Develop and execute an experimental plan Document findings Education, Experience and Skills Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Bioengineering, Physics or equivalent Experience in programming Triple Ring Technologies is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration with regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

description: Do you spend your time thinking about simple, elegant code? Are you a highly skilled software engineer who wants to build useful tools, web services, and APIs? Do you long for a chance to make it easier to consume, process, and understand data? Are you an expert in python, but often feel like dabbling in new languages when it makes sense?   We are seeking a talented software engineer to work on the tools and microservices that make up our big data platform. Netflix is ingesting hundreds of terabytes of data a day and has petabytes of data in the data warehouse. We work hard to build a platform that allows our data scientists to deal with this data at scale. But that isn't the only way that we need to interact with the data. This is where you come in. Whether it is building tools to allow for better exploration and visualization of the data, creating services to help coordinate work on the platform, or dreaming up new ways to write software that is simple yet powerful, we have a lot of hard, exciting problems to solve and many smart people to work with while we make Netflix the best place to enjoy movies and TV worldwide.   This is your dream job if you:   Value simplicity and clarity in design. Our engineering strongly reflects this value Want to build a platform to solve interesting data problems Pride yourself on being an expert software engineer Love to build software in the cloud Desire to be constantly learning new things and can make good forward thinking judgments about new technology Have a BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or related field   Technologies we use:   Python, plus other languages where it makes sense Pandas, numpy, scipy, cherrypy among other useful python libraries Git for source control The right technologies for the problem at hand. We're flexible and open to rapid change

description: Project Wing is working on self-flying vehicles that could open up entirely new approaches to delivering goods and services—including options that are cheaper, faster, less wasteful and more environmentally sensitive than what’s possible today. Project Wing is a part of X.  The Project Wing team is developing an aerial delivery system based on self-flying aircraft (UAVs) operating in commercial air space.  As an engineer for Project Wing, you have excellent technical education and experience in estimation and perception techniques, simulation, and multi-modal sensor fusion. You have an outstanding track record of successful development of complex sensing and perception solutions from concept through successful deployment of technology into the marketplace. You have a proven ability to work within teams of highly talented, diverse engineers through solving tough technology problems that enable valuable business solutions.  Your primary responsibility includes developing the navigation and perception solutions that enable safe and reliable operation of self-flying aircraft in close proximity to people, terrain, buildings, and other ground obstructions. You are skilled at collaborating with cross-disciplinary team members to invent and create efficient technological solutions with creative and prolific skill. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive technology development at Google speed. Responsibilities  Create innovative, reliable, and efficient navigation and perception solutions to enable new and challenging aircraft capabilities.  Work with multidisciplinary engineering teams to identify solutions and take them from concept to production.  Participate in and support testing and integration efforts for the navigation and perception systems.  Perform detailed analyses of system designs and test data, communicating the results to the Project Wing team and external partners and agencies.  Minimum Qualifications  MS degree in Robotics, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience working with visual odometry, visual SLAM or other techniques, involving optimal estimation of camera motion or scene geometry from imagery with aerial or ground vehicles. Experience programming in C/C++. Experience in estimation, dynamics, and controls.  Preferred Qualifications  5 years of experience working with multiple of the skills listed as minimum qualifications.  2 years of industry experience working with multiple of the skills listed as minimum qualifications.  Experience with one or more of the following: visual/inertial integration, aerial image registration, point cloud processing, path planning.  Experience specifying, selecting, and integrating cameras and other sensors.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].
jobtitle: Computer Vision Engineer, Guidance Navigation and Control (Wing), X

description: This position will oversee the scientific, technical, regulatory, and compliance components of outsourced nonclinical studies including pharmacology, pharmacokinetic, pharmacodynamic, bioanalytical, and toxicology studies to support small and large molecule drug development from concept stages through registration and post-marketing. Essential Functions Initiate and ensure timely CRO selection, approval of service agreements, work /change orders, track accruals per approved budgets, ensure timely invoice and payments per Jazz SOPs Manage study plans (bids, study outlines, scopes of work, protocols, analysis plans), timelines, deliverables, reviews, approvals and submissions. Study protocol generation and finalization support, exchange of information and test material/samples between sponsor and CRO, data analysis, visualization (graphing), reporting, and presentation to support Jazz Early Development staff. Monitor and review deliverables for completeness, regulatory compliance, and scientific integrity. Prepare and/or QC documents for major and routine/minor regulatory submissions. Management and archival of critical documents, samples, and specimens in collaboration with responsible Jazz team members by establishing and maintaining a physical and online file structure to store and track study related documents Manage central study scheduler for all studies funded by Early Development including nonclinical studies at the academic laboratories funded by Jazz Medical Affairs Proficient knowledge in GLP and GCLP guidelines, Maintain current knowledge of the ICH and regional nonclinical guidances. Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Excellent analytical skills with experience in preclinical data analysis. - Must be detail oriented with strong documentation and organizational skills. Ability to work effectively independently and in cross-functional teams, with scientists at all levels and from various organizations, both academic and industry colleagues, to move projects forward in a timely manner and delivering high quality work products Experience identifying specialized contract laboratories, sourcing and managing. Experience facing inspections by regulatory agencies, a plus Study and/or Project Management experience; PMP certification a plus. Proven ability to oversee CRO's and consultants Experience with GLP and GCLP requirements preferred. Proven ability to work independently and be self-motivated. Strong working knowledge of MS Office, MS Project and GraphPad Prism. Excellent written and oral communication skills Excellent contingency planning and time management skills Ability to think critically and solve problems Ability to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, highly-matrixed work environment Embody and model Jazz core values Required/Preferred Education and Licenses This position requires a Bachelors or Master’s degree in biological sciences and 5-8 years of related experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry/CRO experience. Description of Physical Demands Routine mobility within office environment. Routine sitting for extended periods of time. Significant travel to oversee outsourced activities. Operating a computer, printer, telephone and other similar office machinery. Description of Work Environment Work indoors in normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, fumes, vibrations and temperature changes. Routine computer use at workstation. May move from one work location to another occasionally. Responsibilities may require a work schedule that may include working outside of “normal” work hours, in order to meet business demands. Public contact requiring appropriate business apparel. Travel expected.  Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender-identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.

description: Be part of a cell biology team advancing regenerative medicine therapies for CNS diseases.   SanBio is seeking a talented Scientist II to play an important role in the company’s scientific and clinical programs. This position will work with a small team of dedicated neuro- and cell biologists to generate gene expression profiling data instrumental in characterizing the company’s regenerative cell-based product, as well as in discovering its mechanisms of action. The candidate is expected to possess a strong quantitative and analytical background, and demonstrate experience with the use of commercial and open-source bioinformatics software and open-source databases. The candidate should also possess hands-on laboratory experience and familiarity with classical molecular biology techniques (such as RNA, DNA purification and quantification, tissue or cell sample preparation, qPCR, gel electrophoresis, etc)   Independence, leadership, creativity, strong analytical skills, and attention to details are qualities necessary to excel in this position.   This scientist will be responsible for generating microarray data, data mining, building the database, interpreting results, designing and conducting follow up studies, monitoring scientific literature and bringing new technologies in house, as well as communicating findings to the team.   Information and details can be found on the Company website and via the following link to scientific publications:  http://www.san-bio.com  http://www.san-bio.com/news/publications.php   Essential Job Functions and responsibilities:  • Identify best methodologies and vendors for conducting gene/miRNA expression profiling studies.  • Prepare and manage sample submissions  • Analyze and interpret results  • Conduct statistical analyses  • Prepare visual presentations of data  • Conduct validation studies using qRT-PCR  • Design and conduct follow up in-depth studies of pathways.  • Identify technology that is worth bringing in house to efficiently conduct testing of preclinical samples.  • Monitor scientific literature and plan, discuss and implement new experiments and procedures.  • Provide supervision, training, and assistance to others when needed.   Requirements  • PhD in Biological Sciences or Computational Biology with strong quantitative background, involving the analysis of large scale complex data such as next generation sequencing, microarrays, etc., with at least 2 years of experience, or Master’s degree with at least 10 years of experience.  • The ideal candidates will have solid background in biology/molecular biology, bioinformatics and statistics  • Candidate must be able to effectively interpret the analysis results within biological context.   Additional requirements include:  • Proficient with tools and open source software related to data analysis such as gene expression, pathway identification, variants calling, copy number variation identification, structural variants identification, gene fusion, allele specific gene expression, novel transcripts, etc.   SanBio offers a competitive base and incentive compensation package. The Company provides an array of benefits to promote a healthy and creative work environment for its team members. SanBio is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description: Start your career with us today and make a big impact on healthcare! Our college recruiting program is the gateway for your entry into the exciting world of molecular diagnostics by enabling you to put your academic training and passion to work for a global company whose products impact healthcare every day.   As a Product Development Intern, you will have an opportunity to gain professional experience in product testing and understand how a product gets transferred from R&D; to Manufacturing.   The estimated duration is 3 months in length. The internship will be 40 hours a week in the summer months.   Responsibilities:  You will collaborate with the R&D; Engineers and R&D; Scientists to test new product designs, work with biological samples, and suggest improvements to product design to help assure that product quality meets FDA requirements. You will also assist in issue investigation, data analysis, and report write-ups. You will learn the fundamentals of FDA requirements for medical device testing, acquire hands-on experience with clinical sample test designs and methods, and learn how to use data analysis software. The candidate may also work with other cross-functional groups develop and refine Cepheid’s products. description: At Netflix, we don't just deal with huge scale, we deal with a huge diversity of scale. We run thousands of applications on our back-end cloud systems. We serve hundreds of thousands of TV shows and movies to millions of customers across millions of devices, distributed across thousands of device families, all of which are constantly evolving and changing.   The Real-Time Analytics group at Netflix builds systems which continuously use diverse telemetry sources within our environment to sift through millions of signals and arrive at actionable, high-confidence decisions about what's going on in our environment, and what we should do about it. Some work we've already talked about publicly (and would like to open-source) includes:   Noticing when one out of thousands of servers is misbehaving based on Outlier Detection and automatically replacing it with a new server; Automatically detecting whether new code deployed to production is at least as performant and correct as baseline code, and either accelerating deployment globally or rolling it back For more details, take a look at our talk at AWS re: Invent.   We see huge opportunities for using RTA decisions to drive automated systems, both to improve our ecosystem's self-healing capabilities, but also to make it easier for engineers to understand what's most important for them to look at, automatically deduce correlation and causation, and notice the most minute, imperceptible changes in our streaming environment before our customers do.   What You’ll Be Doing   You’ll be the lead software engineer working with data scientists, data engineers and application developers across the entire company to design and build an anomaly detection platform on top of both real-time streaming and batch data You’ll accelerate the team’s research and product development by creating reusable components and services in the machine learning space, so we can can quickly implement new algorithms, compute pipelines, and persistence stores You’ll build services for end users to enable feedback for supervised learning, adaptive modeling, and evaluation of algorithms You’ll scale out the platform to thousands of predictions per minute, and be the go-to person in our team for running our analytics on internal stream processing systems and other batch compute engines like Spark and Elastic MapReduce   What You’ll Bring   Time series analysis is second nature to you. You have a background in quantitative analysis, machine learning or large data sets. Ideally, you’ve worked with operational or system level metrics before You’re highly proficient in Java/Scala and OOP design patterns, and are comfortable with scripting languages like Python and R You’ve written services at scale. You take pride in prior platforms you’ve designed processing thousands of events per second in production You’re excited to design a real-time, distributed system from the ground up. You’ve engineered protocols, designed micro services, optimized data schemas in both key value and relational data stores, and applied the lambda architecture to solve problems in both batch and stream processing You're biased to action, and believe in iterating quickly to solve hard problems You thrive in an open culture where you’ll have autonomy, be empowered to define your own technical solutions, and have the opportunity to collaborate with smart co-workers   Added Bonus   You've worked with AWS technologies You have proficiency in the Apache Hadoop stack, and have written applications on top of big data platforms like Spark, Hive, Mesos and Storm
jobtitle: Senior Software Engineer - Real Time Analytics

description: This position is for a Senior System Engineer to support the specification, development, validation, deployment, and support of high performance computer systems. The System Engineer will carry an array of responsibilities and emphases, working with a multi-disciplinary team of software and hardware architects and engineers, manufacturing engineers, service teams, and customer-facing groups to define, specify, integrate, bring-up, validate, debug, tune, support customer system acceptance, and ongoing engineering support of deployed systems. The successful System Engineer is involved with software and hardware efforts, and possesses a broad set of skills and capabilities across the board.   Responsibilities:  Lead task teams, driving/guiding team efforts, provides effective communication, and documents results Execute project management tasks including ODM design, validation, and system integration Coordinate and deliver hardware and software features and functionality Drive and execute technical efforts, system bring-up/validation, system level performance analysis Define BIOS parameters and configuration Drive and contribute to the development of next generation system specifications and designs Track and drive the resolution of issues, execute hands-on testing and debugging to root cause Recommend, design, develop, and implement system management solutions and improvements Create documentation, system specifications, test plans, test reports, and customer instructions System performance tuning of high speed data channels in large scale systems Programming and scripting of automated test cases and system performance data collection  Requirements:  BSEE (or equivalent experience) plus 10+ years working in computer system design, test, and support, with systems engineering experience. Knowledge of computer architecture and high performance computer systems and networks preferred. Familiar with key PC bus protocols such as PCIe, SAS/SATA and I2C Solid system diagnostic skills and must have a good understanding of Intel CPUs, SMBIOS, BMC, PSU and Power Distribution. Experience in task leadership, guiding a multi-faceted teams assembled from various internal and external organizations Experience in leading technical system integration projects with worldwide ODMs is desirable Knowledge and experience with Linux/Unix operating systems, file systems, networking Knowledge and experience with high speed signal integrity design is a plus Knowledge of basic board designing using Orcad and Allegro is a plus Excellent written and oral communication skills are necessary. Some travel required About Cray: Global supercomputing leader Cray Inc. (Nasdaq: CRAY) provides innovative systems and solutions enabling scientists and engineers in industry, academia and government to meet existing and future simulation and analytics challenges. Leveraging more than 40 years of experience in developing and servicing the world’s most advanced supercomputers, Cray offers a comprehensive portfolio of supercomputers and big data storage and analytics solutions delivering unrivaled performance, efficiency and scalability. Cray’s Adaptive Supercomputing vision is focused on delivering innovative next-generation products that integrate diverse processing technologies into a unified architecture, allowing customers to meet the market’s continued demand for realized performance. With Cray’s relaxed work environment and amazing benefits, take the initiative to join a company of dedicated innovators. Your next is now at Cray.   We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

description: Exponent is a leading engineering and scientific consulting firm. Our multidisciplinary team of scientists, engineers, physicians, and regulatory consultants brings together more than 90 different disciplines to solve complicated problems facing corporations, insurers, government entities, associations and individuals. Our approximately 900 staff members work in 26 offices across the United States and abroad. Exponent has over 700 consultants, including more than 425 that have earned a doctorate in their chosen field of specialization.  Exponent’s Technology Development Practice assists our clients with the delivery of innovation from concept to functional systems and prototypes. Drawing on our multidisciplinary engineering, prototyping, testing, custom production, and failure analysis expertise, we build solutions that integrate the best available technology from the commercial world with in-house development to quickly address our clients’ capability gaps. Exponent has been a successful provider of conceptually innovative and urgently required solutions to the U.S. Department of Defense and international defense community for over a decade. Today, Technology Development continues to support defense industry clients as well as the broader Exponent client base including the transportation, oil and gas, consumer electronic, and medical device industries.  The Technology Development Practice is currently hiring an Associate with expertise in Machine Learning, Data Analytics, and Software Development. This position will be located at Exponent’s headquarters in Menlo Park, CA – in and amongst the Silicon Valley technology sector. The Menlo Park facility houses over 150 consultants in addition to Exponent’s executive management team. The office serves as a hub for nearly all Exponent practice areas making it a natural center for large client engagements and inter-practice/interdisciplinary project work. The facility includes extensive laboratory space outfitted with advanced analytical equipment including imaging equipment (SEM, STEM, x-ray, and CT), chemical analysis equipment (FTIR, GC-MS), specialized combustion and environmental test chambers, an optics laboratory, and a machine shop. For Technology Development, there is a dedicated prototyping laboratory as well as secure office and laboratory space for project work requiring a higher level of confidentiality or security.  This position requires innovative problem solvers who can help rapidly analyze, develop, and prototype algorithms for classification and anomaly detection, time series analysis, knowledge discovery, image processing, and network analysis. Training and coursework in cyber security is a plus. The primary work will revolve around helping Exponent’s team implement safeguards and software systems to enhance security and mitigate risk from both physical and cyber threats. Supported clients are expected to include commercial businesses in the Silicon Valley and beyond, Defense agencies, and other Federal agencies responsible for safeguarding National security assets and infrastructure.  Qualifications for this position include: M.S. or Ph.D. in Statistics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related engineering/scientific field (such as Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics, Bioinformatics or Computational Biology)  Demonstrated experience and expertise in one or more of the following areas:  ? Bayesian statistics  Machine learning  Natural Language Processing  Proficiency with C#, C++, PocketPC, WinXP, Linux (RH 7+), and Visual Studio is preferred  Experience with Java, JDCB, SQL, web services, and OGC (WMS/WFS) is preferred  Experience developing software for a range of platforms (PCs, PDAs, embedded devices, etc.) is preferred  Experience with network routing, GPS (1PPS, SiRF), and/or device drivers is a plus  Strong practical engineering ability combined with leadership and project management skills  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Ability to work independently and in multidisciplinary teams  Our contracts with the United States Government for this position require proof of U.S. citizenship and the possession of or ability to obtain a U.S. DoD Security Clearance  We are an Affirmative Action, Equal Employment Opportunity, Veterans and Disabled Employer.
