description: We’re looking for a Director of Product Innovation to lead our efforts at creating the best video recommendation system in the world. You care deeply about the user experience, resulting in many clear hypotheses for potential improvements to our recommendation algorithms that you can naturally group into areas of opportunity. You will craft, communicate and execute a strategy to advance these areas, leveraging data available as much as possible to inform and explain your choices. You will lead cross-functional teams of software and research engineers, mathematicians, data scientists, and statisticians. You know advanced mathematical modeling and analysis, particularly some combination of probabilistic modeling, statistics, optimization and machine learning, so deeply that you are well aware they are just tools to solve problems rather than being an end in themselves. You naturally gravitate towards experimentation as a way to validate your hypotheses while having a healthy skepticism when interpreting experimental results.  The Director of Product Innovation may come from a wide range of backgrounds: perhaps someone who has led algorithmic innovation for a successful software company, or a pragmatic academic with experience modeling and experimenting with complex systems and in computer science. Important for the role is the technical bent to work with world-class engineers, the statistical acumen to collaborate with top-notch data scientists and the business sense to drive product goals and strategies. Demonstrated ability to build successful consumer facing applications and algorithms, and a strong feel for movie/TV content are big pluses.  The opportunity for huge wins awaits: to date, Netflix has amassed billions of play events and movie ratings and tens of millions of categorical preferences to fuel personalized movie and TV suggestions.This presents endless algorithmic possibilities to delight tens of millions of people across the world with high-quality video recommendations.  A couple of things worth knowing: You won’t have any direct reports. Instead you will have the freedom to focus on the “big picture” while orchestrating the work of impressive teams. Our culture is a bit unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix at www.netflix.com/Jobs.
snippet: You will lead cross-functional teams of software and research engineers, mathematicians, data scientists, and statisticians....

description: Hi,We are looking for Scientist DMPK for one of our clients in CA. . Kindly go through the below job opening and let me know your interest. Please send updated resume in word format along with pay rate .Job Title : Scientist DMPKLocation :  Mountain View,CAClient : AstraZeneca & MedImmuneDuration : 6 Months ContractJOB SUMMARY Scientist I or II with strong research skills in Cell-Mediated Immunology (CMI) and analytical development focused on the pipeline of biological candidates (infectious diseases, vaccines, oncology, RIA). The ideal candidate would be a skilled scientist who has direct experience in the application of CMI bioanalytical development with expertise in cell-based assays for understanding immunological responses to pathogens, foreign antigens and vaccines, for support of epidemiologic studies and biomarker discovery. Candidate must have experience working in a matrixed organization supporting the implementation of analytical methods that meet the needs of cross-functional teams (i.e. Product Development Team). Critical to this position is the ability to support the transition of methods from development into fit-for-use assays (qualified and/or validated) that can be used to make program decisions. The scope of responsibility includes moving a method into a GLP testing environment by leading the scientific and compliance aspects required for full implementation and testing. Implementation includes internal and external technology transfer, data management (quality and compliance), assay performance monitoring, generation of critical reagents, etc. Skills & Qualifications: - A degree in a related area is required, an advanced degree is preferred; - Relevant experience in industry (preferred) or academia: Scientist I: PhD 0-3; Scientist II, PhD 3-7; - Experience and strong knowledge of biomedical data analysis techniques to interpret results; - Experience in bioanalytical assay development (qualification and validation) and performance monitoring, technology transfer, data analysis and its application to pathogen detection, immune profiling, virus characterization; - Familiarity with the application of advanced technology as an R&D; tool for advancing pipeline candidate drugs; - Familiarity with the integration of an analytical method into a GLP compliant environment; - Strong critical thinking skills; - Strong communication (oral & written) skills; - Demonstrated ability to effectively work in teams, both departmental and cross-functional. Responsibilities: - Communicates key scientific, technical and operational issues to members of Translational Sciences, Clinical Operations and Clinical subteams. - Contribute to the overall strategic planning and prioritization of biomarker studies supporting pipeline candidate drug development; - Coordinate and lead staff to deliver key technologies, systems and processes to support assay development, validation and clinical testing including data management (bioinformatics, proteomics, data analysis, curve fitting, etc.) and compliance systems; - Interface and provide scientific leadership as Subject Matter Expert with multiple internal stakeholders and teams within R&D; - Coordinate technology/methods transfer to external collaborators and CROs; - Establish collaborations with internal customers (cross departmental/therapeutic areas); - Establish external collaborations (academic, industry) that support new technology and pipeline development; - Develop SOPs, data transfer specification forms, Corrective Actions and Preventative Actions; - Effectively present results of work in internal and external meetings.Required experience:validation and clinical testing including data management (bioinformatics, proteomics,data analysis: 3 years

description: The self-driving car project aims to improve people’s lives by transforming mobility and making it easier and safer for everyone to get around, regardless of their ability to drive. So far, we’ve self-driven over 1 million miles and are currently out on the streets of Mountain View, California and Austin, Texas.  As a Systems Engineer, you will help revolutionize the safety and efficiency of personal mobility as part of a team developing self-driving cars. You will help us build the right products and rigorously stress those products so they do not fail our customers. Responsibilities  Identify, document, and organize planning and prediction requirements that are useful to implementing engineers, and that form the basis of a robust test program.  Work with software team to architect the planning and prediction systems, and their interactions with other subsystems. Define the key interfaces.  Perform trade studies to inform design decisions.  Define how the planner and prediction team knows their software is "done", that it is safe for a given environment. Track progress toward completion, and suggest priorities for accelerating progress. This includes identifying, prioritizing, and designing mitigations for technical risks.  Develop test approaches and software and hardware tools to efficiently exercise these systems, and provide easily-understood feedback to developers. Develop specific test procedures and analyze test results.  Minimum Qualifications  BS degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Controls, or equivalent practical experience.  Experience figuring out how to make systems fail in ways that help engineers improve their designs.  Experience with high-performance engineering and operations team, including developing consensus in the face of technical disagreements.  Data analysis skills (e.g. matplotlib or MATLAB).  Preferred Qualifications  Graduate degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Controls, or equivalent experience.  Experience on engineering teams.  Experience designing, implementing, and/or testing complex multidisciplinary systems and/or safety-critical systems.  Linux proficiency. Python and C++ programming skills.  Careful and detailed approach to safety-related planning, testing, and documentation.  High social intelligence, and a sense of humor.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: SRI’s Poulter Laboratory performs research and development in the areas of explosive loading and effects, shock physics, and high rate structural mechanics and material response.   Poulter Laboratory is currently seeking a Research Engineer/Scientist with a MS or PhD in mechanical engineering or physics. The Research Engineer will be required to design explosive blast and fragment impact type experiments and analyze the resulting experimental data, as well as manage project budgets and technician staff to perform the experimental work.   Desired areas of expertise include:  structural dynamics, high pressure loading, stress wave propagation, and familiarity with instrumentation and data acquisition systems to make experimental measurements related to pressure, temperature, acceleration, and strain associated with explosive and fragment testing.   Qualifications  MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering or Physics. New grads are welcome to apply, experience is a plus. Due to government requirements candidates must be a US citizen with the ability to obtain/maintain a security clearance, current active secret clearance a plus. R&D; experimental work a plus Blast experience a plus Computational or modeling blast fragments experience a plus  Other Requirements  --Ability to transfer/obtain/maintain a U.S. government security clearance required. See http://www.dss.mil/psmo-i/ps_faqs.html  --U.S. Citizenship required.   EOE/AA  SRI International is an EEO/AA employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status.   Background Check  Employment with SRI International is contingent upon the satisfactory completion of a background check.

description: Cell-Mediated Immunology (CMI) and analytical development focused on the pipeline of biological candidates (infectious diseases, vaccines, oncology, RIA). The ideal candidate would be a skilled scientist who has direct experience in the application of CMI bioanalytical development with expertise in cell-based assays for understanding immunological responses to pathogens, foreign antigens and vaccines, for support of epidemiologic studies and biomarker discovery. Candidate must have experience working in a matrixed organization supporting the implementation of analytical methods that meet the needs of cross-functional teams (i.e. Product Development Team). Critical to this position is the ability to support the transition of methods from development into fit-for-use assays (qualified and/or validated) that can be used to make program decisions. The scope of responsibility includes moving a method into a GLP testing environment by leading the scientific and compliance aspects required for full implementation and testing. Implementation includes internal and external technology transfer, data management (quality and compliance), assay performance monitoring, generation of critical reagents, etc. Skills & Qualifications: - A degree in a related area is required, an advanced degree is preferred; - Relevant experience in industry (preferred) or academia: Scientist I: PhD 0-3; Scientist II, PhD 3-7; - Experience and strong knowledge of biomedical data analysis techniques to interpret results; - Experience in bioanalytical assay development (qualification and validation) and performance monitoring, technology transfer, data analysis and its application to pathogen detection, immune profiling, virus characterization; - Familiarity with the application of advanced technology as an R&D; tool for advancing pipeline candidate drugs; - Familiarity with the integration of an analytical method into a GLP compliant environment; - Strong critical thinking skills; - Strong communication (oral & written) skills; - Demonstrated ability to effectively work in teams, both departmental and cross-functional. Responsibilities: - Communicates key scientific, technical and operational issues to members of Translational Sciences, Clinical Operations and Clinical subteams. - Contribute to the overall strategic planning and prioritization of biomarker studies supporting pipeline candidate drug development; - Coordinate and lead staff to deliver key technologies, systems and processes to support assay development, validation and clinical testing including data management (bioinformatics, proteomics, data analysis, curve fitting, etc.) and compliance systems; - Interface and provide scientific leadership as Subject Matter Expert with multiple internal stakeholders and teams within R&D; - Coordinate technology/methods transfer to external collaborators and CROs; - Establish collaborations with internal customers (cross departmental/therapeutic areas); - Establish external collaborations (academic, industry) that support new technology and pipeline development; - Develop SOPs, data transfer specification forms, Corrective Actions and Preventative Actions; - Effectively present results of work in internal and external meetings.Thanks and Regards,SatishRequired experience:Experience in bioanalytical assay development (qualification and validation): 5 years

description: Scientist, Protein Characterization-BIO004519  Description  Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.  Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.  Scientist, Protein Analytical Characterization  We are looking for an experienced protein analytical biochemist to carry out extensive analytical characterization of recombinant proteins and monoclonal antibodies to support Biologics Discovery research at Merck Palo Alto.  Candidates must have deep and broad knowledge of protein analytical technology including chromatographic and biophysical characterization methods such as HPLC (SEC, IEX, RP), capillary electrophoresis, cIEF, DLS, SEC-MALS, DSC/DSF,.. Ability to write internal reports and give presentations on technical and scientific findings is required. The candidate will must have very strong attention to details and ability to maintain accurate records. Experience with high-throughput analytical characterization methods and automation is preferred. Experience with protein and antibody purification is preferred. Experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry is preferred  Qualifications  Education:  Required: BS Preferred: MS  Required:  Solid and proven theoretical basis and hands-on experience in protein purification and analytical characterization Ability to analyze, interpret and effectively present data at group and departmental meetings is required. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential Strong organizational skills  Preferred:  Experience with high-throughput analytical characterization methods and automation Experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry  Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives. description: Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.  The UX (User Experience) Team at Project Aura develops concepts, designs, user interfaces, user experiences, input and output devices, and interaction techniques. We are a highly motivated team that works in a fast paced environment. We prototype with paper, clay, screens, video, software and hardware, depending on the needs. We work both with near-term products to support and inform product decision, as well as, with experiments, explorations, and longer term R&D; efforts. We have a diverse team of UX/UI/sound/motion/product designers, interaction/UX researchers, software engineers, UX prototypers and research scientists. Not only is our team very interdisciplinary, we also work closely and organically, for example, with industrial design, product design engineering, mechanical engineering, optics, marketing and the software and hardware teams.  As a Software Engineer in our UX team, you will have a critical role in synthesizing concepts into functional prototypes of different fidelity. We’d like you to bring the most innovative product concepts to life to help us push the boundaries of user interface design across a new category of products.  You'll partner with our designers, researchers and engineers to define and deliver new features, test new concepts and assist with final implementation. You work both independently and collaboratively in your projects, and will interface members across the organization. You will use your experience to drive medium to large-sized tasks and projects while exercising considerable independent judgment and discretion. Responsibilities  Deliver innovative, engaging prototypes using the latest software technologies.  Design and build advanced apps for the Android platform.  Advise, collaborate with, and synthesize feedback from UX designers and researchers, and members from across the organization.  Fulfill several project requests simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines.  Assist software and hardware engineers with final development of Aura products.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.  Experience with developing apps with streamlined UI/UX.  Experience in mobile application development.  Preferred Qualifications  MS degree in Computer Science with 5 years of related work experience.  Experience working with Android SDKs (sensors), third-party APIs and data sources (JSON/XML, etc.).  Experience with low-level Android development (NDK).  Embedded development and prototyping (microcontrollers, FPGAs) experience.  C/C++ experience, especially for firmware development.  Proven ability to collaborate with designers, researchers, and engineers to develop new solutions.  Area  The Google Glass division is a world-class team focused on the cutting edge of hardware, software and industrial design. It is charged with pioneering, developing, building and launching smart eyewear and other related products in line with Google's ambitious and visionary objectives.
jobtitle: Software Prototyping Engineer, Project Aura, Glass and Beyond

description: SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is one of 17 Department of Energy (DOE) National Laboratories. Operated by Stanford University on behalf of the DOE, SLAC develops and operates some of the world’s premier science facilities, including the first hard X-ray free-electron laser. Researchers from SLAC and other premier institutions around the world use our facilities to investigate some of the most exciting and important problems facing our society in areas such as clean energy, environmental science, biomedicine, and advanced materials.   The Strategic Planning Office at Stanford Linear Accelerator is currently seeking a senior scientist/engineer to provide technical leadership for an emerging capability in building-to-grid integration. The position will provide broad technical oversight in the areas of buildings and electric power system research, development and demonstration, focusing on modeling, simulation, and advanced control systems design in building mechanical and electrical systems, building energy management, electricity distribution, and resource integration with electricity transmission systems.   This position is responsible for providing technical leadership and expertise in these research areas for the Strategic Planning office. The successful candidate is expected to perform strategic planning, initiative investments, proposal development, high-level and technical client interactions, long-term program planning, developing and implementing complex multi-year research programs, managing multidisciplinary technical teams, as well as developing, implementing and guiding large-scale electricity system modeling, simulation capability development, field experiment and analysis activities. This will include high-level responsibility for establishing overall technical direction, client interactions, business development, proposal writing, project management, technical oversight of senior/mentoring of junior science and engineering staff. The successful candidate will contribute to the engineering and scientific literature on both building and electric power systems modeling, simulation and controls, lead and coordinate research activities, interact with key clients, and develop the Laboratory’ technical capability to engage in new client-funded research programs for integrated buildings and electricity systems planning and operations.   The candidate will serve as a scientific authority in the area of building-to-grid integration modeling, simulation and demonstration, leading the development of programs in this area and establishing SLAC as a premiere facility for original research on advanced building-to-grid controls. This will include the following responsibilities:  Provide technical leadership, vision and direction in the areas of building and grid modeling, simulation and control. Serve as principal investigator and/or project manager to develop and deliver high-visibility client-funded projects. Develop and implement large project and/or research programs. Develop and implement strategic research investment plans. Collaborate, coordinate and guide senior staff on client-funded and business development activities. Oversee, train and mentor staff and students on technical research and career growth activities. Provide technical leadership on a wide range of technical document preparation including conference papers, journal and magazine articles, and large, complex, formal documents such as books and program/project reports. Work with academic institutions, industry, and other DOE laboratories on interdisciplinary research. Note: The Staff and Senior Staff Scientist levels are regular-continuing positions at SLAC. Applicants will be evaluated on research experience and accomplishments in field of expertise. Appointment at the Senior Staff Scientist level requires an achieved recognition of leadership nationally and/or internationally as a result of original developments in field of expertise.   Qualifications  PhD in mechanical/electrical engineering or related fields with minimum ten years of experience in buildings, power system or controls research and development. Able to consider, select and broadly apply principles, theories and concepts in multiple fields of specialization, with particular emphasis on two or more of the following: building systems, electric power systems, energy system economics, and control theory. Fully competent in one or more of the following areas: building and electric power system controls, building and electrical systems and control, advanced controller development, building systems simulation, simulation software development, and building and electric grid systems integration. Experience in building and/or power system control research or engineering. Experience contributing to multiple projects and leading tasks on major projects and applying and interpreting the latest theories, principles, methods, tools and technologies. Comfortable working with a diverse set of government, military and industry clients with potentially fast-evolving and high-risk goals. Possess strong analytical, management, and communications skills, both oral and written, and able to communicate clearly the goals, parameters, objectives and outcomes of research. Adept at working in a multidisciplinary team environment and keeping large-scale investments and activities in scope, on schedule, and within budget. Demonstrated experience in professional activities participation and/or external collaborations. Demonstrated capabilities in fundraising. Desired Skills:  PhD with 10+ years of research and development experience in building HVAC controls, Electrical, Mechanical, or Control Systems, and/or advanced control theory. SLAC Manager Competencies:  Results Through Others: Achieves expected results by effectively delegating and managing the work of others. Aligns Priorities: Ensures planning and prioritization of resources and work efforts; ensures alignment of direct and matrix reports to support organizational goals and business plans. Applies Lab Acumen: Maintains understanding of lab efforts and direction as well as current research and trends, considers technology and customer impacts, and contributes relevant, informed ideas to lab growth. Navigates Complexity: Demonstrates effective problem-solving and decision-making in complex situations; manages a multitude of information and circumstances to discern what is most important; takes appropriate action, even with conflicting data or in difficult situations. Communication: Ensures effective information flow to various audiences and creates and delivers clear, appropriate written, spoken, presented messages. Relationships: Builds relationships to foster trust, collaboration, and a positive climate to achieve common goals. Self-awareness: Seeks feedback from others and takes ownership of, and actions to address what is learned; recognizes impact on others and adjusts as needed; pursues continuous learning opportunities; implements a meaningful development plan. Team Effectiveness: Effectively motivates team members and fosters a diverse and collaborative environment; leverages individual members’ strengths for overall team effectiveness; incorporates insights to improve team operations. Purpose & Vision: Articulates a clear vision of expected outcomes; inspires others to execute work plans and feel a sense of purpose and ownership for the mission. Attracts & Develops Employee Talent: Plans for, attracts, and hires the right talent for current and future organizational needs; operates with a focus on growing internal talent through organizational and staff development; values and encourages continuous growth development through a blend of work experiences, coaching, and formal learning; aligns individual development with organizational needs and objectives.  Job-Specific Competencies:  Strategic Mindset: Seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies. Cultivates Innovation: Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful.  Qualifications:

description: xAd enables real-time, location-based marketing, without the guesswork. Working with xAd, marketers can deliver more relevant, personalized messages to the right people they want to reach, based on the real places they visit everyday. Each month, xAd's patented location platform helps marketers reach over 300 million people globally via more than 30 thousand popular mobile applications. With xAd, marketers can say goodbye to assumptive marketing and reach the right people at real places in real-time with precision, relevance and confidence. Learn more: www.xad.com.  We operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment where everyone on the team is committed to the success and growth of xAd. Our culture is highly entrepreneurial and our success comes from our employees who voice their opinions and ideas to facilitate growth to our bottom line. We reward hard work, support career development and foster a fun and friendly work environment. If this sounds like a company you would like to join please review the job description below. We are looking for a product manager with a strong grasp on the algorithms, models, techniques, and tools in data science will not only enjoy the support of the data science teams he/she works with, but also will be able to steer the product roadmap with application of the right models/techniques combined with right data set to the right business problems and market requirements. Working with the Science and Research team of smart researchers and engineers to address challenging data problems in the exciting mobile advertising domain. The goal of the team is to make sense out of the huge amount of data flowing through xAd platform. The problems we work on include, but are not limited to, yield optimization, smart pricing, network behavior analysis and modeling, campaign performance optimization, inventory prediction and management  Responsibilities Primary focus will be the market-centric innovation by working Data Scientists and Engineers, and providing the insight of adequate level of sufficient accuracy to take the product to the market at the right time. Play a highly proactive role in building the product with the help of data scientists, data engineers, data architects, and other stakeholders on all sides Excel in a highly interactive role in educating the stakeholders and the managers about the data science behind the analytics. Discuss and plan the exploration in the areas of statistics, machine learning, experimental design, and operational research. Analyze and present new algorithms to benefit xAd network. Work with various other team members including data analyst, business owners, engineering, Client Services, Marketing and Sales. Experience/Skills Minimum of 5 years Product Management experience. 5-10 years of software engineering and scientific experience. Prior ad network, Big Data or analytics experience, operations research or similar. Proficiency with databases, SQL, and scripting languages. Practical understanding of the mathematics behind modern machine learning, linear algebra and statistics. Demonstrated ability to apply statistical techniques to solve real problems. Experience with data analysis, business intelligence and statistical tools (e.g. R, SAS, or SPSS). Analytical thinker. Attention to detail, data accuracy and quality of output. Results oriented and deadline driven. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: A9.com, an Amazon company, creates powerful, customer-focused search and advertising solutions and technologies . Whenever a customer visits an Amazon site worldwide and types in a query or browses through product categories, A9 Product Search services go to work. We design, develop, and deploy high performance, fault-tolerant distributed search systems used by millions of Amazon customers every day. Our Search Relevance team works to maximize the quality and effectiveness of the search experience for visitors to Amazon websites worldwide.  Amazon Video and Amazon Music have many millions of users daily. Movies and Music are critical strategic categories for Amazon with fast growth. The Digital Search Relevance team is a small, highly talented, engineering team focused on solving highly impactful relevance problems within this strategic category. In this role you’ll be a technical leader within the Search Relevance organization, which includes several engineering areas for improving search quality and effectiveness. You will own the full development cycle - from inception to deploying in production systems. Projects will span the whole development pipeline, including data analysis, prototyping, machine learning (ML), natural language processing (NLP), A/B testing, and creating production code that runs at massive scale. The role interacts with many teams team to create solutions - Analytics, Infrastructure, Operations Engineering, etc. In this highly visible position you will work alongside some of the internet’s most influential visionaries with ownership of one of the highest growth categories for Amazon.  At A9, you’ll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), one of the world's leading internet companies. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Palo Alto, California.  As the leader for Digital Search Relevance you will: Drive Search Relevance, Ranking, and Query Understanding Amazon Movies and Music categories. Identify customer pain points, understand business challenges, and solve technical problems to address them. Develop ML and NLP models to improve relevance across all access points – mobile, desktop, and voice. Define project deliverables with long term customer satisfaction as the target. Collaborate with teams across A9.com, and Amazon, to improve the Search experience across a variety of devices. Lead the design and implementation of technical solutions requiring a strong background in algorithms, analytics, data mining, machine learning, A/B testing, and customer facing code that runs at scale. Recruit, hire and cultivate great engineering talent to attack challenging technical situations. Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related engineering discipline. A minimum of 5 years of experience leading software development teams. At Least 2 years of domain experience in Search, Information Retrieval, or Relevance. At least 2 years of experience in Machine Learning (ML) and/or Natural Language Processing (NLP). Preferred Qualifications:  Ability to recruit, and develop, a high-performing engineering team of computer science engineers and data scientists. In-depth knowledge of a variety of applied machine learning methods and techniques. Proven track record in shipping products/services with high quality standards. Strong understanding of data structures and algorithms. Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical partners. Ability to effectively work, and communicate, with Senior Executives. Ability to work independently with little direct supervision. Ability to function well in loosely structured situations involving uncertainties and a range of opinions. Bias for action, with strong customer focus. Excellent decision maker who drives action, high quality, and results. Job # 15173

description: This position is for a highly motivated biological systems engineer with an extensive biochemistry background and significant hands-on experience in the application of a range of liquid handling systems for the manipulation of biochemical materials and the performance of analytical methods. The position supports the R&D; scientific team to design, build and test liquid handling systems to address one or more of the major steps in the company’s proprietary sequencing platform (sample preparation, and DNA library construction) for fast and low cost genome sequencing. This engineer will be an active and collaborative part of a team of research and development scientists focused on developing the next generation technologies for the CGI platform. This role requires the engineer to interact on a daily basis with the scientists working on the biochemistry of our technology and needs to have a deep understanding of the liquid handling needs as defined by the requirements of the biochemistry.   Major Duties and Responsibilities Under general direction performs various R&D; assignments that require knowledge of molecular biology and biochemistry knowledge, concepts, and techniques. Support activities in the Biochemistry Department to design, research, develop and implement processes for new DNA sample prep or library strategies. Participate and contribute in weekly group meetings on experimental design, activity planning, and troubleshooting, including reporting experimental results. Execute experimental work plan in collaboration with other group members, providing technical expertise, material and hands-on support as needed to achieve Departmental goals. Collaborate and communicate experimental results with other development and production groups. Perform other work related duties as assigned.  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in biological sciences (Biochemistry, Molecular Biology or related science) with a minimum of 4 years of experience in a relevant technical/laboratory role with increasing responsibility; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Demonstrated experience in design, implementation and transfer of various liquid handling systems into process automation systems in both R&D; and Production environments. Experimental Biochemical or Molecular Biology hands-on skills are essential, as well as experience with Good Laboratory Practices and aseptic techniques. Must have an excellent ability to apply experimental design, data analysis and statistics to decision making. Familiarity with systems and processes used in biochemical production environments, including use of SOPs and LIMS Excellent analytical, organizational, and planning skills, with great attention to detail and record-keeping in both lab notebook and electronic documentation Ability to carry out and develop standard operating procedures involving basic and advanced laboratory techniques, calculations, materials measurement, operation of laboratory equipment and record keeping Ability to follow protocols and pay attention to detail, with good problem solving and analytical thinking skills required Demonstrated strength in working within a team and with cross-functional partners, as well as ability to work effectively independently. Should be well organized, self-motivated and possess excellent time management skills. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to multitask and adapt to rapidly changing requirements, priorities and tight schedules  Complete Genomics does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website, employees or Human Resources.   Complete Genomics will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of Complete Genomics and will be processed accordingly without fee.   Complete Genomics has the sole discretion to determine with whom we will enter into a contract. If you wish to work with Complete Genomics, please contact the Human Resources department at careers@completegenomics.com .   Complete Genomics provides equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran or uniformed service status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description: Picarro is pioneering a unique intersection of hardware, software and cloud-based computing unlike anything being done today. We are transforming how world-class scientific and regulatory compliance measurements are made, and more importantly, who makes them. Never before have such high quality data been so readily available and so affordable. The Electronics Design Engineer position will offer tremendous opportunities and continuous intellectual challenges as you play a key role in developing the electronics that powers our instruments.  This is an amazing career development opportunity for the right individual to join a well-funded, rapidly growing and highly respected pre-IPO company bringing truly transformative technology to new markets. You will help drive the technological change that is affecting Geo-Political change across the world. Your team members are all “A” players individually selected to be part of this game-changing team. You will be challenged daily but there will also be rewards. You will learn and grow, you will gain an appreciation and visibility into the tight circle of technology thought-leaders and environmental decision makers, all within the stewardship of governments.  Summary: Picarro is looking for an accomplished individual with a strong engineering / scientific background, and strong hand’s on experience. The ideal profile is someone with a blend of both hardware and software development with experience productizing & commercializing new products during the critical & formative phases of the product lifecycle. description: Description Cellular Research, Inc., is a biotechnology research and development company founded in 2011 by innovators from Silicon Valley and Stanford University was recently acquired by Becton Dickenson and has become an integral part of the new start-up Genomics business at BD. Our mission is to revolutionize life science research by enabling high-resolution investigation of single cells and limited samples, thereby creating new benchmarks and delivering new capabilities in discovery and drug development. Cellular Research has developed Molecular Indexing to deliver these capabilities. Molecular Indexing is a revolutionary technology that enables direct and precise counting of individual molecules, genes, chromosomes, and other genetic materials in very small samples and individual cells.   We are seeking an experienced scientist with experience in molecular immunology and or oncology to become an integral part of the Cellular Research team to validate and unlock the potential of RESOLVETM, an innovative platform for massively parallel single cell gene expression analysis described in Fan et al Science, 2015. You will play a key role in identifying and validating novel applications of RESOLVETM in the fields of immuno-oncology, immunology and stem cell biology. In addition to working with the Cellular Research team, you will also work with external collaborators in academia, biotechs and top-tier pharmaceutical companies to enable breakthroughs in the use of our cutting edge gene analysis platform in the areas of clinical oncology and immunology.   Duties:   • Design and perform experiments to investigate novel applications of the RESOLVETM platform in immunology and oncology. Manage collaborations and relationships, in collaboration with business development, with early access customers from academia, other biotechs and pharmaceutical companies  • Participate in analysis of data from the RESOLVETM platform in collaboration with internal bioinformatics and product development scientists and outside clients  • Provide feedback to scientists and engineers in product development  • Collaborate effectively with other employees to help advance the company’s research and development and commercial goals  • Present results to collaborators and prepare conference abstracts and manuscripts for publication   Qualifications

description: Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.  Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career. description: A9.com, an Amazon company, creates powerful, customer-focused search and advertising solutions and technologies. Whenever a customer visits an Amazon site worldwide and types in a query or browses through product categories, A9 Product Search services go to work. We design, develop, and deploy high performance, fault-tolerant distributed search systems used by millions of Amazon customers every day. Our Search Relevance team works to maximize the quality and effectiveness of the search experience for visitors to Amazon websites worldwide.  As member of the Product Search Relevance team, you will work on relevance and ranking functions that work across all Amazon categories (Fashion, Digital Music, Amazon Instant Video, etc). The initial projects will be focused on the Fashion segment (Apparel, Shoes, Jewelry and Watches), which is a multi-billion dollar industry and one of Amazon’s fastest growing businesses. The focus is to make the online shopping experience fun and easy, in a store with millions of products for all styles and price points. The search solutions you develop will allow customers to quickly discover products in our vast catalog, but also support exploration of our growing selection. You'll participate in aspects of the R&D; process, from experimenting with new ideas and exploring new techniques to implementing features used by millions of Amazon customers every day. We are looking for talented engineers who are passionate about search, machine learning, and writing awesome production code.  Overview: Design, develop, and support new features on a world-class search service that serves billions of queries. Apply Information Retrieval, Machine Learning, and NLP techniques to retrieve relevant results and provide optimal ranking. Dig deep into how customer behavior differs between categories and go beyond generic relevance algorithms. Work as part of product teams that shape the future of Amazon. Participate in the full development cycle: design, development, impact assessment, A/B testing and results analysis, and deployment, Take the latest results from the research community and apply them to delighting our customers. Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software against ambitious schedules. Collaborate with engineers/teams to find technical solutions to complex design challenges. At A9, you’ll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), one of the world's leading internet companies. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Palo Alto, California.  Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical field (in lieu of degree, 4 years of relevant work experience). At least 2 years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist, Software Engineer, or Applied Researcher developing production level code in C++, Java, or C as well as high-level scripting languages like Python. At least 2 years of hands-on experience in applied Machine Learning or Natural Language Processing Experience in object oriented programming in a UNIX environment.  Preferred Qualifications Master’s or PhD in Computer Science Strong Machine Learning and modeling techniques including classification, regression and Bayesian analysis. Strong skills in algorithm design and complexity analysis. Strong understanding of data structures. Experience with Hadoop for web-scale data processing. Results-oriented with a strong customer and business focus. Highly innovative, flexible and self-directed Entrepreneurial ‘think big’ mindset. Ability to communicate well and discuss complex topics with both technical audiences. Ability to deal well with ambiguous and undefined problems. Able to thrive in a fast paced environment. Strong sense of ownership.
jobtitle: Software Development Engineer, Search Relevance (Amazon Fashion)

description: Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. As a Staffing Services Associate, you will enthusiastically represent the Google brand and build our talent pipeline. Whether it’s making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you will have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You'll be focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams.  As a Staffing Services Associate you'll ensure a seamless, candidate-friendly hiring process. You'll be responsible for keeping the process organized and efficient while actively maintaining clear lines of communication with recruiters, hiring managers and candidates - from entry-level to senior leadership hires. By providing great customer service and smoothly managing all the details, you'll contribute to the overall success of the Staffing team. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.  Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. Responsibilities Due to business needs, we are prioritizing candidates that are available to start before May.  Minimum Qualifications  Support client groups with recruiting processes including scheduling interviews, organizing candidate travel arrangements, hosting candidates on campus, reserving conference rooms and liaising with candidates, leaders at Google and their administrative partners, as appropriate.  Create and distribute employment-related correspondence.  Communicate professionally, tactfully and with the utmost diplomacy at all times, treating all candidates with dignity and respect and maintaining a high level of confidentiality at all times.  Arrange special requests and provide a high-touch experience appropriate to the candidate’s needs.  Improve processes using a data-drive approach including optimization of interviewer loads, identification of trends and issues in the scheduling process, and execution of initiatives to increase efficiency and improve experience.  Preferred Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.  Area  Experience in improving processes, identifying issues in processes, suggesting user focused improvements and navigating/influencing cross-functional teams to drive these changes.  High level of creativity, perseverance, and openness to change with a drive to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships.  Self-directed, detail-oriented problem solver with a burning desire to contribute to the organization's reputation and success.  Exceptional attention to detail with a proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a fast-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage time efficiently.  Demonstrated discretion and strong judgment, with the ability to interact comfortably and professionally with all levels of candidates and internal clients. Strong demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills, a customer-service orientation, and a welcoming, helpful attitude.

description: Netflix is at the forefront of cloud architecture and and big data analytics. Our systems ingest hundreds of billion events daily and the volume is growing rapidly as we expand globally. Specifically, you will:   Develop features for big data query engines like Spark, Hadoop, Pig, Hive, and Presto Contribute to open source projects and advance the state of big data Be a liaison to help data scientists for building/diagnosing big data queries   This is your dream job if you:   Are passionate about building out large-scale distributed systems in the cloud to process petabytes of data Seek out opportunities to engage and contribute to the open source community Work well in a cross-functional environment and excel in communicating with your peers Thrive on working in a fast-paced, evolving, growing, dynamic environment Have a BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or related field

description: Position Summary  @WalmartLabs brings together dozens of engineers, scientists and product experts to execute a cutting edge vision. If you're fluent in the language of innovation, @WalmartLabs is a place to become a leading change agent. Join us! Position Description  As a Sr Software Engineer for Wal-Mart’s Global eCommerce division, you will have the opportunity to help define and implement components for Wal-Mart’s next-generation, global eCommerce platform. This hands-on position, reporting to the Engineering Manager at Walmart, will be part of the engineering team, working on all the aspects of the design and implementation of Information Services. The key areas of work involve building a massively scalable and high performance enterprise data service solutions using MPP data warehouse and Hadoop, build & maintain finance & marketing applications, business intelligence reports and analytics. A wide degree of creativity and efficiency is a plus. As a self-motivated and enthusiastic member of our team, you will be working closely with the product and senior management, other development teams, DBA's, operations, release and scheduling teams, and quality assurance teams. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. description: The Department of Pediatrics, Division of Neonatal and Developmental Medicine at Stanford University School of Medicine aims to provide optimum state-of-the-art care for critically ill and recovering neonates and infants. We are dedicated to the School of Medicine’s mission of advancing and exploring innovative and novel biomedical, translational, and clinical research and education through the nurturing stimulation of interactions among basic and clinical scientists, clinicians, and educators throughout the School of Medicine and University, as well as with the private and public sectors. Through our integrated research, education, patient, and community outreach programs, we are committed to maintaining the highest standards of academic medicine and patient care. Embedded in the Division are the Perinatal Programs.   About the Perinatal Programs:  Stanford University is the coordinating center for the California Perinatal Quality Care Collaborative (CPQCC) and California Maternal Quality Care Collaborative (CMQCC). CPQCC provides leadership from within our Outcomes and Perinatal Epidemiology Research Unit and helps facilitate statewide collaboration. The collaborative collects data from 132 NICUs to identify opportunities for improving the quality of care for the 6,000 yearly acute neonatal transports. CPQCC’s sister program, CMQCC, works to ensure equitable care for mothers to end preventable morbidity, mortality, and racial disparities in California maternal care. The Mid-Coastal California Perinatal Outreach Program (MCCPOP) provides obstetrical and neonatal education, resources, consultation, and technical assistance to regional healthcare providers. The Regional Perinatal Programs of California (RPPC) is a cooperative network of public and private health care providers within geographic areas who focus on the well-being of pregnant women and their babies to promote access to appropriate levels of high quality care. Together, these Perinatal programs focus on improving the quality of maternal and newborn care and outcomes.   We are currently recruiting for 3 Biostatistician II positions who will consult with investigators to refine research questions, define hypotheses, design studies and devise analysis plans, work with senior statistician(s) to implement analysis plans and publish findings, and present results orally to clinical investigators. These positions will provide guidance to clinical investigators on design and analysis issues.   These positions will focus on different research projects associated with the following programs within the Perinatal group:   1) California Children’s Services (CCS) High Risk Infant Follow-up (HRIF) Program (Job #69900)  2) CMQCC (Job #68941)  3) CPQCC (Job #69596)   Duties include:   • Design study.  • Develop and implement protocol for quality control.  • Create analytic files with detailed documentation.  • Select appropriate statistical tools for addressing a given research question.  • Implement data analysis through statistical programming.  • Present results for investigators using graphs and tables.  • Summarize findings orally and in written form.  • Participate in the preparation of papers for publication.  • Consult with investigators on appropriate statistical approaches to data analyses; assist in study design and proposal development.  • Mentor collaborators in areas of experimental design, quality control, and statistical analysis  • Develop oral and written dissemination of findings for conference presentations and peer-reviewed journal articles.  • Oversee lower-level staff on issues related to quality control and creation of analysis files.   * - Other duties may also be assigned Requirements DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  • Ph.D. in Biostatistics preferred  • Experience working with complex, large scale data sets, including data cleaning, security, selection of software, quality control, documentation and data reports.  • 5 to 10 years of experience in managing, analyzing, and reporting on large datasets desired   EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (REQUIRED):   Master's degree in biostatistics, statistics or related field and at least 3 years of experience.   KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (REQUIRED):   • Proficient in at least two of R, SAS, SPSS, or STATA.  • Skills in descriptive analysis, modeling of data, and graphic interfaces.  • Outstanding ability to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.  • Demonstrated excellence in at least one area of expertise, which may include coordinating studies; statistical methodology such as missing data, survival analysis, statistical genetics, or informatics; statistical computing; database design (e.g., expertise in RedCAP or MySQL); graphical techniques (e.g., expertise in Illustrator).   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:   • Frequently perform desk based computer tasks, seated work and use light/ fine grasping.  • Occasionally stand, walk, and write by hand, lift, carry, push pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.   * - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.   May work extended or non-standard hours based on project or business cycle needs.   If you are interested in applying for these positions, please visit stanfordcareers.stanford.edu and search for job #s 69900, 68941, and 69596. Resume and cover letter required.   Stanford University is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and is committed to recruiting and hiring qualified women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

description: Welcome  Who we are  Quantum Dot Pioneers  Management Team  Board of Directors  How It Works  Quantum Dots  QDEF  Environment  News  In The News  Press Releases  Awards  Photos & Video  Subscribe  Blog  Careers  Contact Us  Contact Us  Events  Welcome  Who we are  Quantum Dot Pioneers  Management Team  Board of Directors  How It Works  Quantum Dots  QDEF  Environment  News  In The News  Press Releases  Awards  Photos & Video  Subscribe  Blog  Careers  Contact Us  Contact Us  Events  R&D; Scientist, Cd Free Nanocrystal Synthesis  March 8, 2016  by Nanosys  Join the Quantum Dot Pioneers! Nanosys is building a materials revolution, combining scientific expertise with awareness of the system needs of TV and display manufacturers. We are looking for people who are not only energetic, committed and passionate about what they do, but focused on applying innovation to help industries overcome obstacles through materials architecture. We have a “roll-up your sleeves” culture that is based upon individual empowerment, mutual respect, integrity and recognition of successes. Our quantum dots are designed to increase the range of colors emitted by standard displays by up to 50% and that’s why we are interested in the color emitting characteristics of the semi-conductor materials we synthesize into fluorescent nanocrystals. Once created, the dots are coated onto a barrier film that we call QDEF, which in turn is added to a display during the manufacturing process. We are constantly developing new dots, looking at new methods of encapsulation and always pushing the R&D; envelope regarding the materials we design and manufacture. We have been very successful in developing the market for quantum dots in the display industry and we’ve been responsible for many breakthrough technological achievements. We are currently expanding our research activities and the successful candidate will play a key role in the development of our next generation Cadmium Free Quantum Dots (semiconductor nano-crystals) for display applications. R&D; Scientist, Cd Free Nanocrystal Synthesis #730 Summary of Essential Job Functions include but are not limited to the following: The primary responsibility for this position will be researching and coming up with innovative synthesis methodologies for Cd-free quantum dots aimed at improving their optical performance, reliability and ease of manufacture. This is a Laboratory (hands-on) position with some supervision of research associates and coordination with development partners. Chemical/ Inorganic synthesis of organometallics in air-free environments. Analytical characterization of organometallic precursors and quantum dots. Compile and present research data to the development team and make best case arguments for developing research programs. Keep excellent research notes and follow all best practice and GMP documentation guidelines.  Education, Experience and Certifications: PhD in Chemistry, Material Science or a similar discipline. Proven track record of innovative research in quantum dot synthesis. Experience working with Indium Phosphide (InP) or Cadmium (Cd) free Quantum Dot synthesis. Knowledge of organic ligand synthesis, polymerization and cross-linking reactions. Familiarity with nanocrystal characterization techniques (TEM, XRD, NMR, spectroscopy etc.). Experience with air-free chemistry techniques, including Schlenk techniques and working with glove boxes. Excellent communication skills both verbal and written and the ability to interact well in a team environment. Ability and desire to work efficiently and productively in a multi-task environment on a daily basis, independently and with minimal supervision.  Physical Demands & Work Environment: The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Physical Demands include: walking, standing, sitting, use of hands or fingers to handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, talk and hear, lift up to 40 pounds, close vision (clear vision at 20 inches or less), distant vision (clear vision at 20 feet or more), color vision (ability to identify and distinguish colors), peripheral vision (ability to observe an area that can be seen up and down or to the left and right while eyes are fixed on a given point), Depth perception (three-dimensional vision, ability to judge distances and spatial relationships), ability to adjust focus (ability to adjust the eye to bring an object into sharp focus). Must be capable of climbing step stool to reach items at heights above 7 feet. Must be able to physically stand for up to one hour. Must be able to safely wear necessary personal protective equipment in designated areas i.e. lab coat, safety glasses. Must be able to respond to visual and audible alarms. Work is mainly performed in a laboratory environment. The noise level in the environment is usually moderate. While performing the duties of this job, the employee will work with toxic or caustic chemicals. Nanosys offers competitive salary with a wide range of benefits including a comprehensive health plan, basic life and AD&D;, short and long-term disability insurance, 401(k) savings plan, paid time off, paid holidays, employee referral program and stock options. We are seeking results-oriented people that are driven to succeed through teamwork, focused on discovery to solve real-world challenges, and passionate about building a new industry. description: Job Description: Performs a wide range of medical laboratory tests used to diagnose, treat and prevent disease. Using technical knowledge and a theoretical understanding of the basis of the tests, records and validates the accuracy and quality of results to ensure conformity to specifications. Understands and applies the correct control measures and protocols in cases of abnormal results, reporting any discrepancies to a Senior, Reference, or Supervising Clinical Laboratory Scientist. Calibrates assays where the calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance and records is performance. Performs simple troubleshooting and reports instrument malfunctions to senior staff. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory.  Accurately performs and completes laboratory analysis on body fluids in accordance with laboratory protocols and policies. Adheres to all safety/health and state/federal regulatory requirements and the procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Demonstrates technical proficiency in all areas of assigned responsibility. Keeps abreast of new technical developments and acquires the necessary skills to adapt to technological changes. Maintains a current understanding of all procedures used in the assigned laboratory section(s) and can interpret the significance of normal and abnormal results. Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisors. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test results to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability. Experience with molecular techniques desired but will train the right candidate.  License/Certification: Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS)  Must be able to work evening shift.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification. Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to technological changes in the laboratory Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities Ability to solve problems and identify solutions Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization Knowledge and technical proficiency in specialty areas assigned within the laboratory Knowledge of infection prevention policies and procedures Knowledge of local, state and federal regulatory requirements related to areas of functional responsibility

Our Clients' campaign is powered by a bidding optimization engine trained on a proprietary data set of User Composites and App Constellations.  Are you ready to lead our Clients' next generation Data Science Engineering ? description: Stanford University Department of Genetics has an excellent opportunity available for a motivated and experienced Senior Biocuration Scientist. This individual will work with projects funded to coordinate and integrate data from model organism research as part of the Saccharomyces Genome Database project (SGD, http://www.yeastgenome.org) funded by the National Institutes of Health. This individual will be an essential project member who will identify genetic data from scientific articles concerning primarily yeast, and record these data regarding genes, alleles, and proteins in a systematic manner. Other data to be captured include phenotypes, gene product functions, and models of human disease. Curated data are entered into SGD and made freely available to the public.   The successful candidate will have extensive biological knowledge, including familiarity with high-throughput experimental methodologies, large genomic datasets, and their computational analysis in order to successfully describe these data. Prior laboratory experience generating genomic datasets and/or bioinformatics analysis experience to identify RNA transcripts, transcription factor binding sites, protein modifications, and SNPs within genomic datasets is desired. Familiarity with the use of controlled vocabularies and ontologies to describe biological concepts is a plus. An advanced education in a biological field is required to facilitate the assessment of experimental details, results, and data. This individual will be also responsible for working with other curation and software engineering staff in the specification, design, and implementation of tools that integrate, search, and display these data.   Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential in order to (1) interact effectively with members of the scientific community, (2) facilitate the acquisition and description of scientific data, (3) effectively provide documentation and specifications to coworkers during tool development, and (4) contribute to publications and tutorials.   The successful candidate must be able to learn and work independently, yet collaborate well with coworkers. Previous experience working in an academic environment is a plus. The work will take place in a dynamic environment where specifications often change rapidly in response to various demands, so the candidate must remain flexible and adaptable. The successful candidate will work at Stanford University in Palo Alto, California.   Duties include:  Collect and analyze information from peer-reviewed scientific journals and through direct submissions; abstract data into the required format, and verify them for accuracy. Create a variety of reports and user demonstration; collaborate with the users in the discovery of new knowledge. Compile and create educated summaries of the literature, discovering new facts by analyzing the collected data. Participate in presentations and demonstrations of the database at conferences or other institutions. Work with users to answer questions about the contents of the database and provide assistance for submission of information. Supervise or guide staff, as needed; schedule and assign workload; set appropriate deadlines; review work for quality and timeliness.  * - Other duties may also be assigned   Qualifications
