description: Under general direction, to research, plan, analyze and implement ongoing Countywide natural resource conservation projects and/or components of larger environmental conservation programs.   Under general direction, the Parks Natural Resource Planner will conduct research, plan, analyze and implement county-wide natural resource conservation projects and/or components of larger environmental conservation programs. This includes, completing natural resource plans for parks and natural resource programs, being a project manager for planning projects, hiring and managing consultants and other subject matter experts, conducting public meetings, and presenting findings in public forums (i.e., Parks and Recreation Commission). Additionally, the Parks Natural Resource Planner will be working cooperatively with the Santa Clara Valley Habitat Agency on the implementation of the Habitat Plan (HCP) and Natural Communities Conservation Plan (NCCP), and other regulatory agencies for permit and environmental review (i.e., CEQA) compliance for natural resource projects.   Typical Tasks:  Functions as a project leader for natural resource conservation and land use by, establishing procedures, setting goals, and assuming responsibility for the final recommendations;  Leads in the preparation and submittal of the public projects application package for covered parks activities/projects to the new Habitat Agency staff;  Provides technical review and assistance on the Habitat Agency's preparation of a Reserve Unit Management Plan;  Plans for the allocation, management and protection of department natural resources;  Performs environmental reviews and ensures adherence to regulatory requirements;  Keeps management apprised of developments having a Departmental or Countywide impact;  Prepares presentations, project proposals and other materials to represent the County before various groups, organizations, and commissions;  Participates in meetings, committees, conferences, workshops, etc. as a representative of the Department;  Confers with various entities including scientists, engineers, regulators, Habitat Agency staff, etc. to plan or review projects;  Collaborates with the Park Planning Division and affected staff to plan production activities;  Designs and coordinates successive phases of problem analysis and solution proposals;  Prepares and administers budgets and financial reports;  Assists in the research and preparation of grant applications;  Provides stewardship for plant or animal resources or habitats; studies land use, monitors animal populations/ resources;  Completes California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA)/ National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) permit applications from regulatory agencies;  Develops and maintains databases, Geographic Information System (GIS) maps and data records related to tracking and monitoring the progress of assigned projects;  Develops user manuals, checklists and internal procedural memos;  May be assigned as a Disaster Service Worker, as required;  Performs other related duties as assigned.  Employment Standards:   Sufficient education and experience to demonstrate the possession and application of the following knowledge and abilities:  Training and Experience Note: The required knowledge and abilities are attained through training and experience equivalent to possession of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in Regional Planning, Biology, Botany, Environmental and Natural Resource Planning, Environmental Biology, Environmental Studies, Environmental Science, Environmental Management and Protection or a closely related Natural Science field.   - AND -   Three (3) years of professional planning experience.   A Master's degree in a closely related field may be substituted for one (1) year of the required experience.   Knowledge of: Basic aims, trends, concepts, principles, techniques and legal aspects of city and regional planning, zoning administration and regional habitat conservation plans;  Species, natural communities, ecosystems, ecosystem processes and their conservation needs in Santa Clara County;  Wildlife and vegetation monitoring/surveying techniques;  Implications of physical, economic, aesthetic and social factors involved in city and regional planning including the development of urban and suburban environments;  Governmental organization operations and community interrelationships;  Research and statistical methods;  Computer applications, such as word processing, spreadsheets, databases and geospatial software;  Socioeconomic trends, land use and development patterns as they relate to natural resources;  Cartographic and infographic design skills;  Publishing geospatial data and maps to the Web. Ability to: Apply environmental guidelines, regulatory requirements and conditions, evaluate and analyze biological data and technical reports;  Organize and conduct research studies, manage projects and supervise/manage the work of consultants;  Prepare comprehensive reports or projects findings, using graphic aids;  Develop recommendations based on studies, field observation and public contact;  Speak and write effectively;  Conduct appropriate procurement process to retain qualified consultants and other expert assistance;  Understand and relate to others the aims, concepts and principles of city and regional planning and regional habitat conservation plans;  Establish and maintain effective relationships with those contacted in the course of work;  Lead and/ or work with inter-disciplinary teams;  Manage multiple, concurrent projects.

description: Theformer CTO and Founder of the AltaVista Search Engine is looking for developers to join his tight knit team of Stanford alum and high tech engineers in his stealth start up. description: We seek a product manager that has a passion to make computational tools that help change the world. Key attributes of the successful applicant will be a creative approach to all problems, a selfless nature in working within the team, and an empathetic connection to customers. Product managers at Cray are CEOs of their products, owning the business plan, the vision, and the market strategy. The product manager leads the product team to create innovative products, supporting services, white papers, and sales collateral to ensure that Cray is delivering superior value to its customers.   The role requires strong leadership skills to take programs through the full development lifecycle process by leading a cross-functional product team and in working with R&D; and business teams. The product manager must be able to observe and understand the market and clearly communicate market problems and characteristics to the product team.   Responsibilities:  Become a market authority, a voice for the customer through observation of the market Assess market and business needs and develop a business plan for the product Determine the positioning for the product in the market Understand the competitive landscape and how the product competes Lead cross-functional product teams Lead the development of the product and supporting materials Deliver superior value to Cray’s customers Help manage the product portfolio for the supercomputing business  Requirements:  B.S. degree related to the industry and a minimum of 5 years of experience leading complex integrated technical programs (or an equivalent combination of education, training and related work experience) Background in data science and/or machine learning a plus A demonstrated ability to lead and work with teams to achieve something special Hi-tech computing industry experience; High Performance Computing (HPC) background is a plus Systems engineering background is a plus Excellent interpersonal and team management skills and experience, including experience with a matrix organization Strong presentation, written and verbal skills Occasional travel About Cray: Global supercomputing leader Cray Inc. (Nasdaq: CRAY) provides innovative systems and solutions enabling scientists and engineers in industry, academia and government to meet existing and future simulation and analytics challenges. Leveraging more than 40 years of experience in developing and servicing the world’s most advanced supercomputers, Cray offers a comprehensive portfolio of supercomputers and big data storage and analytics solutions delivering unrivaled performance, efficiency and scalability. Cray’s Adaptive Supercomputing vision is focused on delivering innovative next-generation products that integrate diverse processing technologies into a unified architecture, allowing customers to meet the market’s continued demand for realized performance. With Cray’s relaxed work environment and amazing benefits, take the initiative to join a company of dedicated innovators. Your next is now at Cray.   We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

description: Want to help build a personalized homepage that greets each of our over 75+ million members worldwide each time they log in? Are you interested in implementing innovative data-driven algorithmic recommendation approaches using machine learning? The Page Algorithms Engineering team is looking for a passionate and talented software engineer to join us and develop the next generation of algorithms used to generate the Netflix homepage. For more details about what we are working on, read these blog posts.   In this position, you will be expected to drive the requirements, design, implementation, and ownership of important algorithmic components. You will team up with our applied researchers and data scientists to implement scalable, flexible, production-ready solutions for our algorithms. You will also help build a cross-functional platform for machine learning across all our algorithm areas. To be successful in this role, you must have a strong software engineering background, a keen sense of software design, have proven experience with distributed applications, be a quick learner, a good communicator, and work well in large cross-functional teams.   If you are ready to make a difference at a company that matters, and if you want to work with algorithms and data in a company that strongly believes in both, then we would love to talk to you.   Requirements:   5+ years of software engineering experience with a successful track record of delivering quality results Strong software design and development skills (Scala, Java, C#, or C++) Experience with large-scale data frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Pig, or Hive Experience with parallel and distributed computing BS in Computer Science or related field   Preferred, but not required:   Experience building recommendation systems Knowledge of machine learning or optimization algorithms Strong background in math, statistics, or numerical computation Experience with cloud computing platforms like AWS Experience with machine learning tools such as scikit-learn, R, Theano, TensorFlow, SparkML, or Foundry

description: Netflix has a data-driven culture which allows us to gain the insights needed to successfully disrupt the cable and linear TV industry. Utilizing the Experimentation Platform to perform rigorous A/B testing on thousands of Netflix ready devices, our data scientists and product managers ensure that all product decisions are ones that customers love. One facet of this platform is the rich toolset we use to conduct experiments, segmentation, analytics, and insights based on digests of several petabytes of data. You can get additional technical background about the platform here.   If you’re an experienced Software Engineer and you're interested in working with and learning from seasoned Experimentation and Data scientists, Product Managers, Algorithm, UI, and Application Engineers throughout the company, then you are the person we need. You will have the opportunity to help us architect, build, and scale the next generation of this toolset to support the company's fast growth. In this endeavor, you will be part of a tightly knit and driven group of experts, whose work impacts every technical decision made at Netflix, and where teamwork, creative use of technology, and curiosity will be required to meet your customers' needs.   We're looking for someone who has most of the following and is willing to learn the rest on the job as needed:   5+ years of professional web development experience Expert-level knowledge of JavaScript: you understand prototypal inheritance, scope, and closures Proficiency in HTML5 and CSS Experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially React.js and Redux. Experience working with systems written in Java or the like A strong desire to raise the bar for your team technically, and that you are tenacious, curious, and collaborative in all aspects of your work A quick learner and with excellent communication skills Proficiency in data visualization frameworks such as D3 is a plus Some experience with scripting languages like python or statistical languages like R Comfortable working in Linux/Unix environment Enjoy working in an environment with lot of context and minimal guidance Full stack engineers welcome!

description: Here is a learning environment like no other! At DuPont Industrial Biosciences, we are truly changing the world and having fun doing interesting science. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting; in which robust team collaboration, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks. We leverage our cutting-edge biotechnology capabilities to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy.   2016 Summer Internships at DuPont Industrial Biosciences  Palo Alto R&D; Center   DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers. We’ve developed several opportunities for students to gain the valuable experience they’ll need to succeed in today’s demanding job market. Are you interested in the scientific interfaces between biochemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation engineering, and microbial physiology leading to performance benefits in real-world industrial applications? We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   This summer Intern will explore enzyme native and denatured states with a focus on understanding enzyme reversibility and the effect on enzyme activity. Multiple methods of protein denaturation - chemical, pH-induced, and thermal – will be tested and compared. The intern should have a working knowledge of protein biochemistry and biophysics and some experience with enzyme assays.   Job Qualifications Qualified candidates will exhibit the following characteristics:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemical Engineering or a related field Have completed your sophomore year of undergrad education and will continue your education in the fall Have the ability to work in an interdisciplinary scientific setting High level of initiative and the ability to work in a team environment Exhibit exceptional analytical instrumentation skills Exhibit exceptional bench top analytical skills Ability to document results, analyze data, draw conclusions, and communicate findings Familiarity with theoretical and practical aspects of biochemistry and enzymology Our Palo Alto R&D; Center offers an intensive 13-week science internship program, in which interns develop a science project and take part in a variety of learning activities. You won’t spend your summer in just a single department or lab – DuPont Industrial Biosciences interns get exposure to a broad range of scientific disciplines. At the end of the program you’ll deliver a presentation of your ideas and findings, developing practical real-life skills. Our interns are paid a competitive hourly rate and are responsible for their own housing and transportation for the summer.
jobtitle: Summer Internship: Exploring the feasibility of denaturing formulations

description: Call for ProposalsNASA Ames Summer Program 2016NASA Ames Research Center, Moffett Field, CaliforniaJune 6 - July 1, 2016Proposal Deadline: March 14, 20162016 Topic Areas•Solar stellar connection•Space weather impacts on solar and exo-planets•Achieving helio/astro-physics science goals with small/nano satellites PurposeThe NASA Ames Summer Program focuses on the physics of space weather events and their interactions with planetary atmospheres. In the heliosphere, the events start at the Sun and influence the atmospheres, ionospheres, and magnetospheres of Earth and the other planets in the solar system. Observations of these interactions provide data on the interaction of these bodies with the plasma environment and can be studied to advance theoretical development and validation. Similar processes occur around other stars and their exo-planets.  The wide variety of exoplanet systems being discovered offers a rich ground to explore. Even when restricted to Sun-like stars, the variety of activities is large ¾ our limited lifespan offers us a only a brief sample of solar activities, whereas comparative stellar astrophysics enables us to effectively study solar conditions over much longer timescales and so to explore solar and heliospheric activity of the distant past and future. The †Comparative Heliophysics Summer Program 2016† at NASA Ames will focus on the foundations of heliophysics and related disciplines as applied to stars like the Sun and planets like those in the solar system with similar formation histories and that are relevant to understanding the formation, evolution, and present state of our immediate space environment. The program offers also the opportunity to explore approaches to sensor development that address space-weather impact on planetary atmospheres.  It is intended to offer the participants an opportunity to carry out a serious program of research while interacting with colleagues. The primary focus is to seed and encourage new multi-disciplinary research through interactions with scientists of various backgrounds. It is expected that the investigations will lead to high-impact publications and opportunities to expand into new research areas.Up to 25 students will be selected through a competitive process organized by the UCAR Visiting Scientist Programs. In addition, three to five advisors will be recruited from NASA's Ames Research Center to participate in the Summer Program.  The program will last for four weeks from June 6 to July 1, 2016. Successful candidates are: •Currently enrolled as advanced undergraduate students** or graduate students in any phase of training, or first or second year postdoctoral fellows. **undergraduates in physics in their final years (Junior, Senior) with strong background in applied mathematics, numerical methods, and computer science including advanced programming language skills in C++ , Python, and/or FORTRAN.•Majoring in physics with an emphasis on astrophysics, geophysics, plasma physics, and space physics, or experienced in at least one of these areas.•Pursuing a career in heliophysics, or astrophysics or planetary science. For additional information on this program, submitting a proposal and instructions on how to apply,please visit the Heliophysics website athttp://www.vsp.ucar.edu/Heliophysics/ames-overview.shtmlFor further information, call (303) 497-1605 or e-mail vspapply@ucar.eduThe Living With a Star program of the Heliophysics Division in NASA†s Science Mission Directoratesponsors the NASA Ames Summer Program.  The University Corporation for Atmospheric Research (UCAR) Visiting Scientist Programs collaborates with NASA in administering the program. The University Corporation for Atmospheric Research is an EE/AAE who values and encourages diversity in the workplace. Images courtesy of NASA.
jobtitle: Call for Proposals - NASA Ames Summer Program 2016
snippet: *undergraduates in physics in their final years (Junior, Senior) with strong background in applied mathematics, numerical methods, and computer science...

description: Position Summary This position will focus on analytical characterization activities in support of therapeutic protein development. Responsibilities will include development of new product specific assays as well as routine testing of in-process samples. Will work independently and serve as subject matter expert for their focus area, including leading method development, qualification, and technology transfer activities. The position will also perform routine testing and general support activities as needed to meet the goals of Revance Therapeutics’ development programs.  Essential Duties  Regularly apply basic theory and principles from one’s technical expertise to develop, optimize, and transfer analytical assays for product characterization, lot release, and stability testing. Coordinate and conduct routine testing support for other groups within Revance Development and Manufacturing Functions. Perform routine instrument/equipment maintenance and calibration checks to ensure the proper function and compliant use. Provide regular progress updates to manager and present data to internal and external audiences in a succinct and well organized manner. Author test methods and development reports. Serve as subject matter expert for at least one technical area and train other laboratory personnel on the use and maintenance of equipment. Lead technical transfer of assays to and from contract test laboratories or to QC. Plan experiments with limited manager oversight and work independently to achieve deliverables with minimal instruction. Develop and implement laboratory policies for critical reagents, data management, organizational performance, and continuous improvement. Maintain laboratory notebooks and forms consistent with Good Documentation Practices. Maintain adequate supplies of laboratory reagents and coordinate biohazard and chemical waste disposal.

description: Position Objective   The Thermo Scientific Quality Controls team is a group of passionate individuals dedicated to changing the way medicine is practiced. We are building a talented team of scientists and engineers dedicated to the Quality Controls business (MAS and AcroMetrix brands), based in our Fremont site in the San Francisco Bay area. This is an opportunity for a highly motivated software engineer to work in a fast-paced environment and develop diagnostic tools at the cutting edge of technology and medicine.   As part of the Thermo Fisher Diagnostic Quality Controls Business, the Engineer III will lead R&D; software activities aimed at designing and developing products that include web and PC-based software tools that support molecular diagnostic quality control in a clinical setting. The Engineer III will design, develop, and validate software on various development platforms. Activities will include creating software requirements/specifications, development, and validation. The ideal candidate will be a team player who is passionate about delivering simple, effective, customer-focused products. This position will also function in partnership with renowned investigators at research institutions, industry, and clinical laboratories worldwide. This is a great opportunity to work with biochemists, chemists, non-R&D; functions, customers and vendors to create products to enable our customers to deliver high quality diagnostics.   Essential Functions   Develop web-based and desktop applications using the .NET framework (C#). Plan front and back-end schematics with UML modeling and user interface mockups. Establish, write, and validate product specifications and testing procedures related to the development of new software tools for molecular diagnostics. Communicate with customers for collaboration and feedback. Represent R&D; on project teams aimed at launching new software products. Communicate progress and results to team members in a clear and organized manner. Develop software based on relational databases (SQL Server or MySQL). Troubleshoot software-related performance issues. Work within the ISO 13485 and FDA QSR compliant Quality System. Maintain up to date and organized development notes. Quality of documentation must be sufficient to support patent claims. Perform other related duties and responsibilities as required and/or assigned.  Education:   Requires a Masters degree in computer science or related field plus at least 5 years of relevant experience.   Experience/Requirements:   The successful candidate will: Have excellent communication skills. Expertise with .NET framework (C#) for web-based and desktop applications is required. Expertise with website design (HTML, CSS, and Javascript) is required. Advanced knowledge of user interface design and aesthetics is required. Networking software experience (involving data transfer between multiple devices) is required. MySQL experience is required. Experience with web-based software security is preferred. Java experience is a plus. 1-2 years experience in clinical diagnostics field is preferred. Familiarity with statistical computation with R or JMP is a plus. Familiarity with software validation is a plus. (GAMP, FDA, ISO, etc.) is a plus. Be a self-starter and able to work independently. Have the ability to craft design requirements based on customer input and execute on those requirements across the full product development lifecycle from concept to launch. Be collegial and responsible. Ability to work with non-software scientists to develop tools for the clinical market. Have courage and confidence to take risks and learn from mistakes. Working Conditions:   Works in office and laboratory environments. Some travel may be required to attent scientific conferences once or twice per year. May be required to stand for long periods of time while performing duties. Must be able to work safely with chemicals and hazardous materials. May be required to lift up to 40 lbs.   This position is not eligible for relocation benefits.   We are proud to be an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer committed to hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce.
snippet: Ability to work with non-software scientists to develop tools for the clinical market. We are building a talented team of scientists and engineers dedicated to...

description: Job Description  We (Our Client) are one of the leading marketing technology company that helps mobile app publishers acquire more engaged users. Our Clients' campaign is powered by a bidding optimization engine trained on a proprietary data set of User Composites and App Constellations.  Are you ready to lead our Clients' next generation Data Science Engineering ?  If yes, then you will be our company's first data scientist to leverage the terabytes of diverse data systems to directly improve our algorithms and buying strategies.  You will also heavily influence our product roadmap wherein you will have to collaborate with the founders and the product team on ideas, and with the engineering team to create great analysis tooling and make our data sets accessible. You can code in either Python, R or Clojure to perform data analysis. You have an excellent academic record.  We embrace diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.  What’s in it for you? Glad you asked !! Excellent Base Salary + Great Benefits Package  Note: U.S. Citizens / Green Card Holders / EAD / H1B Visa Holders can apply.  Passionate and Dynamic Professionals please apply with your updated resume. Qualifications  null  Additional Information  Shoot your resumes to deepti @roljobs.com to know more.

description: Ardelyx? is a rapidly emerging biotech company. We develop therapeutics acting in the gastrointestinal  tract, and our technology relies on non-absorbable small molecules with highly specific modes of action  to address unmet needs with emphasis in the cardio-renal area. We are seeking a scientist with  expertise in pharmaceutical analysis to join our CMC team. This is a hands-on position, requiring  significant laboratory expertise. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate exquisite attention to  detail, both in the lab, and in written communications.  Position Responsibilites  ? Develop, document, transfer, and troubleshoot phase-appropriate analytical methods for small  molecule drug candidates  o Stability-indicating methods for drug substance and drug product  o Dissolution testing for drug product  ? Independently propose and initiate laboratory experimentation--both at Ardelyx and at our  outsourcing partners  ? Design, lead and help execute pre-formulation characterization, drug substance salt form  screening experiments, and ?form? studies, involving third-party CROs as appropriate  ? Characterize and monitor the impurity profiles of novel drug substances and products  ? Establish and manage or co-manage relationships with third-party CROs/CMOs  ? In our matrixed and ?cross-training? environment, lead or co-lead manufacturing activities for  both DS and DP  ? Independently interpret and present data to a broad scientific audience; write scientific reports  ? Lead by example in the laboratory, and help grow our personnel. May have direct reports  ? Co-author relevant sections of CMC Regulatory documents  Job Requirements  ? BS, MS, or PhD degree in Pharmaceutical, Analytical, or related Chemical field. Depending on  education level, 5 or more years of direct experience in analytical pharmaceutical research and  development  ? Creative and adaptive problem solving  ? Hands-on experience in chromatographic analysis and dissolution testing is required  ? Knowledge of FDA & ICH guidance for early drug development, and hands-on experience in  analytical method development in a regulated (cGMP) environment  ? Thorough knowledge of techniques required for physicochemical characterization of drug  substance  ? Experience with design-of-experiment techniques is desirable  At Ardelyx, you will experience an innovative and dynamic research environment. We are seeking  the best in class scientists, advanced thinkers, and people who thrive on collaboration to co-create  the future. You will be working with some of the industry's best scientists in a team environment  focused on world class research.

description: Contribute to multiple projects relating to all aspects of assay development: from conceptual design, proof-of-concept, demonstration of clinical correlations, to validation. Work with other research associates and scientists within the team to design and execute experiments for advanced cellular analysis, using traditional as well as novel methods. Analyze data and communicate results in an intense, inter-disciplinary environment. Demonstrate a keen interest in learning new skills and growing the scope of their scientific and technical expertise. Use multiple laboratory techniques such as DNA/RNA purification, microscopy, protein conjugation and purification, cell culture, and UV-Vis, etc. The individual will also quickly develop familiarity with other techniques. Rapidly become part of a close-knit and highly-driven team of scientists and research associates. REQUIREMENTS Master's degree in Biological sciences: molecular and cell biology, immunology, or Physical Biosciences: bio/chemical-engineering, biophysics, or related field from a top tier scientific university and superior academic credentials. 1-2 years of experience or B.S. with 2-4 years of experience. Recent graduates with experience in academic labs are also encouraged to apply. Unfaltering determination to excel in an intense start-up environment. Excellent academic record; a driven individual who has a strong desire to learn. Demonstrably rigorous experimentalist with attention to detail and a creative problem solver. Extensive experience with most of the following laboratory techniques: biochemical signaling assays, cell-based assays, microscopy, bioconjugations using off-the-shelf kits, UV-Vis, and cell culture. Ability to effectively handle multiple projects at the same time and work in a highly interdisciplinary team. Ability to support research and development work as an associate in industrial, corporate setting.

description: Job Description: Job Summary: We are seeking a Clinical Lab Scientist with strong background in genomics and experience in Next Generation Sequencing. The candidate will be a part of highly dynamic and diverse group of scientists to help identify cause and problems in unexplained heritable diseases and inherited cancer predisposition. As part of this, the candidate will be actively involved in developing, testing and implementing traditional and next generation sequencing platforms in our Clinical Genomics Laboratory. He/ She should understand and apply the correct control measures and protocol in cases of abnormal results and report any discrepancies to the senior staff. Calibrate assays where calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance. Perform troubleshooting and report any instrument malfunction to the seniors. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory.  Essential Functions Perform laboratory tests, procedures, and analysis according to the laboratory's standard operating procedures. Clearly and accurately record all assays and results in the lab information systems and maintain lab notebooks. Generate SOPs and Quality control documents for the genomics laboratory. Interact and work collaboratively with all different groups within and outside clinical genomics service. Adheres to all safety/ health and state/ federal regulatory requirements and procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test result to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.  Qualificiations: Minimum qualification  Education: BS degree in a work related discipline/ field from an accredited college or university  Experience: At least two (2) years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience in Next generation sequencing platform.  License/ Certification: Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS) or Clinical Genetic Molecular Biology Scientist (CGMBS) or CLS Limited.  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  Strong background and working experience of cutting edge DNA/ RNA based genomic technologies such as Next generation sequencing, Sanger sequencing, Genotyping along with molecular biology techniques such as Nucleic acid isolation, PCR, qPCR, Droplet Digital PCR etc. Experience in Development, Testing, Validation and Implementation of Laboratory tests. Ability to adapt to fast pace and constantly changing work environment. Ability to organize, prioritize, multi task, and adapt to changing priorities. Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Ability to identify and device solutions to solve problems. Ability to use equipment related software's for data analysis. Excellent skills in using Microsoft Office Excel, word, power point. Knowledge of local, state, and federal regulatory requirements related to area of functional responsibility. Demonstrate good lab practices.
jobtitle: Clinical Lab Scientist, Genomics and Next Generation Sequencing

description: Perform experimental work as part of assay development activities. Develop daily work plans, document experimental work, analyze data and report results. Identify problems, communicate them to the team, and develop solutions. REQUIREMENTS M.S. with 2+ years of related experience or Ph.D. in Chemistry or Biochemistry related scientific discipline. Strong foundation in chemistry fundamentals as well as experimental design and solid laboratory skills. Must have hands-on experience working in the field of assay development. Experience with optical methods (absorbance luminescence, fluorescence) is desirable. Experience in formulating assay reagents for stability and rapid dissolution is also a plus. The ability to be an excellent problem solver coupled with a strong work ethic is required. Must be able to screen reagents, and design and develop novel assays. Ability to work independently within a team and share responsibilities. Excellent time management, data presentation and communication skills. Strong experimental and analytical skills. Familiar with biological laboratory techniques. Strong foundation in experimental design and ability to execute complex experiments. Desire to learn new skills and grow his/her knowledge of assays and biological sciences. Strong collaborative and team work attributes. INDLP

description: Here is a learning environment like no other! At DuPont Industrial Biosciences, we are truly changing the world and having fun doing interesting science. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting; in which robust team collaboration, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks. We leverage our cutting-edge biotechnology capabilities to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy.   2016 Summer Internships at DuPont Industrial Biosciences  Palo Alto R&D; Center   DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers. We’ve developed several opportunities for students to gain the valuable experience they’ll need to succeed in today’s demanding job market. Are you interested in the scientific interfaces between biochemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation engineering, and microbial physiology leading to performance benefits in real-world industrial applications? We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   This summer Intern will explore enzyme native and denatured states with a focus on understanding enzyme reversibility and the effect on enzyme activity. Multiple methods of protein denaturation - chemical, pH-induced, and thermal – will be tested and compared. The intern should have a working knowledge of protein biochemistry and biophysics and some experience with enzyme assays.   Job Qualifications Qualified candidates will exhibit the following characteristics:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemical Engineering or a related field Have completed your sophomore year of undergrad education and will continue your education in the fall Have the ability to work in an interdisciplinary scientific setting High level of initiative and the ability to work in a team environment Exhibit exceptional analytical instrumentation skills Exhibit exceptional bench top analytical skills Ability to document results, analyze data, draw conclusions, and communicate findings Familiarity with theoretical and practical aspects of biochemistry and enzymology Our Palo Alto R&D; Center offers an intensive 13-week science internship program, in which interns develop a science project and take part in a variety of learning activities. You won’t spend your summer in just a single department or lab – DuPont Industrial Biosciences interns get exposure to a broad range of scientific disciplines. At the end of the program you’ll deliver a presentation of your ideas and findings, developing practical real-life skills. Our interns are paid a competitive hourly rate and are responsible for their own housing and transportation for the summer.
jobtitle: Summer Internship: Exploring the feasibility of denaturing formulations
snippet: DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers....

description: Imagine ways to make sharing and growing the world's knowledge easier, and being able to transform these ideas into reality. As a product engineer, you will be an advocate for the Quora community and responsible for creating and polishing features to keep people fully engaged with the product. At the same time, you should feel comfortable using data to inform product decisions that would maximize impact.   Quora truly takes our mission to heart: we grow and share the world's knowledge within the product and within the company. We have a strong culture of learning from our community qualitatively and quantitatively. Our product engineers use their deep technical knowledge and cutting-edge technologies to build the product. We also have a strong sense of product and empathize with the community. Balancing these skills lets us have a large impact on the product and on the world.   Responsibilities:  Work on a product team focused on a major user-facing area of Quora. Identify high impact features that achieve goals, and be able to explain rationale for your decisions. Design and implement product and platform features at massive scale with data-driven iteration. Drive projects from ideation to production using the full technology stack. Work with designers, fellow engineers and data scientists to prototype and implement functionality and analyze impact. Work quickly and effectively on multiple projects, prioritizing effectively to ship new features and scale up existing ones. Requirements:  Passion for experimentation and new ideas. Love of both the Quora product and community. Interest in using data and user research to inform product decisions. Experience with effective A/B testing is a plus. Experience with product development at major web and mobile companies. Ability to think holistically about a complex, social product, and map big picture metrics to a realistic actionable plan. Knowledge of Python and JavaScript a plus.

description: The Client is a stealth mode security startup that is leveraging big data and advanced analytics to enable enterprises to rapidly discover, prioritize and investigate security events. We are an early stage company with strong team of security experts, distributed systems experts, and data scientists working in a flat, collaborative environment. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a founding technology team, helping define and shape innovative solutions to one of the most interesting and challenging problems facing modern enterprises.  Position Overview They are seeking top-performing and entrepreneurial sales executives to develop and expand our customer base. Candidates should have a strong desire to build and grow a business, experience positioning risk and/or security services to executives, and demonstrated success in exceeding sales goals. The Salesperson will be responsible for establishing the Client's security product directly to enterprise clients in various industries on a national scale.  Responsibilities: Work with executive team to identify key stakeholder targets to proactively establish new relationships and business opportunities. Leverage and grow existing business relationships Drive day-to-day integrated account management processes to include: account planning, enablement, demand generation and operational processes. Lead and drive the overall client relationship strategy inclusive of proposal creation, presentations, and pricing strategy. Understand the market and competitive landscape to build go-to-market strategies that differentiates the client in the marketplace. Think strategically and entrepreneurially to work effectively and targeted for the greatest business growth. Establish partnerships and alliances to extend our reach and market opportunities.  Qualifications: Required Skills 5 + years’ experience of success selling security product Experience some of the following security products desired: SIEM, Security Analytics, Forensics, Intrusion Detection Experience building relationships with security operations and incident response functions Demonstrated success consistently meeting individual sales targets. Proven success in building and leading a sales team to launch a new business Experience in technical sales / sales engineering is desired Flexible, enthusiastic and entrepreneurial spirit. Executive presence – ability to communicate with excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Highly developed interpersonal skills and ability to effectively sell, build client relationships and successfully negotiate mutual benefit. Ability to travel several days a week. Education Required Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college, MBA or advanced degree preferred in business or technology field. Formal sales training.

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies.   We are seeking an experienced Director/Head of Sales to lead our global sales efforts, with an initial focus on developing the North American market. The position will provide the opportunity for an experienced sales professional to take on a leadership role at a company that stands to make a major impact on the field of neuroscience. You will lead a well-organized sales process and be responsible for selling nVista Starter Packages (a comprehensive end-to-end solution including the nVista product, Mosaic software, support and training, and consumables) to neuroscience research labs at Universities and Institutes across the world. You will also be responsible for implementing strategies for repeat sales and for driving Account Sales (e.g., through sales of consumables and Care packages). You must have a proven track record of closing sales opportunities for sophisticated instrumentation and solutions in the life science research industry.   Responsibilities:  Hit sales targets for nVista Starter Packages in the US, Canada, and select international markets. Develop a well-organized sales process that together with Marketing proactively generates new leads, qualifies leads according to scientific fit, and nurtures leads through to opportunity conversion. . Actively pursue sales prospects through sales presentations and leveraging Application Scientists as required. Implement strategies for repeat sales and drive sales of consumables and Inscopix Care packages. Build and lead a lean salesforce to scale-up sales efforts. Use data-driven analytics to optimize sales cycle and other key sales performance metrics. Manage, report, and forecast on region-based sales of nVista Starter Packages. Represent Inscopix at major scientific meetings and conferences. Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in Biology or related scientific discipline (Neuroscience background is preferred). 10+ years of experience in life sciences research industry. Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets. Demonstrated success managing and leading Sales Representatives. Experience with CRM databases such as Salesforce. Excellent communication skills with the ability to work directly with all levels of the organization as well as with customers (especially with Principal Investigators). Willingness to travel (20-40%) for customer visits and conferences. How to Apply:   Please forward cover letter and resume   About Inscopix:   Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate causal neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista HD, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson’s, autism, and schizophrenia.

description: A generously funded (more than $13 mln in seed and series A funding) and ambitious early-stage startup with a team of accomplished technical experts in search, machine learning and AI fields, is looking for Inference Scientist to join their team and work on distributed Inference platform that continuously learns ("infers") ever-improving statistical models from web-scale data. The platform follows fundamental probabilistic principles and rigorously evaluates and benchmarks itself on real-world tasks.   Why you should join: Opportunity to work on a small team of ~10 amazing engineers and data scientists. Spend 100% of your time working on a problem with virtually unlimited potential impact. Generous salary, equity, and benefits well above industry norms, including unlimited PTO. Flexible hours and family-friendly culture that values sustained productivity and happiness. Amazing office in historic downtown Palo Alto.  Responsibilities: Establish and expand the rigorous statistical foundations of the inference platform. Develop prototypes and execute experiments to help guide engineering efforts. Explore new model families and inference algorithms.  Requirements: PhD in Computer Science (AI/ML specialization), Statistics, Mathematics (Probability), or equivalent. Strong foundations in probability, linear algebra, and optimization. Background in statistical modeling and inference. Strong drive and desire to work for an early stage startup company and make is a success.  Pluses: Experience with large-scale industrial applications of statistical modeling and inference. Experience with statistical modeling across a diverse range of data sets and domains. Knowledge of Go, C/C++, Mathematica  To apply: Please send your resume in WORD or PDF format to lilia@eltisolutions.com Place the text "Inference Scientist" in the subject line. Provide the date you are available to start work.
snippet: Opportunity to work on a small team of ~10 amazing engineers and data scientists. Place the text "Inference Scientist" in the subject line....

description: Jazz Pharmaceuticals is seeking an experienced clinical research scientist with an advanced degree to join the Life Cycle Management Clinical Development Team in the Sleep Therapeutic Area (TA). You will be responsible for generating global (US and Ex US) clinical development plans and protocols to support new indications, medical monitoring of trials, the oversight and interpretation of clinical trials data, clinical interactions with investigators and multidisciplinary groups across the company including R&D;, commercial, regulatory and business development. Serve as clinical leader on trials that have the potential to expand the indications for molecules currently in development as well as for commercialized products. -Develop and implement strategic clinical plans in alignment with LCM goals for the Sleep TA. Identify and interact with opinion leaders to integrate current clinical practice and guidelines into global clinical development plans. including relevant industry developments Work with project team members, regulatory affairs and senior management to integrate competitive intelligence and regulatory strategy with the clinical strategic plan. Develop phase II -IV clinical protocols and work closely with other functional areas within the R&D; Departments (regulatory, clinical operations, data management, biostatistics, clinical pharmacology, preclinical) to facilitate the execution of clinical trials and programs Provide clinical input to Statistical Analysis Plan and assume responsibility for the clinical review and interpretation of the clinical trial data. Lead preparation of clinical portions of all relevant regulatory filings (IND, NDA, etc) and review sections from other functional areas Develop strategy for and lead clinical advisory board meetings to obtain strategic input into clinical development programs Serve as clinical (and medical, if MD) resource for clinical issues raised by internal and external collaborators, investigators, consultants and business development and investor contacts Serve as lead clinical (and medical, if MD) representative with regulatory agencies Provide strategic input on new product concepts, long-range strategic plans and licensing opportunities Provide clinical leadership in collaborations with strategic partners. Supervise and be accountable for the generation of and management of messaging in clinical program and regulatory submissions Accountable for success of clinical development strategy and implementation Represent the company at scientific, industry, regulatory, advocacy and financial community meetings and presentations, as well as other public relations opportunities. Monitor clinical trials for safety Work in conjunction with Drug Safety and Pharmacovigilance to insure timely reporting of safety signals to regulatory authorities  Essential Qualifications: PhD, PharmD, MD, DO degree – advanced degree required, medical degree a plus. Experience in clinical development in neurology, sleep or psychiatry preferred. 10 years of clinical development experience. Demonstrated scientific and therapeutic expertise Excellent written and verbal communications skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment  Preferred Requirements: Experience with IND and NDA submissions preferred Experience with interactions with regulators and business partners preferred Collaborative and flexible in personal interactions at all levels of the company Ability to work proactively and effectively, with exceptional creative problem solving skills Proven strategic planning and communication skills across multiple disciplines Demonstrated ability to work with senior management and provide input towards the setting and execution of corporate and departmental objectives Ability to travel, required Description of Physical Demands Occasional mobility within office environment. Routinely sitting for extended periods of time. Constantly operating a computer, printer, telephone and other similar office machinery. Description of Work Environment Work indoors in normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, fumes, vibrations and temperature changes. Frequent computer use at workstation. May move from one work location to another occasionally. Responsibilities may require a work schedule that may include working outside of “normal” work hours, in order to meet business demands. Occasional public contact requiring appropriate business apparel.  Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.
jobtitle: Senior Director, LCM, Sleep Clinical Development

description: Description: A full-service acute care facility serving the residents of Tracy for over 60 years, Sutter Tracy Community Hospital (STCH) has a total of 82 inpatient beds. STCH provides a wide range of inpatient and outpatient services including\: a 24-hour emergency department, inpatient and ambulatory surgical services, endoscopy lab, intensive care, diagnostic imaging, laboratory and rehabilitation services including physical, speech and occupational therapy. STCH also has specialized care for Hemodialysis, Family Birthing Center, Continence Center and a Pain Management Center. STCH is a not-for-profit, community-based hospital, affiliated with Sutter Health since 1993. For more information about Sutter Tracy Community Hospital, please visit www.suttertracy.org  Under the supervision of the section supervisor, the Clinical Laboratory Scientist performs generalized and specialized assignments or functions in clinical laboratory technology. description: The Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) at SLAC National Accelerator Lab is the world’s first hard X-ray free electron laser. LCLS produces pulses of X-rays more than a billion times brighter than the most powerful existing synchrotron sources. Scientists use these highly focused, intense beams of X-rays to reveal the identity and arrangement of atoms in a wide range of materials. The tiny wavelength of X-rays enables study of the arrangement of atoms in metals, semiconductors, ceramics, polymers, catalysts, plastics, and biological molecules. The ultrashort duration of these X-ray pulses can capture images of atoms and molecules in motion. LCLS is operated as an international user facility, attracting hundreds of scientists from around the world to conduct first-of-a-kind experiments to study fundamental processes of chemistry, technology, and life itself.

Each month, xAd's patented location platform helps marketers reach over 300 million people globally via more than 30 thousand popular mobile applications. With xAd, marketers can say goodbye to assumptive marketing and reach the right people at real places in real-time with precision, relevance and confidence. Learn more: www.xad.com. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Position Summary  This position will focus on analytical characterization activities in support of therapeutic protein development. Responsibilities will include development of new product specific assays as well as routine testing of in-process samples. Will work independently and serve as subject matter expert for their focus area, including leading method development, qualification, and technology transfer activities. The position will also perform routine testing and general support activities as needed to meet the goals of Revance Therapeutics’ development programs.   Essential Duties  • Regularly apply basic theory and principles from one’s technical expertise to develop, optimize, and transfer analytical assays for product characterization, lot release, and stability testing.  • Coordinate and conduct routine testing support for other groups within Revance Development and Manufacturing Functions.  • Perform routine instrument/equipment maintenance and calibration checks to ensure the proper function and compliant use.  • Provide regular progress updates to manager and present data to internal and external audiences in a succinct and well organized manner.  • Author test methods and development reports.  • Serve as subject matter expert for at least one technical area and train other laboratory personnel on the use and maintenance of equipment.  • Lead technical transfer of assays to and from contract test laboratories or to QC.  • Plan experiments with limited manager oversight and work independently to achieve deliverables with minimal instruction.  • Develop and implement laboratory policies for critical reagents, data management, organizational performance, and continuous improvement.  • Maintain laboratory notebooks and forms consistent with Good Documentation Practices.  • Maintain adequate supplies of laboratory reagents and coordinate biohazard and chemical waste disposal.   Requirements Qualifications  • Solid training in general laboratory practices (e.g., buffer preparation, sample dilution, micro-pipetting).  • Experience in the development and optimization of assays for pharmaceutical characterization.  • Experience in one or more of the following areas, including training and troubleshooting experience:  Chromatography or capillary electrophoresis  Mass spectrometry  Immunochemical assays  Spectroscopy  Cell based assays  • Working knowledge of cGMP practices and ICH guidelines.  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.  • Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to efficiently function in a team-oriented environment.  • Excellent planning and organizational skills with good documentation, record management habits, and attention to detail.  • Ability to handle multiple projects and to demonstrate initiative and take accountability.  • Flexible and adaptable to meet the needs of the organization.   Preferred Education  • Chemistry or Biological Science degree: bachelors with 8+ years, masters with 6+ years, or doctorate with 2+ years of experience in biopharmaceutical analytical development.  • This is a senior technical position; level is dependent on experience and qualifications.   Preferred Additional Skills (i.e., Computer)  • Proficient with Microsoft-based applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

description: SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is one of 17 Department of Energy (DOE) National Laboratories.   Operated by Stanford University on behalf of the DOE, SLAC develops and operates some of the world’s premier science facilities. The Advance Instrumentation for Research Division in the Technology Innovation Directorate (TID-AIR) is involved in many national and international projects, among others the instrument development for the Large Synoptic Survey Telescope (LSST) camera, the Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) experiments, the Cryogenic Dark Matter Search (CDMS) experiment, the LHC ATLAS detector at CERN, and accelerator controls for LCLS-II.   TID-AIR has a centrally managed summer internship program for undergraduate students. Each intern is partnered with a mentor, typically a scientist, engineer, or other technical staff, who directs the internship project during the summer. The primary goal of the program is to provide interns with a stimulating, real-world research experience. To some extent technical projects are matched to the interests and skills of each intern, but are ultimately determined by the programmatic needs of the facility.   Project Description  The intern will be in charge of the setup of a beam loss detector research laboratory for the Advanced Control Systems (ACS) Department in the Advanced Instrumentation for Research Division at SLAC. The intern will work closely to engineers and physics to learn specific tasks. He/she will be responsible for setting up test bench for sensors including: sensor instrumentation, control and data acquisition systems, as well as modeling and simulation system for data validation. The detectors under study and characterization in this laboratory will be used for beam loss detection on the LCLS I and LCLS II accelerators. Specific responsibilities (Including but not limited to):  Initial setup and organization of the laboratory space and equipment. Setup, configuration and installation of sensors and their instrumentation. Implementation of control and data acquisition systems. Characterize the sensors experimentally. Create mathematical model of the sensors and characterize them through simulations. Validate experimental data with simulation results. Sensors under study:  LCLS 1 MR and LCLS IIBeam Loss Detector detectors MPS Undulator Beam Loss Fast Wire Scanner Detector Point Loss Detectors with Diamond Sensors Note: This is an hourly, non-benefits eligible temporary-nonexempt, summer internship position (work at 50% full-time equivalent or more), not to exceed 980 hours in six consecutive months. Eligible applicants must be at least 18 years of age and currently enrolled in an educational program or recently graduated and have US work authorization.   Qualifications:  Must be enrolled in a degree program in engineering, physics or related field Problem-solving and analysis skills Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment Organizational skills and ability to multi-task and complete assignments Strong verbal and written communication SLAC Competencies:  Effective Decisions : Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner. Self-Development : Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing. Dependability : Can be counted on to deliver results with a sense of personal responsibility for expected outcomes. Initiative : Pursues work and interactions proactively with optimism, positive energy, and motivation to move things forward. Adaptability : Flexes as needed when change occurs, maintains an open outlook while adjusting and accommodating changes. Communication: Ensures effective information flow to various audiences and creates and delivers clear, appropriate written, spoken, presented messages. Relationships : Builds relationships to foster trust, collaboration, and a positive climate to achieve common goals.  Qualifications:

description: Here is a learning environment like no other! At DuPont Industrial Biosciences, we are truly changing the world and having fun doing interesting science. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting; in which robust team collaboration, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks. We leverage our cutting-edge biotechnology capabilities to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy.   2016 Summer Internships at DuPont Industrial Biosciences  Palo Alto R&D; Center   DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers. We’ve developed several opportunities for students to gain the valuable experience they’ll need to succeed in today’s demanding job market. Are you interested in the scientific interfaces between biochemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation engineering, and microbial physiology leading to performance benefits in real-world industrial applications? We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   We are looking for a driven and creative summer intern to investigate characteristics of protein solubility. This internship will focus on the use of mass spectrometry to examine solubility parameters, and other analytical techniques will be applied (e.g. gel electrophoresis, spectroscopy, liquid chromatography, enzymatic activity assays). The ideal candidate will be pursuing a degree in analytical chemistry, biochemistry, or related life sciences and be familiar with the basics of protein chemistry and enzymology. The intern must be an individual who is detail oriented, friendly, and thrives in a highly collaborative environment.   Job Qualifications Qualified candidates will exhibit the following characteristics:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemical Engineering or a related field Have completed your sophomore year of undergrad education and will continue your education in the fall Have the ability to work in an interdisciplinary scientific setting High level of initiative and the ability to work in a team environment Exhibit exceptional analytical instrumentation skills Exhibit exceptional bench top analytical skills Ability to document results, analyze data, draw conclusions, and communicate findings Familiarity with theoretical and practical aspects of biochemistry and enzymology Our Palo Alto R&D; Center offers an intensive 13-week science internship program, in which interns develop a science project and take part in a variety of learning activities. You won’t spend your summer in just a single department or lab – DuPont Industrial Biosciences interns get exposure to a broad range of scientific disciplines. At the end of the program you’ll deliver a presentation of your ideas and findings, developing practical real-life skills. Our interns are paid a competitive hourly rate and are responsible for their own housing and transportation for the summer.
jobtitle: Summer Internship: Evaluating Protein Solubility using Mass Spectrometry

description: Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.  JOB DESCRIPTION:Primary Job Function:  An engineering professional who, working with little or no supervision, applies scientific knowledge, engineering knowledge, mathematics, and ingenuity to complete assignments related to a specific technical field or discipline. A Senior Engineer has general knowledge of other related disciplines beyond their own.  Core Job Responsibilities: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.  PROJECT MANAGEMENT:  Independently plans and conducts small- to medium-size assigned projects within engineering specialty requiring conventional types of plans, investigations, and/or equipment. Manages multiple, often concurrent, projects and meets deadlines. Maintains project controls and reporting for cost, scope and schedule; develops execution strategy including procurement; balances multiple demands within an assignment, e.g. executes contingency plans to recover from schedule slippage and financial overruns. Facilitates the definition of a project scope with clients. Establishes workable and trackable schedules. Works with staff, outside firms, and/or consultants to agree on plans and timetables for a specific project; identifies pinch points or conflicts, e.g. determines verification and tracking mechanisms; sets performance metrics; assigns responsibilities for team members; develops a budget. Independently performs economic analysis and feasibility studies related to project alternatives. Responsible for achieving the project's financial targets in support of business objectives.  TECHNICAL/DESIGN:  Anticipates future directions. Benchmarks internally and externally. Recognizes changes in the environment and present resources as indicators of future problems and opportunities; prepares for such eventualities, e.g. initiates plan to acquire new engineering skills required by changes in technology. Independently executes, and/or directs others in the execution of, the design of products/processes/equipment/systems/facilities by applying new engineering theories, concepts, and techniques within the discipline. Designs and leads complex experiments, often with multiple variables, gathers data, and performs preliminary analysis. Reports findings. Prepares and communicates recommendations and respective action plans.  PROBLEM SOLVING/INNOVATION:  Produces unique and cost-effective results. Establishes alternate use possibilities and incorporates flexibility; balances system costs with benefits provided; oversees design work of internal and external consultants, e.g. integrates complex manufacturing processes and defines product flow within regulatory constraints. Integrates financial with technical data. Analyzes complex interdisciplinary problems and identifies their impact; establishes probabilities; draws conclusions reflecting broad business needs; understands organizational and financial impact of recommendations, e.g. applies regulatory requirements and recommends best course of action; sets complex design and process requirements. Improves methods/designs/processes. Recognizes and implements good ideas/innovations/costs reductions; consistently generates/adopts original solutions to problems and reduces them to practices, e.g. implements better methods to reduce component cost; creatively applies others' design ideas.  ORGANIZATIONAL INTERFACE:  Mentors others by sharing technical expertise and providing feedback and guidance. Interfaces frequently with inter-organizational and outside customer contacts. Represents the organization in providing solutions to difficult technical issues associated with specific projects. Prepares written communication. Conveys information effectively through formal and informal documents with team members, designers, technicians, and other technical personnel, both internal and external to Abbott, using appropriate communication protocols, e.g. develops proposals; conducts reviews; provides audience targeted content; prepares project summaries and design documentation. Obtains approval to proceed with proposed action plans. Establishes networks. Follows through on project goals; contributes willingly and incorporates the ideas of others; shares resources, knowledge, and accountability to benefit the objectives of the business, e.g. participates in team meetings; serves as a functional expert in cross-project design review. Builds relationships. Initiates and cultivates open, honest relationships with colleagues, customers, contractors, and vendors by establishing rapport, developing an understanding of others' needs, promoting common goals, and following through on commitments, e.g. offers assistance; interacts effectively with stakeholders at appropriate levels of the organization. Resolves underlying problems. Identifies full range of customer/client needs and proposes solutions to address them; makes alterations in products or services to better meet (recognized or unrecognized) customer need, e.g. partners with an outside vendor to provide a better deliverable.  COMPLIANCE:  Complies with all regulations and standards for quality, Environmental, Health, Safety and Energy (EHS&E;) Global Policies, Abbott Engineering Standards, and other governance areas as applicable. Ensures quality and effectiveness of assigned tasks. Has awareness of the potential consequences (defects and failure modes) of design changes to established processes. Identifies areas of risk with respect to compliance.  ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES MAY INCLUDE:  Develops procedures and standards. Coordinates with technical support personnel to conduct prototype or experimental runs of products or processes. Directs the efforts of others such as technicians and outside resources. Performs tasks such as writing Requests for Capital Expenditures (RCEs), safety/quality checklists, scope documents, etc. Develops and executes validation protocols. Resolves problems, such as production process deviations, vendor deviations from specification, urgent out-of-stock replacements, and crisis situations requiring fast, astute decisions with rapid implementation by utilizing technical training and experience. Provides training on systems. Represents engineering on corporate and division task forces.  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES MAY INCLUDE:  Provides mentoring in technical and organizational areas within work group; monitors the improvement of other engineer(s), e.g. delegates challenging tasks to others to help them develop; provides constructive and timely feedback. Participates in the evaluation of assigned staff/project team members and in the identification of development needs. May supervise other engineers or technicians.  RELATED JOB TITLE EXAMPLES:  Senior Engineer Engineer I Senior Specialist Technical Lead Scientist II Metallurgist Senior Manufacturing Engineer Senior Project Coordinator  Position Accountability / Scope:  Works under general direction. Independently determines and develops approach to solutions. Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives. Identifies and quantifies technical risks and their consequences relative to the success of part of a project; recommends appropriate action, e.g. reports calculations and recommendations in terms concrete enough for management to make an informed decision. Decisions or recommendations would typically achieve department/project objectives. Drives functional performance that ensures the highest standards in quality, customer service, and regulatory compliance are met.  Minimum Education:  A Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, science, or closely related discipline is desired, or equivalent technical experience plus demonstrated competence, with a desired 5+ years of significant engineering and/or operational experience. Mechanical Engineering degree preferred. A post-graduate education/degree is desired, and may contribute towards the desired years of experience.  Minimum Experience / Training Required:  Strong SolidWorks experience desired. Equipment test method validation is a plus Medical Device product experience preferred Has demonstrated competency within a discipline. Possesses a strong technical knowledge and application of concepts, practices, and procedures. Works on problems of complex scope where analysis of situations or data involves multiple competing factors. - Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Interacts well with diverse groups within engineering and maintains strong working relationships with internal and external collaborators. Listens to and understands others' points of view and articulates tactfully and respectfully one's own perspective orally, in writing, and in presentations. Works well with other engineers in a collaborative, fast-paced goal-driven environment. Possesses interpersonal skills to negotiate and reconcile differences. Has a technical background in health care, nutritional products, laboratory diagnostics, medical devices, pharmaceutical, or similar industries (preferred). Has demonstrated competency with financial systems and in fiscal control.  JOB FAMILY: Engineering-General DIVISION: AMO Medical Optics LOCATION: United States - California - Milpitas  ADDITIONAL LOCATIONS: WORK SHIFT: Standard TRAVEL: Yes, 5 % of the Time MEDICAL SURVEILLANCE: Yes SIGNIFICANT WORK ACTIVITIES: Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day) Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
