description: VMware NSX is a network virtualization platform that delivers the operational model of a virtual machine for the network. Virtual networks reproduce the network model in software, allowing complex multi-tier network topologies to be created and provisioned programmatically in seconds. NSX includes a library of logical networking services – logical switches, logical routers, logical firewalls, logical load balancers, logical VPN, QoS, and distributed security.  A self-service interface allows users to create custom combinations of these services in isolated software-based virtual networks that support existing applications without modification or deliver unique requirements for new application workloads. Similar to virtual machines in compute, virtual networks are programmatically provisioned and managed independent of networking hardware. Decoupling from hardware introduces agility, speed and operational efficiency that has transformed data center economics.  Why work for our Division VMware’s world-class, award-winning R&D; team is comprised of thousands of top-notch computer scientists and software engineers that are transforming computing through virtualization. Members of the R&D; team voice their creative ideas and watch them become initiatives, participate in exciting short-term and long-term products on the VMware roadmap, initiate advanced research projects, and/or write and test code that ships. At VMware, our engineers continue to learn and grow by working with top professionals from around the world and recent graduates of top universities and by taking advantage of our extensive internal training opportunities and generous external education assistance program. R&D; team members work on the latest computing equipment and have access to the ACM and IEEE libraries. VMware has R&D; offices in: Silicon Valley; Burlington, MA; Cambridge, MA; Broomfield, CO; Sofia, Bulgaria; Aarhus, Denmark; London, UK; Herzliya, Israel; Bangalore, India; and Beijing, China.  Why work with our Group Engineers interested in systems architecture, systems software, and distributed systems get to design and implement novel operating system techniques and algorithms for managing both virtual and real computer hardware. They work on harnessing the power of highly sophisticated computer and storage hardware.  Job Description  Opportunity Snapshot: VMware is looking for a Staff Engineer who is interested in joining our Software Defined Datacenter team.  Responsibilities: As a hands-on developer, be capable of fully understanding the networking system and implementing and guiding the changes required to maximize virtual and physical I/O performance and scalability.  Work on networking resource management requirements for virtual networks and virtual machines; work on kernel and user space software; problem analysis, resolution, and debugging.  Requirements: Extensive experience in C/C++/Java coding on Linux or Windows, algorithms and data structures. Solid knowledge of modern UNIX kernels (i.e., Linux, BSD, Solaris, AIX, or HP/UX) in kernel/C development, debugging, problem and performance analysis. Knowledge of CPU internals, CPU schedulers, memory management  Good Understanding of layer-2, and/or layer-3 network protocols and technologies.  Good knowledge of Packet Forwarding Data Path in Routers and Switches.  Strong familiarity with TCP/IP protocol suites  Have dealt with ARP, ND6, DHCP etc IP/IPv6 Forwarding Plane experience, GRE Tunneling, PBR etc  Desired Skills: X86 platform CPU and server architecture  CPU scheduling and memory management, networking file system, SMP locking, interrupt routing  Distributed systems knowledge  Education: A Computer Science undergraduate and/or master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science is required. description: Job Description: Job Summary: We are seeking a Clinical Lab Scientist with strong background in genomics and experience in Next Generation Sequencing. The candidate will be a part of highly dynamic and diverse group of scientists to help identify cause and problems in unexplained heritable diseases and inherited cancer predisposition. As part of this, the candidate will be actively involved in developing, testing and implementing traditional and next generation sequencing platforms in our Clinical Genomics Laboratory. He/ She should understand and apply the correct control measures and protocol in cases of abnormal results and report any discrepancies to the senior staff. Calibrate assays where calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance. Essential Functions Perform laboratory tests, procedures, and analysis according to the laboratory's standard operating procedures. Clearly and accurately record all assays and results in the lab information systems and maintain lab notebooks. Generate SOPs and Quality control documents for the genomics laboratory. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test result to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  Strong background and working experience of cutting edge DNA/ RNA based genomic technologies such as Next generation sequencing, Sanger sequencing, Genotyping along with molecular biology techniques such as Nucleic acid isolation, PCR, qPCR, Droplet Digital PCR etc. Experience in Development, Testing, Validation and Implementation of Laboratory tests. Ability to adapt to fast pace and constantly changing work environment. Ability to organize, prioritize, multi task, and adapt to changing priorities. Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Ability to identify and device solutions to solve problems. Ability to use equipment related software's for data analysis. Excellent skills in using Microsoft Office Excel, word, power point. Knowledge of local, state, and federal regulatory requirements related to area of functional responsibility. Demonstrate good lab practices.

description: A generously funded (more than $13 mln in seed and series A funding) and ambitious early-stage startup with a team of accomplished technical experts in search, machine learning and AI fields, is looking for Inference Engineer to join their team and work on distributed Inference platform that continuously learns ("infers") ever-improving statistical models from web-scale data. Strong drive and desire to work for an early stage startup company and make is a success. Strong foundations in probability, statistical analysis, linear algebra, and optimization. Some experience with C/C++ is highly desirable  Pluses: MS or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent. Experience with large-scale industrial applications of statistical modeling and inference. Experience with machine learning platforms. Understanding of recommendation engines and predictive ranking technologies.  To apply: Please send your resume in WORD or PDF format to lilia@eltisolutions.com Place the text "Inference Engineer" in the subject line. Provide the date you are available to start work.

description: Ardelyx™ is a rapidly emerging biotech company. We develop therapeutics acting in the gastrointestinal tract, and our technology relies on non-absorbable small molecules with highly specific modes of action to address unmet needs with emphasis in the cardio-renal area.   We are seeking a skilled senior medical writer with experience in publications and scientific communications for an exciting opportunity in our Fremont location.   Position Responsibilities  • Prepare documents that present clinical data objectively in a clear, concise format. The incumbent must show competence in writing, editing, and reviewing Clinical Study Reports (CSRs) and other clinical regulatory documents.  • Provide dedicated scientific authoring expertise to both the development and research groups.  • May need to liaise with external services and review documentation generated elsewhere (e.g., Clinical Research Organizations [CROs], subsidiaries, co-development partners), and internal support staff (e.g., for the preparation of tables, illustrations, and appendices).   Requirements  • Scientific degree, preferably PhD, PharmD, or medically qualified, or with equivalent relevant experience.  • Experience (preferably 5+ years) as MW, or equivalent, or presenting relevant qualifications.  • Skills that are prerequisite for a medical writer (including: appropriate mastery of English, ability to coordinate multidisciplinary teams, respect of deadlines and management of priorities while respecting quality needs, etc.).  • Ability to clearly, accurately, and concisely prepare all types of clinical regulatory documentation, including major submission and/or complex documents in English.  • Proven level of excellent spoken and written English, including understanding of English language usage and also standardized writing styles.  • Technical comfort with electronic document management and word processing software is required, particularly good Microsoft Word skills.  • Ability to work independently and proactively within a team.  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, while maintaining priorities and high quality results.   At Ardelyx, you will experience an innovative and dynamic research environment. We are seeking the best in class scientists, advanced thinkers, and people who thrive on collaboration to co-create the future. You will be working with some of the industry's best scientists in a team environment focused on world class research.   For consideration, please send your Resume/CV and cover letter indicating Senior Medical Writer, Req#6008 in the subject line by clicking Apply Now.   Ardelyx, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description: DuPont has a rich history of scientific discovery that has enabled countless innovations and today, we're looking for more people, in more places, to collaborate with us to make life the best that it can be. DuPont Industrial Biosciences is a leader in three strategic areas: BioRefineries, BioActives and BioMaterials. We leverage our cutting-edge protein engineering expertise to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting, in which high team spirit, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks.   Our Palo Alto, California Process Engineering and Technology Group is seeking a dynamic, highly trained bioprocess professional with an emphasis on process design, analysis, and developmentWe are seeking an individual with experience and interest in applying chemical engineering principles to develop scalable processes and feasibility analysis. Job Qualifications Requirements:  • PhD Biochemical or Chemical Engineering, with 3-6 years bio-processing industrial experience with hands on emphasis or BS/MS with equivalent work experience.  • Experience with separations bioprocess development and process modeling.  • Strong written and verbal communication skills  • Strong team player and mentor  • Self starter with good organizational skills and leadership potential.  • Some travel required.

Under general guidance, interface with contract laboratories and research organizations. Under guidance, participate in development of regulatory submissions. Requirements  Education/Experience: BS, MS, or PhD in Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences or a similar applicable discipline OR PhD 0+ years, MS 4+ years, BS 8+ years of relevant industry experience Experience testing inhalation products preferred, especially MDIs, with a variety of active pharmaceutical ingredients at different stages of development In-depth knowledge in one or more relevant fields: HPLC, GC, UPLC, MDI performance testing, assay and related substances testing Experience with method development and validation of assay and related substances desired Experience with controlled documents, documents for regulatory submissions and knowledge of GMP requirements is desired In-depth understanding of relevant ICH, USP, EP, and FDA guidance documents as well as cGXPs in support of MDI product testing is desired  Project leadership experience is desired Behaviors/Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills including technical writing (documentation of laboratory experiments) Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a complex, global matrix environment Demonstrated ability to collaborate and work successfully within a team

description: Description   Intuit is entrusted with the collective data of 37 million customers – a unique pool of data that covers the financial spectrum ranging from individual purchase history to business inventories. And with this data, Intuit is improving our customers’ lives so profoundly they can’t imagine going back to the old way of doing things.   Data is the catalyst that is powering new innovative products that will improve the lives of our customers and help Intuit grow its business   Come join the Intuit Data Engineering & Analytics (IDEA) team as a summer Data Engineer Intern focusing on Data Governance and work side-by-side with Intuit's data engineers, architects, data scientists, data analysts and product managers to develop big data platforms, real-time applications, large-scale distributed engineering operations and more   For example, we are developing peta-byte scale big data platforms, large-scale distributed services (i.e. multi-tenant profile services, a commerce graph, real-time data capture and audience segmentation…) and data-driven products/applications.   Our team uses the leading-edge big data technologies like AWS, Spark, Kafka, Cassandra, Hadoop, employs cutting-edge data science methods and continuously experiments with relevant emerging data technologies.   The objective of our summer internship program is to bring highly talented people into the organization and to put them to work on solving our most-important challenges. Our internship program is truly an 'early identification' program, focusing on identifying and investing in high potential university students early to encourage them to bring their talent back to Intuit after graduation.   We're looking for talented, innovative thinkers to join the IDEA team and apply your technical skills and innovative ideas to help us build data products that solve important, real-world customer problems.  Qualifications Must be currently enrolled in a degree seeking program BS or MS in Computer Science (or related degree) Strong software engineering skills, such as Agile development Solid understanding of object oriented design and programming languages Experience with at least one of the following: C#, Java, C++ Web front-end design and languages preferred (D/HTML, JavaScript, XML, Flex, CSS) Location:  Mountain View, CA Company Overview:   Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies To Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide.   Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market – from QuickBooks®, Quicken®, and TurboTax®, to GoPayment, Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.   Discover what it’s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It’s time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: http://careers.intuit.com . EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability.

description: Imagine ways to make sharing and growing the world's knowledge easier, and being able to transform these ideas into reality. As a product engineer, you will be an advocate for the Quora community and responsible for creating and polishing features to keep people fully engaged with the product. At the same time, you should feel comfortable using data to inform product decisions that would maximize impact.   Quora truly takes our mission to heart: we grow and share the world's knowledge within the product and within the company. We have a strong culture of learning from our community qualitatively and quantitatively. Our product engineers use their deep technical knowledge and cutting-edge technologies to build the product. We also have a strong sense of product and empathize with the community. Balancing these skills lets us have a large impact on the product and on the world.   Responsibilities:  Work on a product team focused on a major user-facing area of Quora. Identify high impact features that achieve goals, and be able to explain rationale for your decisions. Design and implement product and platform features at massive scale with data-driven iteration. Drive projects from ideation to production using the full technology stack. Work with designers, fellow engineers and data scientists to prototype and implement functionality and analyze impact. Work quickly and effectively on multiple projects, prioritizing effectively to ship new features and scale up existing ones. Requirements:  Passion for experimentation and new ideas. Love of both the Quora product and community. Interest in using data and user research to inform product decisions. Experience with effective A/B testing is a plus. Experience with product development at major web and mobile companies. Ability to think holistically about a complex, social product, and map big picture metrics to a realistic actionable plan. Knowledge of Python and JavaScript a plus.

description: Job Description: Performs a wide range of medical laboratory tests used to diagnose, treat and prevent disease. Using technical knowledge and a theoretical understanding of the basis of the tests, records and validates the accuracy and quality of results to ensure conformity to specifications. Understands and applies the correct control measures and protocols in cases of abnormal results, reporting any discrepancies to a Senior, Reference, or Supervising Clinical Laboratory Scientist. Calibrates assays where the calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance and records is performance. Performs simple troubleshooting and reports instrument malfunctions to senior staff. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory.  Accurately performs and completes laboratory analysis on body fluids in accordance with laboratory protocols and policies. Adheres to all safety/health and state/federal regulatory requirements and the procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Demonstrates technical proficiency in all areas of assigned responsibility. Keeps abreast of new technical developments and acquires the necessary skills to adapt to technological changes. Maintains a current understanding of all procedures used in the assigned laboratory section(s) and can interpret the significance of normal and abnormal results. Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisors. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test results to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.  Qualificiations: Minimum Qualifications: Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.  Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university  Experience: One (1) year of progressively responsible and directly related work experience  License/Certification: Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS)  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification. Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to technological changes in the laboratory Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities Ability to solve problems and identify solutions Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization Knowledge and technical proficiency in specialty areas assigned within the laboratory Knowledge of infection prevention policies and procedures Knowledge of local, state and federal regulatory requirements related to areas of functional responsibility T

description: Ascent Pharma is seeking a Manager of Biostatistics for a Well Established Pharma  ***APPLY TODAY OR REFER A FRIEND! We offer a terrific referral bonus!  Madelene Marinas/ Sr. Clinical Recruiter  Please send your resume directly to: mmarinas@ascentsg.com  Manager, Biostatistics  Palo Alto, CA  DESCRIPTION  The Manager, Biostatistics will be acting as a project-level and study-level statistician.  This role is responsible for statistical aspects of study design, for coordinating the analysis, validation, and study documentation, and for publication of data from all phases of studies.  This position will work collaboratively with clinical development, pharmacology, clinical drug supply, project management, regulatory affairs, medical affairs, medical writing and especially with data management, clinical operations, biostatistics, and clinical data analysis and will oversee the work of statistics and programming external vendors.  RESPONSIBILITIES  Provide timely and scientifically sound statistical expertise to clinical development projects.  Participate in department and cross-functional meetings to optimize clinical study designs, endpoints, and analysis strategies.  Collaborate with members of project teams to establish project timelines and to develop and implement protocols  Work closely with data management, clinical operations, clinical data analysis, and other biostatisticians to develop and validate study-specific data capture systems  Develop statistical analysis plans, coordinate and perform data analysis and validation as necessary, and provide data interpretation.  Manage CROs regarding statistical issues and activities to ensure timely delivery of analysis results. Provide guidelines and standards to CROs to ensure quality of deliverables. Participate in CRO selection process.  Attend regulatory meetings to support and defend clinical programs.  Collaborate with clinical scientists, thought leaders, and medical writers, both internally and externally, in the publication of study data.  Stay current with new developments in statistics, drug development and regulatory guidance through literature review, conference attendance, etc.  QUALIFICATIONS  MS or PhD in statistics, mathematics, or related field, with 8+ years (MS) or 4+ years (PhD) of industry experience in clinical trials.  Advanced knowledge of clinical trial design and analysis  Proficient in US drug development regulatory requirements as they relate to statistics  Experience in contributing to NDAs or BLAs  Familiarity with pharamcokinetic/pharmacodynamic data, a plus  Proficient in using SAS; knowledge of other statistical applications and programming languages a plus  Experience using CDISC SDTM and ADaM models and standards  Experience supporting publication of analysis results (e.g. abstracts, posters, manuscripts) a plus  Excellent in both oral and written communications.  PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT  Occasional mobility within office environment.  Routinely sitting for extended periods of time.  Constantly operating a computer, printer, telephone and other similar office machinery.  Work indoors in normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, fumes, vibrations and temperature changes.  Frequent computer use at workstation.  May move from one work location to another occasionally.  Responsibilities may require a work schedule that may include working outside of "normal work hours, in order to meet business demands.  Occasional public contact requiring appropriate business apparel.

description: Start your career with us today and make a big impact on healthcare! Our college recruiting program is the gateway for your entry into the exciting world of molecular diagnostics by enabling you to put your academic training and passion to work for a global company whose products impact healthcare every day.   Our Software Quality department works closely with Software Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering to ensure successful new product introductions.   As a Software Quality Engineering Intern, you will have an opportunity to gain professional experience in software testing and understand how a product gets transferred from R&D; to Manufacturing to market.   The estimated duration is 3 months in length with potential for extension as appropriate. The internship will be 40 hours a week in the summer months with the potential to go part-time while school is in session.   Responsibilities:  You will collaborate with the Software Engineers and R&D; Scientists to test new software designs, work with instruments, and suggest improvements to help assure that software quality meets FDA requirements. You will also assist in issue investigation, data analysis, and report write-ups. You will learn the fundamentals of FDA requirements for medical device testing, acquire hands-on experience with instrument manufacturing test designs and methods, and learn how to create and use data driven testing. The candidate may also work with other cross-functional groups.  Required Knowledge - Skills - and Abilities:  Currently enrolled in a college or university working towards a degree in Engineering (Biomedical, Computer Science or Bio Engineering) Completion of upper division hands-on lab coursework Proficiency with software programming using Java, C++, Python etc. Analytical/troubleshooting skills and self-motivated Willing to learn new concepts, technologies, products, and tools Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills  Preferred Qualifications:  • Junior or Senior level student preferred  • Knowledge of cloud computing  • Experience with mobile software testing   Physical Demands:  Ability to lift up to 20 pounds   Options: Apply for this job online Apply  Share  Refer this job to a friend Refer   Share on your newsfeed   Your application choices are:  Cepheid administers its personnel policies and conducts its employment practices in a manner that treats each employee and applicant for employment on the basis of merit and experience, without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), age, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, ancestry, religion, gender identity, or any other protected characteristic as established by law.   Cepheid is an E-Verify employer. E-Verify is an Internet based system operated by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in partnership with the Social Security Administration (SSA) that allows participating employers to electronically verify the employment eligibility of their newly hired employees in the United States. description: We are currently seeking a Principal Investigator to join our experienced drug discovery and development team and lead our Cardio-renal Disease Biology effort in Fremont CA. The successful candidate willspearhead the cardio-renal therapeutic strategy and lead drug discovery programs from target identification through IND-enabling studies in a matrixed organization. In support of the company?s drug discovery and development efforts, the Principal Investigator will also directly supervise a group of in vitro biologists focused on the identification and evaluation of new targets, new molecules and mechanisms involved in cardio-renal pathophysiology. Responsibilities ? Reports to the Chief Scientific Officer, has broad responsibility for the metabolic group, including senior scientific contributors, and collaborative activities. ? Responsible for leading the strategy, review, assessment, planning and execution of all activities related to our metabolic drug discovery project portfolio ? Provide a leadership role in developing relevant in vitro biochemical, cell-based and biophysical assays critical to the evaluation of compound activity, as well as assisting in the design of adequate animal models in the field of cardio-renal disorders (e.g. ESRD, CKD, mineral dysregulation, etc.). ? Assist the clinical development team in providing IND-enabling data ? Responsible for tracking group performance and driving continuous improvement. Understand how to organize group efforts, including contracted off-site scientists in order to deliver on goals. ? Ensure budget, timeline, staffing and other corporate/program goals are met ? Provide documented opinion to the executive team on new therapeutic opportunities and serve as the company liaison for collaborations with partners regarding disease area activities. Requirements ? Ph.D. in biology (or a related discipline) with a minimum of 10 years of industrial experience ? A broad knowledge and proven ability to develop in vitro assays and systems for compound evaluation in metabolic disorders (e.g. ESRD, CKD, mineral dysregulation, etc.) and a deep working knowledge of the animal models required to progress candidate molecules. ? Connections with key opinion leaders in fields relevant to the disease area is important ? Experience/knowledge in gut physiology and the role of intestinal receptorItransporters is a plus ? A commitment to high-quality research and the execution of research plans in a timely and organized manner ? Strongwritten and communication skills; and an ability to work effectively with a diverse team of co-workers in a dynamic environment At Ardelyx, you will experience an innovative and dynamic research environment. We are seeking the best in class scientists, advanced thinkers, and people who thrive on collaboration to co-create the future. You will be working with some of the industry's best scientists in a team environment focused on world class research. We offer competitive compensation and benefits and stock options. Ardelyx?, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description: Department: Translational Biology Reports to: Senior Director, Biology FLSA Status: Exempt Version: 12/23/2016 PURPOSE OF THE JOB Ardelyx is seeking a highly motivated and accomplished bioinformatics scientist to join our translational biology team focused on Cardio-Renal and GI diseases. The successful candidate will play a lead role in the design, execution, analysis and interpretation of experiments generating large genomic data-sets, including NGS data, in support of the company?s drug discovery and development efforts. This will involve utilizing both global, unbiased approaches as well as mechanistic hypothesis testing strategies to gain a detailed insight into drug target biology and drug candidate mechanism of action. In addition, systems biology approaches and pathway analysis tools will be applied to publically available and internally generated ?omic? data to interrogate human Cardio-Renal and GI disease pathogenesis and support new drug target identification, target selection, target validation and translational science strategies. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ? As a member of the translational biology team design, execute, analyze and interpret experiments generating NGS/RNAseq/proteomic data ? Communicate and present bioinformatics concepts, data and interpretations to cross-functional drug discovery teams ? Contribute to the development of translational strategies for drug discovery projects, by using bioinformatics approaches to provide a deep understanding of target biology and drug mechanism of action ? Access, curate, integrate and analyze publically available omics data-sets to provide insight into human CardioRenal and GI disease pathophysiology and enable new drug target identification. Utilize these datasets and pathway analysis tools to define predictive biomarkers of drug efficacy for multiple internal drug discovery programs. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  Education and/or Job Experience: ? Ph.D. in bioinformatics (or related discipline) with three or, M.S. in bioinformatics (or related discipline) with seven or more years of drug discovery research experience in industry. ? Alternatively, formal training in bioinformatics along with a Ph.D. in biology (or related discipline) with three or, M.S. in biology (or related discipline) with seven or more years experience of applying bioinformatics approaches to drug discovery research in industry. ? Possess broad bioinformatics experience including generation and analysis of NGS data (prior experience with Illumina platform preferred) and expertise in systems and pathway biology. ? Demonstrate a track record of using bioinformatics approaches to make biological discoveries, as evidenced by peer-reviewed publications. ? Experience in Cardio-Renal or GI disease biology is not required, but would be a distinct advantage. At Ardelyx, you will experience an innovative and dynamic research environment. We are seeking the best in class scientists, advanced thinkers, and people who thrive on collaboration to co-create the future. You will be working with some of the industry's best scientists in a team environment focused on world class research. We offer competitive compensation and benefits and stock options. Ardelyx?, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description: Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.  At Comcast Silicon Valley Innovation Center (CSV) we're changing the way America views entertainment. Literally. If you love being on the cutting edge, we would love for you to be a part of changing Comcast's history.  We're looking for a dedicated and passionate Data Scientist to join our cloud networking team. If you enjoy digging into massive data sets, finding patterns and relationships and transforming them into business insights, we'd love to speak with you. As you can imagine, millions of Comcast customers interact with our eco-system through set-top boxes, PC's, mobile apps, and devices. We are looking for someone who can aggregate and analyze all these interactions and help us drive our efforts around personalization and various new business initiatives. Your role is equal parts scientist, statistician & software developer.  We practice Agile/Scrum methodology and we program in a variety of languages such as Python, C/C++, Java & GoLang. We are building a large scale and high performance cloud based networking service platform that will deliver the next generation of Internet services across private and public networks.  Responsibilities: * Help design a Big Data Analytics pipeline (acquire - > ETL - > model - > analyze) for data from various sources (e.g. Voice, Video, Home)  * Evaluate commercial and open source offerings around Machine Learning & Analytics  * Rapidly test hypotheses by developing prototypes & running experiments  * Integrate the data pipeline into our Personalization platform  * Present and defend architectural, design, and technical choices to internal and external audiences.  * Work with a team of strong developers to turn innovative ideas into products  * Collaborate with local & remote teams (e.g. Philadelphia, DC) and break down Data Silos!  * Be current with advances in Data Science e.g. products, publications, patents, standards  * Innovate on your own ideas during our Hack Days  Desired Qualifications: * 3+ years' experience in a dedicated Data Science or similar (Big Data, Data Mining) role  * 2+ years' developing high-performance production code  * Proficiency with scripting languages  * Comcast Innovation Center fosters a dynamic and fast-paced engineering culture. So your start-up experience is a plus!  * Good understanding of modern, scalable, high availability solutions  *  Prior experience with many of the following: * Algorithms for rules engines, personalization, and analytics  * Predictive modeling  * Data mining  * Machine learning  * Graph analysis  * Data visualization  *  Familiarity with languages & tools like these: * Relational databases e.g. MySQL, Postgresql  * NoSQL databases e.g. Cassandra, Redis  * Hadoop/Pig/Hive/Hbase and related technologies  * R, Python data tools e.g. NumPy, SciPy, Pandas  * Scala, Clojure  * Open source contributions, conference presentations, patents, publications  * Management/leadership experience  About Comcast Silicon Valley  Looking for an environment with a startup vibe where your ideas affect millions of users and go from conception to deployment in a matter of days or weeks instead of months? Comcast Silicon Valley Innovation Center is hiring talented, focused and dynamic people to build a growing set of products. We are looking for people who thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional, collaborative and casual culture where passionate, skilled people let the best idea win. We offer awesome benefits including: free lunches, discounted Comcast courtesy services (yep that includes all the premium channels, Blast HSI, and home phone), and free on-site access to the Moffett Towers Fitness Club.  Core Responsibilities:  Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration  needs.  Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development, and customizes current applications. Develops software update process for existing applications. Assists in the roll-out of software releases. Trains junior Software Development Engineers on internally developed software applications. Oversees the researching, writing, and editing of documentation and technical requirements, including evaluation plans, test results,  technical manuals, and formal recommendations and reports.  Keeps current with technological developments within the industry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews  literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.  Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures, and techniques. Serves  as a guide and mentor for junior level Software Development Engineers.  Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team delivers software on time, to specification, and within budget. Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements. Displays expertise in knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, and skills and their application in the area of specified  engineering specialty.  Displays expertise in process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design, and technical choices to internal  audiences.  Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance. Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. description: Here is a learning environment like no other! At DuPont Industrial Biosciences, we are truly changing the world and having fun doing interesting science. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting; in which robust team collaboration, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks. We leverage our cutting-edge biotechnology capabilities to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy.   2016 Summer Internships at DuPont Industrial Biosciences  Palo Alto R&D; Center   DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers. We’ve developed several opportunities for students to gain the valuable experience they’ll need to succeed in today’s demanding job market. Are you interested in the scientific interfaces between biochemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation engineering, and microbial physiology leading to performance benefits in real-world industrial applications? We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   The internship project will be an experimental study of hydrolytic enzymes for potential use in industrial applications. The intern will establish and optimize methods for characterizing and screening enzyme performance based on published and internal protocols, including enzymatic activity assays, determination of hydrolysis products by HPLC, evaluating changes in substrate viscosity, etc. Enzymes with interesting attributes may be submitted to application testing for determining industrial relevance. Over the course of the project, the intern will have the opportunity to:  1. gain hands-on experience with enzymatic assays and analytical methods for biomacromolecule detection;  2. make connections between biochemical characterization of enzyme activity/specificity and enzyme performance in real-world applications;  3. learn about industrial biotechnology and work with enzymes relevant to industrial applications. We are looking for candidates who possess a good command of the undergraduate-level biochemistry, including hands-on laboratory experience with proteins and enzyme activity assays, as well as some experience with HPLC and other analytical chemistry techniques.   Job Qualifications Qualified candidates will exhibit the following characteristics:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemical Engineering or a related field Have completed your sophomore year of undergrad education and will continue your education in the fall Have the ability to work in an interdisciplinary scientific setting High level of initiative and the ability to work in a team environment Exhibit exceptional analytical instrumentation skills Exhibit exceptional bench top analytical skills Ability to document results, analyze data, draw conclusions, and communicate findings Familiarity with theoretical and practical aspects of biochemistry and enzymology Our Palo Alto R&D; Center offers an intensive 13-week science internship program, in which interns develop a science project and take part in a variety of learning activities. You won’t spend your summer in just a single department or lab – DuPont Industrial Biosciences interns get exposure to a broad range of scientific disciplines. At the end of the program you’ll deliver a presentation of your ideas and findings, developing practical real-life skills. Our interns are paid a competitive hourly rate and are responsible for their own housing and transportation for the summer.

description: -  16000586  Help protect NASA's information systems on Earth and beyond! If you are an IT Security Specialist with a desire to sharpen your skills in an enterprise environment, then check out our opportunities on our contract supporting Ames Research Center in Mountain View, CA.  ASRC Federal  Research and Technology Solutions (ARTS) is  seeking an  Information Security Analyst with Monitoring and Detection  with experience in the field of Information Security to join our growing team in supporting NASA's Security Operations Center (SOC) at Ames Research Center in Mountain View, CA. ARTS was awarded a five-year, $400 million contract to provide IT services ranging from cloud computing to network & information security, as well as application management, system administration and technology development. description: The Stanford Cancer Center is expanding its facilities to partner with the community and to support the growing need for specialized outpatient cancer care in the South Bay. Coordinated cancer care, including diagnostic, treatment and support services, will be available under one roof at the four-story, 70,000-square-foot building.   The Stanford South Bay Cancer Center will be located in the heart of Silicon Valley off of Los Gatos Boulevard in San Jose, 21 miles from the main Stanford campus. Personalized, coordinated cancer care will be delivered by Stanford and University Healthcare Alliance (UHA) physicians. UHA is a physician network and medical foundation partnered with Stanford Health Care.  The facility is scheduled to open for patient care in summer 2015.   Performs a wide range of medical laboratory tests used to diagnose, treat and prevent disease. Using technical knowledge and a theoretical understanding of the basis of the tests, records and validates the accuracy and quality of results to ensure conformity to specifications. Understands and applies the correct control measures and protocols in cases of abnormal results, reporting any discrepancies to a Senior, Reference, or Supervising Clinical Laboratory Scientist. Calibrates assays where the calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance and records is performance. Performs simple troubleshooting and reports instrument malfunctions to senior staff. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory.  Essential Functions:  Accurately performs and completes laboratory analysis on body fluids in accordance with laboratory protocols and policies.  Adheres to all safety/health and state/federal regulatory requirements and the procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals.  Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel.  Demonstrates technical proficiency in all areas of assigned responsibility. Keeps abreast of new technical developments and acquires the necessary skills to adapt to technological changes.  Maintains a current understanding of all procedures used in the assigned laboratory section(s) and can interpret the significance of normal and abnormal results.  Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease.  Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting.  Performs other duties as assigned by supervisors.  Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate.  Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test results to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.  Every day, patients facing the challenge of fighting cancer come to the Stanford Cancer Center for help, hope, and healing. Recognized for advanced clinical care, scientific research and technology breakthroughs, we are focused on finding new and better ways to fight cancer. As a National Cancer Institute designated cancer center and one of the best hospitals in America for cancer treatment according to U.S. News & World Report, the Stanford Cancer Center is at the forefront of high quality patient care.  Minimum Qualifications: Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.  Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university  Experience: One (1) year of progressively responsible and directly related work experience  License/Certification: Current CA Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS)  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:  Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results  Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing  Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to technological changes in the laboratory  Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities  Ability to solve problems and identify solutions  Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization  Knowledge and technical proficiency in specialty areas assigned within the laboratory  Knowledge of infection prevention policies and procedures  Knowledge of local, state and federal regulatory requirements related to areas of functional responsibility
jobtitle: Clinical Lab Scientist Relief (Chem/Coag/Hem) - South Bay Cancer (35732)

description: Cray Inc. is looking for a Pre-Sales Engineer to support the Americas sales account managers in promoting and selling Cray systems and storage in the high-performance computing (HPC) market and participate in driving solutions for customers there. This position could be located anywhere on the West Coast.   Responsibilities:  Bachelor's or Master's degree in engineering, or equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience in HPC Systems is required, direct experience in the HPC market a plus. Presenting Cray systems architectural benefits and features to prospective customers. Configuring Cray systems to meet customer requirements cost-effectively. Understanding and translating customer storage requirements into storage configurations. Responding to customer RFPs in a timely and efficient manner. Presenting and demonstrating Hadoop applications to prospective customers. Working with the Cray sales account managers in crafting cost-effective Cray solutions. This position will require 20 - 50% travel, depending on location and business opportunities. In-depth hardware and software knowledge and experience, especially with respect to storage systems, parallel and network file systems and Linux. Knowledge and experience with using Lustre in a HPC environment a definite plus.  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to communicate Cray products and solutions to customers effectively. Ability to design solutions that meet customer requirements and budget. The ability to complete projects on time with minimal supervision. Demonstrated ability to coordinate and collaborate with others, both internal and external to the company. Ability and willingness to develop skills in new technologies and products quickly. Success in working in a fast-paced, changing environment; strong sense of urgency. About Cray: Global supercomputing leader Cray Inc. (Nasdaq: CRAY) provides innovative systems and solutions enabling scientists and engineers in industry, academia and government to meet existing and future simulation and analytics challenges. Leveraging more than 40 years of experience in developing and servicing the world’s most advanced supercomputers, Cray offers a comprehensive portfolio of supercomputers and big data storage and analytics solutions delivering unrivaled performance, efficiency and scalability. Cray’s Adaptive Supercomputing vision is focused on delivering innovative next-generation products that integrate diverse processing technologies into a unified architecture, allowing customers to meet the market’s continued demand for realized performance. With Cray’s relaxed work environment and amazing benefits, take the initiative to join a company of dedicated innovators. Your next is now at Cray.   We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

description: VMware Horizon Remote Experience Mobility is transforming business. From the constant proliferation of mobile devices, to new mobile form factors, to applications and services that empower a workforce, engage customers and re-imagine business processes, few trends will have as big an impact in transforming the way a business operates or competes in the market.  Business Mobility is causing a fundamental shift in three key technology areas: Apps – Access to a portfolio of desktop, SaaS and mobile apps anywhere, anytime, using any device, including mobile phones and tablets, notebook computers, thin clients, MacBooks, or Chromebooks. Infrastructure – A scalable set of services, for running a variety of applications and desktops, and for the centralized management of data, security and preferences, serving end users with varied devices. Networking – The secure transmission of real-time data across NATs and over the internet, while dealing with latency and loss in a manner that does not compromise the end-user experience.  VMware Horizon provides Desktops and Applications as a Service to enterprises. More information on can be found at http://www.vmware.com/products/horizon-view/  Position: The team is looking for a Senior MTS of R&D; to provide technical expertise in L4-L7 networking in EUC Desktop. You will get to work on some of the more challenging and interesting problems building on VMware's production-proven platform. You will contribute to our next generation protocols to deliver applications and desktops from the cloud to a variety of devices. You will be able to influence all of the Networking aspects of the products.  The ideal candidate is driven, has a passion for building software with significant experience in network programming, blended with a strong systems background. The candidate must be a technical expert in dealing with real time and bulk data network protocols across varied network conditions – high bandwidth low-loss Long fat networks to low bandwidth lossy satellite networks. The candidate must have strong interpersonal and organizational skills, and be able to work closely with other junior engineers within and outside the teams that are spread geographically.  Required Skills and Background:  BS or MS in CS/EE or equivalent 5+ years’ experience in development of multi-threaded system software for networking protocols including TCP/IP and UDP protocols. Experience with designing a few layer-4 through layer-7 network protocols over IP networks and evaluating their performance in different network conditions. Hands on experience with socket programming, congestion control/error recovery mechanism & the transmission of real-time data over the internet. Strong coding and debugging skills in C and C++ with object oriented design. Cross platform development experience on Windows, Linux, OS X, iOS, or Android. Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact with engineers and management in technical forums  Highly Desired Skills:  Experience with Terminal Services protocols such as RDP or RemoteFX a strong positive Development experience with Windows internals, Windows kernel-level development, hooking Windows API calls and/ or Windows reverse engineering is highly desirable Familiarity and understanding of Public/Private cloud networking technologies. Knowledge of virtualization and application virtualization technologies would be a plus.  Responsibilities:  Provide technical expertise for the next generation networking protocol of VMware Horizon 6 and Horizon DaaS for streaming real-time and bulk data while remoting desktops and applications. Participate in all phases of software development and support including  requirements, design, coding, unit testing, debugging, network performance benchmarking and performance tuning.  Interact with technical leaders from other development team, QA, Documentation, Release Engineering to execute on product goals. Be self-motivated and proactively manage time and tasks  Why work for our Division VMware’s world-class, award-winning R&D; team is comprised of thousands of top-notch computer scientists and software engineers that are transforming computing through virtualization. Members of the R&D; team voice their creative ideas and watch them become initiatives, participate in exciting short-term and long-term products on the VMware roadmap, initiate advanced research projects, and/or write and test code that ships. At VMware, our engineers continue to learn and grow by working with top professionals from around the world and recent graduates of top universities and by taking advantage of our extensive internal training opportunities and generous external education assistance program. R&D; team members work on the latest computing equipment and have access to the ACM and IEEE libraries. VMware has R&D; offices in: Silicon Valley; Burlington, MA; Cambridge, MA; Broomfield, CO; Sofia, Bulgaria; Aarhus, Denmark; London, UK; Herzliya, Israel; Bangalore, India; and Beijing, China. Why work with our Group Mobility is transforming business. From the constant proliferation of mobile devices, to new mobile form factors, to applications and services that empower a workforce, engage customers and re-imagine business processes, few trends will have as big an impact in transforming the way a business operates or competes in the market. Business Mobility is the core of innovation for businesses today, giving organizations the power to compete more aggressively, increase the effectiveness of employees and connect with customers in ways that were previously impossible.  At VMware, we see this broader trend of Business Mobility as having far-reaching implications for how mission critical applications are built, to how desktops are architected and managed, to how entire industries build and re-build core business processes and operations.  Business Mobility is causing a fundamental shift in three key technology areas: Apps – desktop, SaaS and mobile apps are forming a new portfolio of business critical apps; accessing these apps anywhere, anytime through any device is essential to business results Infrastructure – the right infrastructure is essential to establish a new desktop architecture, for running key applications and for acting as the centrally managed data, files, security and preferences that can be delivered to a portfolio of devices Networking – the future of networking is intelligent, dynamic and secure delivering the right resources based on the needs of the application 70207BR 70207

description: Tyco (NYSE: TYC) is the world’s largest pure-play fire and security company. Tyco provides more than three million customers around the globe with the latest fire protection and security products and services. A $10+ billion company, Tyco has more than 57,000 employees in 900 locations in nearly 50 countries serving the world’s most demanding environments, including banking and financial services, oil and gas, marine, government, healthcare, retail, home security, transportation and commercial and industrial. More information on Tyco can be found at www.tyco.com.  Tyco Garage is Tyco’s advanced engineering organization in the globally recognized innovation ecosystems of Silicon Valley, Ca. and Tel Aviv, Israel. We want to fundamentally change how businesses understand and improve their safety, security and operations using technology to deliver actionable learnings and solve very interesting, real world problems.  We are a start-up like in-house innovation hub with some very smart people that are helping to lead Tyco to the forefront of sensor-based analytics and helping fulfill Tyco’s mission of zero harm to people and environment). We work in small, fast teams that drive efficient development cycles delivering iterative output and results in speedy sprints. We lead interaction and collaborations with internal and external partners and stakeholders  If you are driven by a strong sense of curiosity, urgency and passion, excited by the combination of a can do startup culture and the customer base and stability of an established company, then Tyco Garage is right for you.  Job Description  This role will lead a series of exciting new embedded vision projects in Tyco’s Advanced Engineering Center in Silicon Valley. The success in this role requires the ownership of a significant new work-stream in the team focused on solving complex computer vision problems (including, but not limited to, image representation, object recognition, and caption generation), using machine learning (particularly, deep learning methods such as convolutional neural networks) and high-performance computing (including, near real-time image analysis).   Employ the best of computer-vision research for solving problems and disrupting the current practice in face and gesture recognition, situational awareness and 3D mapping. Build and refine computer vision and machine learning algorithms that can find patterns in large multi-modal data (particularly, images and videos) Work closely with a team to develop operational prototype systems and investigate their deployment to challenging, real-world problems. Seek, develop and champion new business opportunities based around the technical capabilities of the group. Work with internal and external stakeholders to develop solutions to their requirements leveraging computer vision and machine learning capabilities. Comfort with a high degree of ambiguity and ability to solve problems that haven’t been solved to scale before are essential. Collaborate with software and hardware development teams to build robust vision-based solutions for customer-facing applications. Communicate (both oral and written) with colleagues and stakeholders (both internal and external) Review, direct, guide, inspire the research of more junior scientists in the team Above all, this role will provide a unique opportunity to enjoy state-of-the-art research and development; grow and be challenged in an entrepreneurial / start-up-like division of a large company; and create game-changing products for the security and retail markets.  Qualifications  Experience   Embedded Vision Systems – imagers, video and signal processing and analytics, object detection and recognition, event and activity recognition, content based search and retrieval, data mining, knowledge based inferencing and machine learning. Strong background in basic machine learning and statistical modeling related to embedded vision (e.g., classification, regression, and clustering including topics such as graph theory, hierarchical modeling, and Bayesian inference) and track record in integrating machine learning with real-time computing Prefer expertise and real-world experience in deep learning (convolutional neural networks, restricted Boltzmann machines, and deep neural networks). Experience in employing machine learning in a commercial/business setting – in collaboration with product (back-end and front-end) development teams.  Qualifications   PhD or Masters in the field of computer vision, image and video processing, machine learning (or related field) 5+ years of experience and a track record of successful applications of embedded vision technologies, creating novel algorithms and developing practical solutions to complex problems. Strong communication and collaboration skills Proficiency in signal processing and some of the programming languages such as C/C++, python, R, Java and/or matlab  Job  :  Engineering  Organization  :  Tyco HQ - Enterprise Software  Primary Location  :  United States-California-San Jose  Job Posting  :  Mar 8, 2016, 2:58:48 PM  Shift  :  Day Job  EEO/AA/Female/Minority/Veteran/Disability Employer

description: The Radiological Sciences Laboratory ( http://med.stanford.edu/rsl.html ) in Stanford University’s Department of Radiology invites applications for a faculty appointment at open rank in the University Tenure Line or Research Line track. The predominant criterion for appointment in the University Tenure Line is a major commitment to research and teaching. The major criterion for appointment for faculty in the Research Line is evidence of high-level performance as a researcher for whose special knowledge a programmatic need exists.   We are seeking energetic and visionary individuals with a doctoral degree in an engineering or science discipline who have demonstrated or provide clear evidence for their potential to develop diagnostic and therapeutic imaging methods at the cutting edge of basic and clinical medicine, with eventual translation to improved healthcare. Ideal candidates will fuse engineering and the physical sciences with biology and medicine to promote scientific discovery and the invention of new imaging technologies or therapies, with an emphasis on X-ray and/or CT-based modalities. However, especially strong candidates in any area of radiological imaging will be considered. The RSL comprises nine faculty focused on X-ray/CT acquisition, reconstruction and analysis methods, magnetic resonance imaging, and ultrasound imaging/therapy delivery.   A strong commitment to graduate teaching is desired, and the supervision of doctoral students and academic advising of trainees at all levels is expected. Ideal candidates should demonstrate strong communication, teaching, and leadership skills, as well as an ability to actively contribute to our rapidly growing Radiology department at Stanford.   Comprehensive research imaging facilities available include X-ray/CT laboratories, ultrasound laboratories, three 3T MRIs (one PET/MR including a 13C hyperpolarizer), one 7T human MRI scanners, and a small animal imaging facility. The RSL has very strong ties to the Department’s three other basic science sections, the Molecular Imaging Program ( http://mips.stanford.edu ), Integrative Biomedical Imaging Informatics at Stanford ( http://ibiis.stanford.edu ), and Canary Center at Stanford for Cancer Early Detection ( http://canarycenter.stanford.edu ), and collaborates with scientists and clinicians in the department and many other School of Medicine and School of Engineering departments, which facilitates technology translation and provides a rich intellectual environment.   Applications will be accepted only through the quick link at: http://radiology.stanford.edu , and will continue to be accepted until the position is filled. Applications should include a brief research plan, a detailed C.V. including a publications list, and the names and addresses of at least five references. We note parallel, related searches ongoing at Stanford including those in Bioengineering and Chem-H. For candidates who are qualified and interested in multiple faculty searches at Stanford, we encourage them to apply to those searches as well, and we will coordinate our search with others and consider joint appointments. Successful applicants may benefit from collaborative opportunities at interdisciplinary institutes and centers, including for example Bio-X ( biox.stanford.edu ), Stanford Neuroscience Institute ( neuroscience.stanford.edu ), SLAC ( slac.stanford.edu ), and the newly developed Biomedical Data Science Initiative ( med.stanford.edu/bdsi.html ).   Stanford University is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to increasing the diversity of its faculty. It welcomes nominations of and applications from women, members of minority groups, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities, as well as from others who would bring additional dimensions to the university’s research, teaching and clinical missions.
jobtitle: Faculty Position in Radiological Sciences Laboratory at Stanford University

description: Position : Senior Research Scientist Location : Milpitas, CA Duration : Full time  Job Description :Business Unit: The Film and Scatterometry Technology (FaST) Division provides industry leading metrology solutions for worldwide semiconductor IC manufacturers. The FaST Division portfolio of metrology products includes hardware and software solutions for optical film thickness, optical critical dimension (CD), composition, and resistivity measurement systems. These products are essential for the IC manufacturers as they provide critical metrology capabilities for the development and implementation of their advanced IC processes. The FaST division is committed to support our customers to achieve performance entitlement of our solution and we effectively partner with our customers from their early research and development phase to the high volume in-line manufacturing implementation specific for their process needs. The division consists of a global team located in US, Israel, China, and India.  Responsibilities: 1) Work within a small group of dedicated individuals to develop and improve an application that is at the core of physical modeling capabilities of a line of semiconductor film measurement systems. 2) Work on problems that influence the design and success of current products or addresses broad design issues of future products or technologies. Tasks include developing problem statements, analysis of various solutions, implementing solutions at software level, testing prototypes, and supporting integration into product software. 3) The responsibilities include development of new numeric methods and algorithms for data processing, physical optical modeling and numeric regression, implementing the algorithms in C++, supporting other groups in adopting new features and participate in troubleshooting.  Preferred Qualifications: 1) Proven ability to solve complex and challenging physics or engineering problems in academic or industrial setting 2) 5+ years of experience in C++ and object oriented design; 3) Ability to work with other scientists and engineers to develop problem statements, requirements and solutions; 4) Experience in any of the following areas: computational physics, scientific programming, numeric methods, algorithm design, and data processing; 5) Background in physical optics or metrology is a plus.  Minimum Qualifications: Doctorate (Academic) Level Degree in Physics, Computational Physics or Applied Mathematics with at least 4 years of experience OR Master's Level Degree with at least 8 years of experience.  Kindly send your resume to  KLA-Tencor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

description: Here is a learning environment like no other! At DuPont Industrial Biosciences, we are truly changing the world and having fun doing interesting science. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting; in which robust team collaboration, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks. We leverage our cutting-edge biotechnology capabilities to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy.   2016 Summer Internships at DuPont Industrial Biosciences  Palo Alto R&D; Center   DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers. We’ve developed several opportunities for students to gain the valuable experience they’ll need to succeed in today’s demanding job market. Are you interested in the scientific interfaces between biochemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation engineering, and microbial physiology leading to performance benefits in real-world industrial applications? We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   For this internship, we are looking for an independent, motivated and creative summer intern to investigate the interaction of proteins, and assess protein stability factors. This internship will focus on the use of dynamic light scattering to predict protein solubility; supported by other analytical techniques (e.g. UV and fluorescence spectroscopy, IEF-capillary electrophoresis, and enzymatic activity assays). The ideal candidate will be pursuing a degree in analytical chemistry, biochemistry, or related life sciences and be familiar with the basics of protein chemistry and enzymology. The intern must be an individual who is meticulous, friendly, and who can work in a highly collaborative environment.   Job Qualifications Qualified candidates will exhibit the following characteristics:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemical Engineering or a related field Have completed your sophomore year of undergrad education and will continue your education in the fall Have the ability to work in an interdisciplinary scientific setting High level of initiative and the ability to work in a team environment Exhibit exceptional analytical instrumentation skills Exhibit exceptional bench top analytical skills Ability to document results, analyze data, draw conclusions, and communicate findings Familiarity with theoretical and practical aspects of biochemistry and enzymology Our Palo Alto R&D; Center offers an intensive 13-week science internship program, in which interns develop a science project and take part in a variety of learning activities. You won’t spend your summer in just a single department or lab – DuPont Industrial Biosciences interns get exposure to a broad range of scientific disciplines. At the end of the program you’ll deliver a presentation of your ideas and findings, developing practical real-life skills. Our interns are paid a competitive hourly rate and are responsible for their own housing and transportation for the summer.
jobtitle: Summer Internship: Predicting Protein Solubility and Stability with Dynamic Light Scattering
